The funding she receives will be used to purchase a new cow. Searching for grass for cattle to graze on is usually the job of men, but Ni Nengah Purnami says she is already used to doing it and wants to take care of her cattle. Every morning at 6AM she brings grass for her cattle that she has prepared the evening before. In the afternoons and evenings she goes out 2 times to search for new grazing land and to harvest food for her cattle. She does this hard work to ensure her cattle and the cow she wants to purchase will be in the best health possible. Luckily there is always fresh feed available in the fields. During the farming season cattle are often used to help plow the farm fields in the community. The profit she makes from her business is used to help improve the life of her family. Besides renting out her cattle for use in the fields, she also prepares them for breeding so she can sell the calves or raise them for renting out to use in the fields.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Menjadi peternak sapi adalah suatu kegiatan yang tidak pernah ditinggalkan bagi Ni Nengah Purnami semenjak menikah dengan Putu Merta. Melalui organisasi didesanya, Ni Nengah Purnami mendapat kepercayaan dan akhirnya mendapatkan dana pinjaman dari yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut diperguanakan untuk membeli satu ekor induk sapi. Pada umumnya, mencari rumput untuk paka sapi adalah pekerjaan yang sering dilakukan untuk seorang laki-laki. Bagi Ni Nengah Purnami itu adalah suatu pekerjaan yang sudah biasa dilakukannya. Setiap hari, mulai pukul 06.00 pagi, Ni Nengah Purnami memberi makan rumput yang sudah dipersiapkan kemarin sorenya. Sedang untuk siang hari dibiarkan di kebunnya untuk mencari makan sendiri. Menjelang malam hari, pukul 06.00 sore, diberi makan sekali lagi. Kegiatan ini dilakukan dengan harapan sapinya yang baru dibelinya tetap sehat. Persediaan pakan hijauan selalu tersedia dikebunnya. Pada musim tanam padi seringkali sapinya didisewa untuk membajak sawah oleh masyarakat sekitarnya. Penghasilan ini bisa untuk membantu dan menambah pendapatan bagi keluarganya. Selain dipakai untuk membajak, sapinya juga dipersiapkan untuk calon induk agar untuk kedepannya dapat menghasilkan anak sapi untuk dijual kembali atau untuk dikembangbiakkan.

loans.use: to purchase a breeding cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sukepen

texts.id:
The skills to craft Canang Sari and Banten (Hindu religious offering/articles) have been passed down from Ni Ketut Sukepen’s parents. Besides crafting them for her own use, she also provide the offering for some great Hindu ceremony, such as Odalan (Great ceremony to show gratitude to God), Otonan (baby birth family ceremony), and Ngaben (burial ceremony with means of fire). For those ceremony the production cost is high. Ni Ketut Sukepen even has to add worker to help her meeting the time whom she pays per diem. Through her village organization, she receives loan from Dinari foundation. She uses the loan to buy raw material. Almost everyday she buys variety of flowers and coconut leaves in the market. The daily cost of crafting Canang Sari is Rp. 50.000 (US$5) and get net income for Rp. 20.000 (US$2). From the business Ni Ketut Sukepen can help her husband, komang Tersen, who works as construction worker.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada, Kiva Volunteer.

Ketrampilan membuat Canang Sari dan Banten ( sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu ) sudah diperoleh dari orang tuanya yang juga adalah seorang penjual Canang Sari. Selain membuat Canang Sari untuk sarana sembahyangan setiap hari, Ni Ketut Sukepen membuat dan melayani untuk sarana sembahyangan besar seperti Odalan ( upacara adat skala besar untuk bersyukur kepada Tuhan ), Otonan ( upacara keluarga untuk menyambut kelahiran seorang bayi ) dan Ngaben ( upacara bakar mayat ). Untuk persembahyangan skala besar biasanya memerlukan biaya cukup banyak. Bahkan untuk mempercepat waktu pembuatan, Ni Ketut Sukepen harus menambah beberapa orang untuk membantu pekerjaannya agar selesai tepat waktu dan tenaga kerja ini dibayar secara harian.

Melalui oraganisasi yang ada didesanya, Ni Ketut Sukepen mendapat modal pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari. Modal ini sangat dibutuhkan untuk menunjang usahanya. Modal inidipergunakan untuk memenuhi dan melengkapi bahan baku. Hampir setiap hari Ni Ketut Sukepen membeli aneka macam bunga, janur di pasar untuk keperluan usahanya. Pengeluaran untuk usaha Canang Sari dalam satu hari mencapai Rp.50.000,- dan memperoleh pendapatan bersih sekitar Rp. 20.000,- .dari usaha inilah Ni Ketut Sukepen dapat membantu menambah pendapatan suaminya, Komang Tersen, yang berprofesi sebagai tukang bangunan.

loans.use: To buy raw material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Putu Wirati

texts.id:
Even though her husband has a regular income, Ni Putu Wirati cannot only depend on her husband's income. At home, Ni Putu Wirati opens a small kiosk that sells various kind of staples for the neighbourhood. She sells staples such as rice, eggs, various kind of snacks, soaps, etc. She has run this business since she was married to I Nengah Suarba. Through the non-profit organization in her village, Ni Putu Wirarti got a loan from DINARI. She used the loan to buy more merchandise so that the kiosk has more varieties of merchandise. The kiosk opens in the morning at 6am until 7pm. After finishing the work in the kiosk, Ni Putu Wirati continues her housework at home, such as cooking, cleaning and preparing for her 2 children who studies in elementary school. Her net profit is about Rp. 20,000 to Rp. 30,000 per day. Thanks to the profit, Ni Putu can learn to become more independent and to not always depend on her husband's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun suaminya mempuinyai penghasilan tetap, namun Ni Putu Wirati tetap tidak hanya mengandalkan pekerjaan suaminya. Dirumahnya, Ni Putu Wirati membuka warung kecil yang menjual berbagai macam keperluan sehari-hari yang sangat diperlukan bagi masyarakat disekitarnya. Barang barang yang dijual adalah kebutuhan pokok seperti, beras, telor, aneka makanan ringan, sabun mandi, sabun mandi dan lain-lain . Usaha ini sudah dijalani sejak menikah dengan I Nengah Suarba, suaminya. Melalui organisasi yang ada didesanya Ni Putu Wirati mendapat kepercayaan dan mendapatkan dana pinjaman dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipergunakan untuk menambah dan melengkapi segala keperluan yang belum ada sehinga warung semakin lengkap dan lebih bervariasi barang dagangannya. Warungnya dibuka pagi hari mulai pada puku 6.00 wita dan tutup pada sore hari pukul 7.00 wita Setelah selesai membuka warung, Ni Putu Wirati kembali meneruskan pekerjaan untuk keluarganya yaitu, memasak, mencuci dan mempersipakan keperluan kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah tingkat dasar. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat mencapai Rp.20.000,- s/d Rp.30.000,- dalam sehari. Dari keuntungan inilah Ni Putu Wirati dapat belajar mandiri dan tidak selalu mengandalkan pendapatan dari pekerjaan suaminya.

loans.use: To add more capital to buy more varieties of merchandise for the kiosk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sayu Komang Artamiat

texts.id:
Sayu Komang Artamiati is a housewife who diligently assists her husband to earn additional income to meet the family daily needs. She makes several kinds of traditional snacks such as fried banana and others to be sold in a local school canteen.

She gets a reference from a local organization in her village to get a loan from Dinari. The money will be used to add the variety of the merchandise at the local school canteen. With a daily cost of IDR 200 thousand, she can earn net profit up to IDR 30 thousand (around USD 3.3) which is very important for her as she can help in meeting her family daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sayu Komang Artamiati adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang senantiasa tekun menjalani usahanya. Penghasilan suaminya terkadang tidak mencukupi keperluan hidup keluarga. Untuk menambah dan mencukupi keperluan hidup keluarga Sayu Komang Artamiati menitipkan barang dagangan hasil buatannya sendiri di kantin sekolah. Barang barang yang yang jual seperti aneka makanan ringan buatan sendiri seperti pisang goreng dan aneka jajanan tradisional. Melalui organisasi yang ada didesanya Sayu Komang Artamiati mendapat kepercayaan dan mendapatkan dana dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipergunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya yaitu menambah variasi barang dagangannya yang ada di kantin sekolah. Modal yang dikeluarkan dalam sehari Rp. 200.000,- dapat mendapatkan keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp. 25.000,- s/d Rp. 30.000,-. Dari tambahan penghasilan harian ini, Sayu Komang Artamiati dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya dan dapat mencukupi kebutuhan kedua orang anaknya.

loans.use: To add merchandise for her stall (Membeli barang dagangan seperti makanan dan minuman ringan untuk melengkapi warungnya)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz is a low-income, vulnerable man. He is 22 years old and lives with his parents in a village near Saatli, in the central part of the Azerbaijan Republic. Araz has a herd of cattle. He started his business five years ago with one cow and has increased the number of cattle in the herd to five. He has applied for a $500 loan through the Normicro Saatli branch, which he plans to use to build a shed for his cattle.

loans.use: To build a shed for his herd of cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is low-income, vulnerable man. He is 25 years old and lives with his parents in a village near Saatli, in the central part of the Azerbaijan Republic. Kamal has a herd of five cows. He started his business five years ago when he bought his first cow with money he had saved up.

He purchases young calves, breeds them, and then sells them in the city market. The business is profitable, but requires investment from time to time. Kamal plans to increase the number of animals in the herd and has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a $500 loan. He hopes to successfully collaborate with Normicro and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy calves and increase the size of his herd

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Назиров Акбар житель района Файзабад.Возраст 45 лет. Женат имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается откормкой и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков на рынке , откармливает около 40-45 дней. За это время бычки подрастают .Затем клиент продает их на тех же рынках по выгодной ему цене.  И так каждые 50 дней.Основными покупателями клиента являются мясники , которые скупают бычков на мясо, что позволяет обеспечить население свежим и полноценным мясом. Опыт работы в этой сфере у клиента около 5 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить свой оборот , путем покупки нового бычка.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Akbar N. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a High School education. He is in the business or raising and selling cattle. He purchases young calves on the market and raises them for 40-45 days. During this time period the calves grow bigger. Akbar sells the grown calves on the market at a profit. This cycle repeats every 50 days. Akbar's main clients are local butchers that purchase the animals for sale as meat. In this manner Akbar's business provides fresh and wholesome meat to the local population. He has about 5 years experience working in this business. The business is the main source of income for his family. He plans to use the money from the loan in order to be able to increase turnover by buying an additional calf. He plan's to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Назиров Акбар житель района Файзабад.Возраст 45 лет. Женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается откормкой и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков на рынке , откармливает около 40-45 дней. За это время бычки подрастают .Затем клиент продает их на тех же рынках по выгодной ему цене. И так каждые 50 дней.Основными покупателями клиента являются мясники , которые скупают бычков на мясо, что позволяет обеспечить население свежим и полноценным мясом. Опыт работы в этой сфере у клиента около 5 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить свой оборот , путем покупки нового бычка.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj is a 37-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. She breeds cattle together with her husband (shown in picture). They have been in this business for 20 years.

Sevinj raises calves and sells them at the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. Cattle breeding is traditional in the region, where there are no other jobs. Sevinj wants to increase her family's herd. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $600.

loans.use: To buy calves for her family's cattle-breeding business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en: I am a mother of six: four boys and two girls. I operate a boutique in which I sell embroidered clothes. I have a forte at my work and I create very unique and beautiful clothes. The boutique generates decent profits for me.  I would like to borrow in a group of few other women all of whom are my neighbors and play an important role to get incomes for their families.  Rukkiah B. plans to invest loan in her grocery store. Naseem B. will buy a donkey cart with her share of loan. Saeeda B. needs loan to expand her stitching business.

loans.use: Improve and expand boutique

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.ru:
Nematullo R. Ismatovich lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 41 years old, is married and has 6 children. He has a college degree. He is a High School teacher by profession. He is in the business of raising cattle. He purchases calves on the market, raises them for a period of 40-45 days and them resells them on the market. This cycle repeats every 50 days. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. He plans to use the money from the loan to purchase and additional calf. He plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Раджабов Неъматулло Исматович проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст 41 год. Женат имеет 6 детей.Образование высшее. По профессии учитель средней школы. Занимается животноводством. Скупает бычков на рынке откармливает около 40 -45 дней , а затем продает на тех же рынках.И так каждые 50 дней. Работает клиент в этой сфере уже около 3 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить дополнительного бычка. Погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Sokhoeun is a widow with four children -- one son and three daughters. Two of her daughters work in a garment factory and the other two children study at the local school.

Sokhoeun grows rice and sells desserts in her village. She and her children live in an old house along national road number five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $400. She will use this money to add to her own money for repairing her house.

loans.use: For repairing her house

loans.name: Mengsroeun

texts.en:
Mr. C. Mengsroeun and his wife, Mrs. Lay Eng, have been married since 1999. They have two children -- one son and one daughter. Their daughter is studying at the local school, and the son is still young and stays home.

Mengsroeun and his wife have been in the business of selling groceries and fruit since 2000. They buy them at the market in Phnom Penh to sell in their shop in the village market.

Mengsroeun and his family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He hopes that his business will be able to support his children as they study at a high level and can be used to build a new house.

Mengsroeun is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,000 from MAXIMA. He will use this money to purchase grocery items and fruit for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for reselling.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Miss N. Sreymom is single and lives with her old parents. She has four sisters, two of whom are married and live in separate houses. The other two sisters weave silk at home.

Her family has three looms, including hers. She started her business weaving silk in 2000. It’s a skill she learned from her sister.

Sreymom and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sreymom is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 from MAXIMA. She will use this money to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Nat and his wife (both seen in this picture) have been married since 1996. They have two children -- one son and one daughter. Their daughter is studying at the local school and the son is still young and stays at home.

Nat has run Motor Remoque taxi for many years. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh.

He also fishes at the lake near his house for fish to sell and has been growing rice since 1987. His wife is a garment factory worker.

Nat and his family live along national road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

He is requesting his third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. He will use this money for repairing his house and growing rice.

loans.use: For growing rice and repairing his house

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Sona and her husband have been married since 2002 and have one daughter.

Sona has been a tailor for one year. It’s a skill she learned in Phnom Penh.

Meanwhile, her husband has sold second-hand cars in Phnom Penh for nine years. Sona and her family live with her parents across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She is requesting her sixth loan in the amount of $1,000 from MAXIMA. She will use this money to purchase cloth and a machine for sewing.

loans.use: To purchasing cloth and a machine for sewing.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
A. Gulchehra is 37 years old. She is married with two children of school age.

Gulchehra sells clothing for kids. Gulchehra is purchasing the goods at wholesale prices, and afterward, she is able to make the retail prices for the goods not so high. That attracts the clients with average levels of income. The business is successful, and it has provided considerable income for the family for the last 5 years. 

Today Gulchehra requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. She plans to purchase clothing for kids for selling. Gulchehra thanks all supporting her and promises to pay in time.

loans.use: Purchasing the clothing for kids for selling

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
K. Abdurahmon is 49 years old. He and his wife have raised two children.

For more than 10 years, Abdurahmon has been running his business. He is purchasing, raising and selling the cattle. The business is the family one, as his wife helps him. Thanks to the income generated by the business, Abdurahmon was able to arrange the wedding parties for his two sons. Now Abdurahmon is planning to expand his business and purchase another 2 cows. For this purpose he requests 950.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Abdurahmon thanks all supporting him and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing 2 cows

loans.name: Maheera

texts.en: Maheera lives in the Saatli region in the village of Soltanabad. She is 42 years old. Maheera is married and has 4 children. Maheera established her business in 1995 and since then has been successfully managing it together with her husband (shown in the picture). They breed cows and then sell them to the local cattle market. Maheera wants to buy more cows and expand her business.  Maheera has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a $600 loan for a period of 12 months

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
M. Mavluda is 53 years old. She raised her children and now is living together with the family of her son.

Since 1982, Mavluda has been in her business. She embroiders the national hats. Mavluda is producing national hats of various types. She has many clients and usually there are many orders. Her daughter-in-law helps her if required. The readymade hats Mavluda sells in the local market. The business is stable, allowing Mavluda to contribute significantly to the family budget. Today Mavluda requests 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. The loan is required for purchasing the fabrics for producing and embroidering the national hats. Mavluda thanks all supporting her promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the fabrics for producing the national hats and embroidering them.

loans.name: Begmat

texts.en:
E. Begmat is 39 years old. He is married with 6 children.

Begmat is purchasing and selling cattle and calves. As a rule, he is purchasing the animals in the central market of Dushanbe city and selling them in the local market of his home city. Currently Begmat has 9 head of cattle and 15 calves. The business of Begmat is stable, allowing him to support his large family and improve their living conditions.

Today Begmat requests 2,000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase the cattle and calves in the market for further sales. Begmat thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to sell.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
B. Farhod is 25 years old. He is married with two children.

Farhod is providing taxi services with his vehicle. He has been working as a taxi driver for two years. Farhod is a very diligent young man and tries to work to make his clients happy. So today Farhod plans to install a fuel supply system working on gas. This allows him to decrease the prices for his services, as gas costs less than petrol. With this purpose he requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 18 months. This is the first loan for Farhod, and he thanks all supporting him and promises not to let you down.

loans.use: Installation of system for using the gas as the fuel for the car instead of petrol.

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
K. Komil is 65 years old. He has raised three children.

Komil is selling fruits and vegetables like onions in the market. He is very experienced and knows many secrets for how to store the fruits and vegetables so that they are fresh and do not lose their condition. The business is successful generating the main income for Komil.

Today he requests 150.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing onions for selling. Komil has been the client for IMON for many years and has a positive credit history. And today he thanks all and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase of onions for selling.

loans.name: Yuldash

texts.en:
K. Yuldash is 40 years old. He is married with three children.

Yuldash is purchasing and selling animals. He has been in the business for 20 years. Currently he has 2 donkeys that he uses for transporting hay and the fodder for animals, 1 horse that he uses for plowing the land, 10 cows, and 4 sheep. Yuldash purchases the animals in the central market of Dushanbe city and usually, one week later, is selling in the local market of his city. This stable business, generating the main income for the family, allows Yuldash improving their living conditions.

Now he requests 2,000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing the cattle and small cattle in the market for further sales. Being a loan recipient for the first time, Yuldash thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and the small cattle in the market

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
M. Gavhar is 45 years old. She is married with three children. 

Gavhar is selling clothing for kids. Having a trading place in the central market, Gavhar has got lots of clients. She tries to diversify the range of goods. Most of the goods are attractive for clients with average levels of incomes. Gavhar purchases the goods in the neighboring city. And now she is planning to travel in order to purchase clothing for kids for the spring season. For this purpose she requests 500.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Gavhar has gotten loans from IMON several times and has proved herself as a reliable client. Today she thanks everyone supporting her and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for kids for selling

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
S. Bahodur is 44 years old. He and his wife raised two children. 

Bahodur is selling DVDs and CDs. He works in the market. Bahodur orders the delivery of the disks from Russia and tries to have all new movies, concerts of popular singers, and others. The business is successful, generating the main income for the family. 

Today Bahodur requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase DVDs and CDs for selling. Bahodur thanks all supporting him and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing DVDs and CDs for selling

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
K. Muhabbat is 30 years old. She is married with four children.

Muhabbat is an entrepreneur. She is selling confectioneries like candies and sweets in the market. As a rule, she is purchasing the goods for selling in one of the markets of Dushanbe city and is selling them in the local market of her home city. The business of Muhabbat is the main source of income for her large family, and she is doing her best in order to make it stable and successful. Her husband helps Muhabbat.

Having worked for three years, Muhabbat applied for the loan for the first time. She requests 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Muhabbat thanks all supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan management.

loans.use: Purchasing confectioneries like candies and sweets in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
S. Zarrina is 24 years old. She is married with two children. 

Zarrina is selling towels and tablecloths. The trading place is located in the one of the markets. The husband of Zarrina is currently unemployed, and Zarrina has to work hard as her business is the only source of income for her family. Now Zarrina needs to increase the range of goods and purchase more towels and tablecloths for selling. For this purpose, she requests 600.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Zarrina thanks everyone for support and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchasing towels and tablecloths for selling

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
M. Saodat is 37 years old. She is married with six children. 

Saodat is an entrepreneur. She sells the confectioneries and candies and sweets. Saodat purchases the goods in the market of Dushanbe city and sells them in the local market of her home city. Saodat’s business is the main source of income for her family, and her husband is ready to help her. For 8 years the business has been successful in generating the stable income for this large family. Today Saodat requests 2,000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months. The loan shall be used for increasing the working capital required for purchasing the confectioneries for selling. Getting a loan for the first time, Saodat thanks all for supporting her and promises to be precise in loan payment.

loans.use: Increasing the confectioneries and candies for selling.

loans.name: Khairi

texts.en:
B. Khairi is 57 years old. She and her husband raised three children. 

Khairi is a market vendor. She sells socks in the local market. She has been it the business for 12 years. Now the business is the main source of income for Khairi. Her children are grown up and living independently. However, even today Khairi wants to support them and help them, and being a loving mother and grandmother, she always has in store some small gifts and sweets for her grandchildren. The business helps Khairi to feel independent. Now Khairi is planning to increase the range of goods for selling. For this she requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Being the client of IMON with a positive credit history, Khairi promises to be precise in the loan repayment and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing socks in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Bibihol

texts.en:
M. Bibihol is 30 years old. She is married with one child.

Bibihol is a seamstress. She sews the national dresses for women and girls. She has been working in the tailoring shop for the last 12 years. The fabrics required for sewing, she purchases by herself in the market. Bibihol is a very popular seamstress and has lots of orders. The business is stable, generating the considerable income for the family.

Bibihol is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting 1,000.00 Somoni (300.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months for purchasing a sewing machine. Bibihol thanks everyone supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Bimalika

texts.en: P. Bimalika is 50 years old. She and her husband have raised three children. Two sons of Bimalika are helping her in the business. She is baking the national bread, lepeshka. The family is working hard; they start baking the lepeshka from early morning so that their customers will have fresh bread in the morning. And they go to bed late in the night after making dough and preparing the firewood and coal for baking for the next day. Bimalika is selling the majority of her products just from her place. However, she also is running the a storefront in the central local market, selling the lepeshka. Thus, keeping the business stable, Bimalika helps her husband in supporting their family and allowing her sons to have the source of significant income. Now Bimalika requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase the flour wholesale that is required for her business. Bimalika is grateful for all supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour wholesale for baking the national bread, lepeshka.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
S. Mukaddas is 29 years old. She is married with two children.

Mukaddas is a market vendor. She is selling clothing for women. Being in the business for 6 years already and having a good taste, Mukaddas has managed to make her business stable and successful. Thanks to the income, Mukaddas is able to contribute considerably to the family budget and to help her husband in supporting their family and his parents. Now Mukaddas is planning to purchase new clothing for women from Kyrgyzstan, Bishkek. For this she needs additional funding. She requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Being a client of IMON for several years and having a positive credit history, Mukaddas promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: U. Mahbuba has been running her business for several years already. She and her husband have two trading places. Both are located in the central local market. In one, Mahbuba is selling foodstuffs like candies and sweets, housewares like toothpastes and brushes, detergents and washing liquids. In the other, there is wide range of such goods as electrical house equipment like electrical kettles, ovens, heaters and housewares like plates and dishes, and tools and others. The business is the main source of income for the family. As Mahbuba as well as her husband are involved in the business, that takes lots of their time and effort. Today Mahbuba is planning to expand the business and purchase more goods, thus increasing the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 5 months. Being loaned money by IMON several times already and having proved herself as a reliable client, Mahbuba promises to pay the current loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuffs like confectioneries and sweets and home electrical equipment (appliances) in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
M. Fatima is 32 years old.  She is married with two children.

Fatima is a market vendor. She is selling such goods as chocolates, chocolate bars, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and small toys and others. The husband of Fatima is currently unemployed. Being the only breadwinner, Fatima is working hard. As any mother she is trying to ensure her kids have everything they may need, and she is dreaming to be able to pay for their higher education. Now Fatima is planning to increase the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests 1,000.00 Somoni (300.00 US Dollars) for the term of 5 months. Being the client of IMON for several years already, Fatima has proved herself as a reliable client and promises to pay the loan in time, expressing her gratitude.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs like chocolate bars, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and toys in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Twenty-eight year-old Ruth M. is married with one child, aged three.

Ruth owns a clothing business. She requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Irene S.. She is married with one child, aged five, and has one other dependent, her niece.

In 2004 Irene established a general store. She now plans to diversify her business by selling soft drinks and needs a loan to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To diversify her business by selling soft drinks, and to purchase stocks of soft drink in bulk.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat N. Rahmatulloevich lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a college degree in agronomy. He is in the business of raising cattle. He purchase calves, raises them and resells them at the market at a profit. Raising a calf takes about 40-45 days. After selling the animal he uses the obtained money to purchase new calves that he raises and resells as well. He has more than 6 years experience working in this business. This business is the main source of income for his family and therefore Karomat makes sure that it functions very well. In addition to being crucial to the wellbeing of the N. family, the business also provides local butchers and therefore local markets with affordable meat. Karomat plans to use the money from the loan to purchase another calf to raise. He plans to repay the loan in a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Нуров Каромат Рахматуллоевич житель района Файзабад. Возраст 52 года , женат имеет 6 детей. Образование высшее. По профессии Агроном. Работает в сфере животноводства. Покупает бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. Откармливает бычков около 40-45 дней.После реализации покупает новых бычков и опять продает. опыт в этой сфере около 6 лет .Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому его бизнес налажен.Кроме того он дает возможность мясникам обеспечивать рынки района мясом, по доступным ценам. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести дополнительного бычка для откормки. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Meet 29 year-old Rehema D.. She is single with one child, aged five.

In 2004 Rehema established herself as a seamstress. She now requires a loan in order to purchase material and sewing accessories, which she will use to sew new items for sale. Rehema thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase material and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Mahmadali U. Rahmanovich lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 49 years old and is married. He has a college education. He is a history teacher by profession. He works at a local school but is also in the business of raising cattle. He purchases young calves, raises them and in 45 days resells them on the local market. This business is the only source of income for his family. He plans to use the money from the loan to purchase a calf, which will allow him to increase turnover. He plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Умаров Махмадали Рахмонович житель района Файзабад . Возраст 49 лет , женат .Имеет высшее образование ,по специальности преподаватель истории . Работает в местной школе учителем . Кроме того занимается животноводством .Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и через 45 дней продает их на местном рынке . Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Планирует получить кредит на покупку бычка, что позволит ему увеличить оборот . Кредит планирует погасить в течении 12 месяцев .

loans.use: purchase a calf

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Agness M.. She is married with three children, aged 11, 12, and 14, and has one other dependent, her nephew.

In 2005 Agness established a general retail business. She now requires a new loan in order to diversify her business by adding a clothing section to her shop. Agness thanks you for your support.

loans.use: For business diversification and to purchase stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Eva H.. She is married with two children, aged 7 and 12.

In 2006 Eva established a pharmacy business. Eva has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to add to her inventory of medicines. Eva thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicines at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is 54 year-old Esther M.. She is married with four children, aged between 30 and 37, and has two other dependents, her niece and nephew.

In 2002 Esther established a food stall business. Esther has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fruit, vegetables, rice, and oil in bulk. Esther thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of fruit, vegetables, rice, oil, and other stock for her food stall.

loans.name: Mahmadsolim

texts.ru:
Mahmadsolim K. Rahmonovich lives in the Varzob region. He is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a High School education with technical specialization. Mahmadsolim is a turner by profession. He is in the business of purchasing and reselling building materials. This business is currently the only source of income for his family. He wishes to use the money from the loan to purchase a larger variety of items to resell at his sales location. The building season is about to start and building materials are currently in great demand. He plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Каримов Махмадсолим Рахмонович житель Варзобского района. Возраст 33 года, женат ,имеет 4 детей.Образование средне-техническое , по специальности токарь . Занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов . В данное время это является единственным источником дохода его семьи . На кредит хочет пополнить ассортимент торговой точки , так как начинается сезон строительных работ и стройматериалы очень востребованы. Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев .

loans.use: Increase variety of goods up for sale

loans.name: Tsitsopé

texts.fr:
Tsitsopé A. (the woman dressed in a red knit top) is single and 23 years old. For two years, she has been the owner of a hair salon located adjacent to the Adeta marketplace. She professionally manages the salon and accommodates a large number of customers. With the present loan, she is thinking of buying a hair dryer and a big mirror. She is also thinking of making her salon more pleasant for more immediate customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Tsitsopé A. (femme habillée en tricot rouge)est célibataire,âgée d 23ans, propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure sis à côté du marché d’Adéta depuis deux ans. Elle gère ce salon avec professionnalisme et accueille un grand nombre de clientes. Avec le présent crédit elle pense acheter un séchoir, un grand miroir et rendre plus agréable son salon afin de satisfaire plus rapidement sa clientèle

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and a mirror to bolster her salon's business capacity

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Anna S.. She is married with four children, aged 4, 7, 10, and 14.

Anna owns a textile and catering business, and requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of material in bulk, as well as ingredients and utensils for her catering business. Anna thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and utensils for her catering business, and additional stocks of material for her textile business.

loans.name: Sodziné

texts.fr:
Sodzine Ekoué is married and the mother of three. She is 42 years old and has owned a dressmaking shop in the busy part of town for seven years. The income from this business pays for family expenses because her husband lacks a steady income. This is her second loan, now that she has promptly repaid her first. The present loan is going to enable her to acquire two extra sewing machines and to recruit apprentices in order to meet the growing customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Sodzine Ekoué est mariée, mère de trois enfants,âgée de 42ans est propriétaire d’un atelier de couture dans le quartier populaire de la ville depuis 7 ans. Le revenu de cette activité finance les charges familiales du fait que le revenu de son mari est irrégulier .Elle à son deuxième crédit après avoir payé promptement son premier crédit. Le présent crédit va lui permettre d’acquérir deux machines à coudre supplémentaires et recruter des apprenties afin de faire face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle

loans.use: To acquire two sewing machines and to bolster her dressmaking shop

loans.name: Gladness

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Gladness Machocho. She is married with three children, aged 2, 15, and 17, and has two other dependents, who are her nieces.

In 2002 Gladness established a poultry and clothing business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell, as well as stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may have read about kuku many times. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital, you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. There are probably hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow!

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks as well as stocks of clothing.

loans.name: Saifiddin

texts.ru:
Saifiddin Imirzoevich B., 41, lives in Varzob district with his wife and four children. He has a higher education and is a qualified college instructor. However, currently he doesn't work in his field and is making a living in agriculture. He has a plot of land where he plants wheat. He is applying for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and wheat seeds. Since prepared flour is much more expensive at the market, Saifiddin plans to make his own flour, which will supply his family for one year. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Бобиев Сайфиддин lМирзоевич житель района Варзоб .Возраст 41 год, женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее ,по специальности преподаватель . В данное время по специальности не работает, занимается сельским хозяйством . Имеет участок земли, где сеет пшеницу . На кредит планирует закупить минеральные удобрения и семена пшеницы . Так как готовая мука на рынке стоит намного дороже ,Сайфулло планирует обеспечить мукой свою семью на год .Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев .

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dadzo

texts.fr:
Dadzo D. (the woman with her hand on the sandalettes) is 43 years old, married, and the mother of three. Her husband is inactive, and she provides for the family by the income that she earns from selling sandalettes (flip-flops) at the Adeta marketplace and surrounding villages. With the present loan, she is going to increase her inventory in order to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mme Dadzo D. (femme ayan posé ses mains sur les sandalettes) est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants . Son mari est inactif et elle subvient aux besoins de la famille Par le revenu qu’elle tire de la vente des sandalettes au marché d’Adéta et dans ses villages environnants. Avec le présent emprunt elle va augmenter son stock afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy flip-flops in Lomé and resell them in Adéta

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Meet 36 year-old Salama A.. She is married with four children, aged 3, 7, 8, and 10.

In 2007 Salama established a general store. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. Salama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.en: Ms. Ayaba K. is 43 years old and the married mother of 1 child who is enrolled in school.  To provide for her family Ayaba sells ‘sandelettes,’or flip-flops, and plastic containers in a small boutique located in the central market Adéta.  These comfortable and inexpensive shoes and reliable, useful containers are very popular among Togolese and are always in demand.  Ayaba is requesting this loan for two reasons: first, she would like to build a display for her merchandise to attract more customers and second, she hopes to buy more flip-flops and containers to increase the size of her business. She hopes that by increasing her commercial activity she can respond to the needs of her family and can continue to participate in the development of her community.

loans.use: To build a display for her merchandise (flip flops and plastic containers) and to increase her inventory

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
This is 57 year-old Neema K.. She is married with four children, aged between 20 and 37.

In 2007 Neema established a general store, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Upendo M.. She is married with four children, aged between 13 and 24.

In 2006 Upendo established a grain business. Upendo has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, maize, and beans in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, maize, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Jurabek Bobokalanovich G., 41, lives in Varzob district with his wife and three children. He has a techinal college education; by training he is a cinema engineer. However, he doesn't work in this field. Jurabek has a private livestock business. He buys cattle at the district market and then re-sells them at the country markets for better prices. Jurabek has about ten years of experience in this business. Because it is the main source of income for his family, Jurabek has fine-tuned his business for maximum success. He is applying for a loan to increase turnover. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Гафуров Джурабек Бобокалонович житель района Варзоб . Возраст 41 год, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование средне-техническое. По профессии кинотехник. Не работает по специальности. Занимается частным предпринимательством в сфере животноводства. покупает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот. Покупает на районном рынке и перепродает на рынке в кишлаке по более выгодной цене. Опыт в данной сфере около 10 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому его бизнес налажен очень хорошо.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzo Daké is a married mother of four children. She is 38 years old and has owned a roadside restaurant for the past seven years. The income she earns from this business helps her take care of her dependents. This loan will enable her to improve the structure and environment of her restaurant in order to better accomodate her customers.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva translator

Mme Adzo Daké est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est âgée de 38 ans et est propriétaire d’un restaurant sis au bord de la route pour la consommation populaire Depuis 7 ans. Le revenu de son activité participe aux charges de familles. Le présent crédit va lui permettre de construire un cadre plus agréable afin de mieux accueillir Sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of corn and 3 bags of sugar for the production of juice

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Fatuma K.. She is married with two children, aged 9 and 13.

In 2007 Fatuma established a clothing business. Fatuma has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
Ulugbek Hamidovich B., 34, lives in Varzob district with his wife and two children. He has a higher education; he was trained as an engineer. He works as a builder at construction sites. Ulugbek also raises animals as a side business. He buys calves at the Varzob markets, fattens them over 40-45 days, and then sells them back at the same markets. Afterwards, he repeats the cycle of buying, fattening and re-selling calves. Ulugbek has five years experience in this business. He is applying for a loan to buy another calf and increase his turnover. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Бобомуродов Улугбек Хамидович житель района Варзоб. Возраст34 года. Женат имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее. По специальности инженер. Работает строителем на стройке. Так же занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков на рынке Варзоба , откармливает около 40-45 дней ,а затем перепродает на тех же рынках. После продажи начинает снова покупать бычков и перепродавать.Опыт работы в этой сфере около 5 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одного бычка тем самым увеличив свой товарооборот.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. D. Kokou is 39 years old, a father of two children and is owner of a watch repair shop. He has owned this business for 8 years. This activity helps him earn a modest incomes that enables him to provide for the needs of his family. This credit will help him acquire modern tools for the repair of watches and also to secure his workshop by making and installing safety bars.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr D. Kokou est âgé de 39 ans, père de deux enfants et est propriétaire d’un atelier de réparation de montres. Il exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans . Cette activité lui procure des revenus modestes sui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Le présent crédit va lui permettre d’acquérir les outils modernes de réparation de montres et de rendre plus sécuriser son atelier par la fabrication des grilles de sécurité.

loans.use: Purchase of various materials for watch repairs

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr:
Mr. Dieudonné Gamelé is 26 years old, single, and has owned a motorcycle repair garage for three years. With this credit he would like to build his workshop by purchasing new materials for motocycle repair. This will allow him to be well equipped for his work.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Dieudonné Gamelé est agé de 26 ans , célibataire et propriétaire d’un garage de réparation des motos à deux roues depuis trois ans. Avec le présent crédit il pense renforcer son atelier par l’acquisition de nouveaux matériels de réparation afin d’être à la hauteur de sa tâche.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle repair materials to improve the services provided

loans.name: Temur

texts.ru:
Temur Gafur, 35, lives in Varzob district. He is married with one child. Temur has a higher education; he was trained as an architect. He now works at building sites. Aside from this, he also raises poultry. He has a big hen house where he breeds chickens, selling the eggs to wholesalers. This business brings additional income to his family and supplies the markets of Varzob with fresh, home-raised eggs. Temur has been involved in this business for about six years. He is applying for a loan to buy more chickens. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Гафуров Тимур проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 35 лет. Женат имеет 1 ребенка. Образование высшее. По специальности архитектор. Работает на стройке строителем по найму. Кроме того занимается птицеводством. Имеет большой курятник где разводит птиц. Продает яица оптовым реализаторам. Данный бизнес дает дополнительный доход его семье и кроме того позволяет обеспечить рынки Варзоба свежими , домашними яицами. Занимается этим видом деятельности около 6 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы закупить новых курей.Погаситькредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en: I am Sajida H. from Kot Radha Kishan, a small green town in Pakistan. I am married and my husband is a constructor. I mostly do my household chores and to better utilize my free time I have decided to buy a dairy cow. This will help me to increase our household income. I am a group leader of few other women who are: Razia A. and Nasreen S. both are acquiring for their husbands who sell bricks. Gulistan B. will invest her share of loan in her family’s restaurant. I completely trust these women and request you to give us loans immediately.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Afivi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afivi Gbéka is 46 years old, a widow and a mother of five children. She has been selling sandals for 8 years. She buys sandals wholesale in Lomé and individually resells them at the local markets. Thanks to this small business, she manages to take care of her family's needs. This loan will enable her to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Afivi Gbéka est âgée de 46 ans , veuve et mère de 5 enfants .Elle exerce le commerce des sandalettes depuis 8 ans . Elle achète ses sandalettes en gros à Lomé pour les revendre en détail dans les marchés locaux .Avec cette activité elle arrive à faire face aux charges de sa famille. Le présent crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son stock

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of sandals in Lomé and individual resale

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en: I am a mother of four: one boy and three girls. All of my kids attend school except two girls who are not of school going age yet. My husband trades used items. He collects these items from various factories and farms and then supplies them to a used items warehouse. He started this business three years ago by acquiring a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. My financial condition over this period have grown much better. I am a group leader of following women: Shahnaz R. is borrowing to buy a cow. Sakina B.’s husband wants to start a tea stall. Zareena A. will invest her share of loan to start a restaurant. Rasheeda B. is also borrowing for her tea stall. Rasheeda S.’s husband sells bricks.

loans.use: Expand used items business

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en: I am Zeenat H. from a small lush green town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I am a mother of five: three boys and two girls.  Currently two of my boys work at a local factory whereas the younger ones attend a nearby school. My husband works at a brick furnace and I run a grocery store, I also sell milk from my house. Currently, I want to buy an additional cow. I am a loan member at Asasah , a microfinance institution in Pakistan for last four years. With the profits from the earlier loans I managed to marry my daughter last year. My group members who also require loans are:  Zareena B. ,Rashida B., Rasheedan B. and Haneefa B. all these women want to buy  dairy cows for their milk  business .  These women are very responsible and have always repaid their loans in time.

loans.use: Buy a tractor

loans.name: Essinu

texts.fr:
Mrs Essinu K. (the woman in the straw hat) is 48 years old, married and mother of five (05) children. She makes local juice which she sells every day at the bus stop in Adéta. The revenue drawn from this business, which she has been working at for 10 years, helps to contribute to the needs of her family. She has her third loan, which she always pays. This current loan will allow her to build a shop to protect her from the sun and reserve a welcome for her clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Essinu K.(femme portant le chapeau en raffia) est âgée de 48 ans , mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle fabrique Du jus local qu’elle vend tous les jours à la gare routière d’Adéta. Le revenu tiré de cette activité qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans sert à contribuer aux charges de sa famille. Elle à son troisième crédit qu’elle toujours paye. Le présent prêt lui permettra de construire un local Pour se protéger contre le soleil et réservé un accueil à sa clientel.

loans.use: Construction of a shop to improve the scale of her juice bar

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat B., 25, is married with two children. She has a secondary school education. Nazokat does not work outside the home, but raises milk cows as a side business. She uses the milk for her own family and also sells to retailers. Nazokat has been involved in this business for about five years. She is applying for a loan to purchase another milk cow. This will increase the volume of milk produced, increasing her income. Additionally, Nazokat's business supplies the local markets with fresh milk. She plans to repay her loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Боболиева Назокат 25 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. занимается животноводством. Разводит коров для того чтобы получать молоко. Получаемое молоко использует для семьи и на продажу. продает молоко розничным реализаторам.Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 5 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одну дойную корову. Это даст возможность увеличить объем получаемой продукции, тем самым увеличив доход. Кроме того ее бизнес позволяет обеспечить рынки свежим молоком.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en: My name is Ayesha J. from KRK, Pakistan. This is my birth town and I have spent all my life here in Kot Radha Kishan. I am married and a mother of three: two boys and one girl. Our poor family conditions did not allow us to send our kids to school. I sell milk from my house and own seven dairy cows. I want to buy an additional cow so that our income can increase. I am a group leader of few other women: Sabra B., Suriya B. ,Mahmoodan ,Saeedan B. and  Shakila B. all these women sell milk from their houses and want to buy additional cows. These women have been together for five years and have always helped each other in time of need.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr A. Kokou is 36 years old, married and father of three children. He has been the owner of a woodworking workshop for 7 years that supplies him with the majority of his income. The current loan will allow him to acquire a planning machine to improve the quality of his work.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr A. Kokou est âgé de 36 ans , marié et père de 03 enfants. Il est propriétaire d’un atelier de menuiserie depuis 7 ans qui lui procure la majorité de son revenu . Le présent crédit lui permet d’acquérir une raboteuse afin d’améliorer la qualité de son travail

loans.use: Purchase of a planning machine

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Mr D. Kossivi (standing up and dressed in red) is 35 years old, married and father of four (04) children. He has been the owner of a woodworking workshop for the last 5 years. With this loan he is thinking of acquiring three electric saws to improve service.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr D. Kossivi (debout habillé en rouge) est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 04 enfants .Il est propriétaire d’un atelier de menuiserie depuis 5 ans. Avec le prêt il pense acquérir trois scies électriques pour améliorer sa prestation de service

loans.use: Purchase of three (03) electric saws to improve the services at his woodworking shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria G. is married with five children. She is a seamstress and works with her aunt, Together they make and repair clothing. With the help of her husband, she was able to buy two sewing machines and begin the business from her house.

Today, her biggest orders are for school uniforms for all ages, and for work uniforms. She is asking for a loan today so that she and her aunt may be able to fulfill the great amount of work requests. With the money, she will buy fabric, thread, elastic bands, and other necessities.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic bands, and buttons.

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
I have been a group leader for the last five years.  Shahnaz K., Fatima A., Bushra M. and Jameela R. all will buy separate dairy cows for their milk business. These women are very cooperative and exhibit the necessary discipline required. 
I belong to KRK, a small semi urban in Pakistan. I am a mother of five girls and four boys. Four of my kids are married including three girls and one boy. I am borrowing for my milk sales business; I sell milk to various milkmen in my town who come to my house to collect milk. With my share of loan I plan to buy an additional dairy cow. My income has increased substantially over the past four years since I am the member at Asasah.  My business grew and I was able to save enough money to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Mr Z. Kodzo is 48 years old, married and father of six (06) children. He has a tapestry workshop located in the centre of Adéta for the last 12 years. He wants with this current loan to acquire a second sewing machine that will allow him to better serve his clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Z. Kodzo est âgé de 48 ans , marié et père de 6 enfants. Il a un atelier de tapisserie installé au centre ville d’Adéta depuis 12 ans. Il veut acquérir avec le présent crédit une deuxième machine à coudre qui va lui permettre de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine to build his business

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta B. is a 29 year-old single mother of 1.  Alberta has been selling women’s clothing for the past 9 years and she hopes this loan will increase her monthly income.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy clothing from seamstresses to sell to her clients.  Alberta is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy clothing from seamstresses to sell to clients.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa I. is a married mother of two. Rosa, her husband Pedro, and their eldest daughter, all work in their small business distributing charcoal to the local stores and businesses.

For seven years, Rosa and her family have been distributing this important product to the city of San Lorenzo and the surrounding cities. Along with selling charcoal, she also sells helium balloons for parties and gatherings on the weekends.

With the loan she is asking for, Rosa and her family will continue to purchase more charcoal in bulk to meet their customer’s demands. Having the ability to buy in bulk will allow them to lower their prices, making them more competitive in the market.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en: My name is Safia S. from a small green town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of seven: five boys and two girls. My husband sells milk and owns ten cows for this purpose. He sells this milk to various milkmen in the town. Now, one son has also stepped into his fathers business and he trades livestock along with selling milk. This year they plan to buy an additional dairy cow for his business. I would like to borrow in a group of few other women who are: Nazira B. and Sharifan B. both want to buy cows. Hameeda B.’s husband is a welder  .  This is a group loan and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Namka

texts.en: Namka is from the suburb of Gradišće, near the town Zenica. She was born in 1961 and she is married. Her husband collects iron and he can earn 500KM monthly. When he does not work, they are doing agriculture. They do not have any additional income. Namka has 3 children from 16-27 years old. She intends to use this loan in the amount of 500KM to buy more chickens.

loans.use: Buying more chickens.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr. B. is married and the father of one child. He lives in Thies, in the neighborhood called "Grand Thies". He is asking for a loan to upgrade his business selling local fruit juices and various other products. He has been a member of IMCEC since June 28, 2004. He has taken out four loans with us and has repaid them all in a timely fashion.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur B. est marie pere de un enfant et vit a thies au quartier grand thies. il sollicite ce credit pour renforcer ses activites en vendant des jus de fruits locaux et divers produits annexes. Il est membre de la caisse de IMCEC depuis le 28/06/2004. Il a bénéficié de quatre prêts avec IMCEC et tout les ces prets ont ete rembourses correctement.

loans.use:
Upgrade equipment used for selling local fruit juices, etc.

Ameliorer ses equipement pour la vente de jus de fruits locaux et divers

payments.comment: Mr Moussa Ba  a solde a l' avance du terme .  Thanks you  KIVA - Greetings from Senegal !!!!

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella S. is married and has 4 children.  For the past 5 years, she has been selling food products to students at Cape Coast University.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional food items to sell to the hungry students.  Stella is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional food items for food sales business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella S. is married and has 4 children.  For the past 5 years, she has been selling food products to students at Cape Coast University.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional food items to sell to the hungry students.  In addition, Stella is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional food items.

loans.name: Akhteri's Group

texts.en: I am Akhteri B. from a lush green town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I was married 20 years ago and have nine kids: four boys and five girls. All of my kids attend school and I want to find them decent jobs for themselves. My husband works at a brick furnace and I sell milk from my house to support his income. I own two cows at present. My group members are: Asghari B. and Hussaini B. both need to buy separate dairy cows. Lastly, Sakina B. runs a grocery store. Please help all of us and support us to grow our businesses.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: M. Esther prepares food for sale. She is married to a mason and has 1 child. Business is doing very well and she intends to increase production. She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more food stuffs to increase her production and her sales.

loans.use: For additional capital for food production business.

loans.name: Helmina

texts.en: Helmina was born in 1978 and she is married. She lives with her husband in Lokvine near the town Zenica. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 700KM. They are doing agriculture, too. They can earn 200KM monthly in their agriculture business. They have 2 children 10 and 13 years old. Helmina wants to use this loan of 1000KM to buy seeds. She believes that she will improve her living standard by reselling arable crops.

loans.use: Buying seeds.

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en: I was married 15 years ago and have six kids: two boys and four girls. I reside with my family in KRK, Pakistan. I believe that education is necessary, therefore my kids attend school.  My husband works at a tea factory and I sell milk. I am borrowing for a second time from Asasah, a microfinance institution, and want to buy an additional cow. My group members are:  Rehman B. will buy a rickshaw with her share of loan. Majeeda B.,Sughran B. and Nusrat B. all want to expand their milk business and therefore buy cows for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand tea stall

loans.name: Armina

texts.en: Armina is from Blatuša, a small place near the town of  Zenica. She was born in 1972 and her husband has a full-time job. His monthly salary is 486KM. They have one child, 11 years old. This is her second loan in the amount of 1000KM. Armina wants to use it for agriculture. She plants strawberries and she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying strawberries seedlings.

loans.name: Nevzeta

texts.en: Nevzeta lives in Gornja, Zenica with her husband and 2 children, 22 and 28 years old. She is 51 years old. This is her second loan of 1000KM and she is going to use it to buy stock and animal feed. She hopes that she will improve her household and monthly income.

loans.use: Buying stock and animal feed.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. has 3 children and is married to a taxi driver.  To help support her family she makes and sells “kenkey”.  Kenkey is a very popular Ghanaian dish and is served with stew.  She is requesting $225 to buy corn so she can produce kenkey in larger quantities.  Agnes is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy corn to produce kenkey.

loans.name: Hazema

texts.en: Hazema is a 38-year-old woman from Jaruške, near the town Banovići. She is married and her husband works as a miner. He earns about 700KM monthly. They are receiving monthly foreign nursing in the amount of 298KM. Foreign nursing is financial aid that Hazema receives from a social fund for her handicapped child. Hazema is taking this loan to buy a calf and she intends to fatten it with the other stock. She wants to increase her cattle resources in order to increase her family income.

loans.use: Buying a calf.

loans.name: Begajeta

texts.en:
Begajeta was born in 1972 and she is divorced. She has a shop in which she sells a variety of products in Jaruške and she can earn 500KM monthly. She has one child who is 16 years old, and she receives alimony in the amount of 150 KM .

Begajeta wants to use this loan of 1000 KM to extend the range of goods available in her store. She hopes that she will improve living standards for herself and her son.

loans.use: For range extending.

loans.name: Jimiama

texts.en: Jimiama B. is married and has 2 children.  She sells food, vegetables and other commodities at the Cape Coast University science market.  She is requesting $525 to buy food items and vegetables.  Jimiama is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy food items and vegetables.

loans.name: Hidajeta

texts.en: Hidajeta was born in 1966. She is married and lives with her husband in Jaruške, near the town Banovići. Her husband works in a limestone mine and he can earn 500KM monthly. Hidajeta works in agriculture and she can earn about 200KM monthly by selling milk products. She is going to use this loan of 1000KM to buy a calf and fatten it, along with her other stock. She wants to increase her animal resources in order to increase the monthly income of her family.

loans.use: Buying a calf.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira is a 44-year-old woman who is married and lives with her husband Vitez. Her husband works in a medical center in Vitez and he earns about 600KM monthly. Almira does sewing, and with this loan 600KM, she wants to buy material to improve her business. She wants to open a sewing shop.

loans.use: Buying material for sewing.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a young mother of two children. She is married to Oscar Cantero, who works for the military. Laura runs her own small business where she sells the services of three phone booths, while also selling ice, ice cream, and other sweets and snacks.

Laura is asking for a loan today to expand the goods that she sells in her store. Many people use cell phones and the demand for accessories is high. With the loan, she will buy some phone accessories to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.en:
Alcides is a hard working father. He is in the business of selling scrap metals, rubber, bottles, and other odds and ends; a business that he inherited from his father. Businesses buy his industrial material and, from that, he makes a living for his small family.

His wife, Celeste, works as a hairdresser when she is not at home caring for their young girls. She learned this skill from her mother, who was also a hairdresser. Thanks to both Alcides’ work and his wife Celeste’s efforts, the two now own their own house and are working on building their family.

Alcides would like to invest in a bigger truck someday soon to transport his goods and expand his clientele. However, the loan today will be used to invest in more scrap metal, iron, bottles, and various industrial goods.

loans.use: To buy iron, scrap metal, oil clothes, and bottles.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Lorenzo Group

texts.en:
This committee of women named, “The Women in the Fight,” has worked hard to ensure the safety and health of their families. They are all friends and neighbors and, together, they work to take out a loan, but they also plan activities with all of their families. These women have come together to celebrate birthdays and support each other in pregnancy, births, and through the ups and downs of their businesses.

Together, they are asking for a loan to invest in their different businesses, buying clothing, foods items, cosmetics, refreshments, and household items. They support each other and make sure that all of their loan payments are done on time.

loans.use: The women will divide the loan money according to the needs of each business.  The money will be spent on goods, like clothing, shirts, pants, perfumes, facial creams, food, meat, refreshments, and baking goods.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina is a 51 year old married woman with seven grown children. She used to work as a street vender selling bread and milk until she and her husband saved enough to build a small convenience store. Her husband is a construction worker.

She is asking for a loan today to increase the amount of goods sold in her store. Miguelina will buy flour, oil, rice, noodles, sugar and meat with the loan and the diversity of the goods will bring in more income. She works to help support her husband and the pair hope to save enough money to continue expanding the convenience store and repairing their house.

loans.use: To buy goods for their convenience store including flour, sugar, meta, rice and noodles

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly P. is a single mother of four children.  She works as a trader, selling food and sandals to students at Cape Coast University.  She is requesting a loan of $225 to buy a wider variety of shoes and food items to sell.  Nelly is a member the Anointing Group, which is made up of ten borrowers who live in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of shoes and food items to sell.

loans.name: Gladis' Group

texts.en:
Gladis and Herlinda belong to the community bank “Virgen del Carmen”. Gladis has been a member for five years and Herlinda for one year. In that time they have learned responsibility, punctuality and improved their business skills. They say that in the community bank not only have they learned valuable skills but have found support and companionship.

Gladis is 34 years old. She is married and has four children, aged fifteen and younger. Gladis has a store where she sells tara.
