loans.name: Rosa Alejandrina

texts.es:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Valiant Women), located at No. 662 Jr Eduardo D. Águila in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 57 years old, has three kids, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, Rosa decided to invest in a shed for raising chickens.

Presently she makes a living by selling "the tree of life" which is best known as "noni" (a bitter citrus fruit eaten for its nutritional value) , but she still sells eggs from her birds and never neglects the care of her chicken shed. She wakes up very early to make breakfast and attend to her shed, and after that she focuses on the chores of her home and goes to rest early for the physical work of the next day.

With this loan of 1200 Soles, which will be paid back in five months, she will invest in purchasing 25 farm chickens, buying a balanced diet for them, and remodeling her shed.

Rosa tells us that taking noni makes her feel more healthy and it gives her lots of energy to work and continue forward despite the inconveniences that never leave her. She is very appreciative of Manuela Ramos for all the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Eduardo del Águila N° 662, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 57 años, tiene 3 hijos, es separada, Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300, deciD. invertir en un galpón D. crianza D. pollos.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta del árbol D. la vida que es mas conocido como noni pero sin descuidar su galpón y venta D. huevos, se levanta muy temprano para hacer el desayuno y atender su galpón, D. ahí se dedica al aseo D. su casa y descansa temprano para la faena del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invirtió en la compra D. 25 pollos D. chacra, alimento balanceado y en la remodelación D. su galpón.

Rosa, nos cuenta que tomando noni se siente muy bien D. salud y eso le da muchas energías para trabajar y seguir adelante a pesar D. los inconvenientes que nunca faltan, está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por toda la ayuda brindada.

loans.use: 25 farm chickens, a balanced chicken diet, and remodeling her shed

loans.name: Sinfuriana Eumelia

texts.es:
Señora Sinfuriana is a member of the communal bank Corazón de Jesús ("Heart of Jesus"), located at Av. Universitaria Mz G Lt 22 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 52 years, has seven children, and her husband is a locksmith. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in raising chickens.

Presently Sinfuriana owns a shed in which she raises diverse types of birds so that later she may sell them in the market and to different restaurants. Sinfuriana works with the support of her kids in order to grow the business so that each day it prospers more than the previous day.

With the loan of 1700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will invest in fixing up the shed, buying a balanced diet for her birds, and purchasing a great quantity of little chicks.

For Sinfuriana working with Manuela Ramos is a great help, especially for all the support and motivation that is offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sinfuriana pertenece al banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, ubicado en la Av. Universitaria Mz G Lt 22, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, 7 hijos y su esposo es cerrajero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la crianza de pollos.

En la actualidad tiene un galpón en la cual cría diversos tipos de aves, para luego venderlos en el mercado y en los diferentes restaurantes. Sinfuriana cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos para llevar adelante el negocio que prospera cada día más.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en el arreglo del galpón, en la compra de comida balanceada para sus aves y en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollitos.

Para Sinfuriana trabajar con Manuela Ramos es un apoyo y una gran ayuda, mas que todo por las charlas que le brindan, le ayudan y le motivan para seguir adelante.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in improving the shed and buying food for her birds.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.en:
Shely P. is an energetic and lively 28 year old woman with 7 kids (ages 9, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, and 8 months.) She is happily married and loves her kids more than anything else in the world. When she is not working she enjoys reading her Bible. With her first loan funded by Kiva, she was able to begin running her own business selling clothing to other people in her community. With this next loan she hopes to expand her business. Her goal is to have a boutique in Puerto Plata that sells nice clothes and shoes. She would also like to expand her home because there are nine people and not much room!

This Bank of Hope has been part of Esperanza’s microfinance program for over a year. Three of the four groups are applying for their second loan and one group is applying for the first time. The group of twenty women is very diverse: some have come over to the DR with their families from Haiti, and others were born and raised here. For these five women, this is an opportunity they have only dreamed of. Because it actually costs money in the Dominican Republic to even save money – its unfathomable for these women to think that they would be offered a loan from someone besides a greedy loan shark, much less an organization that anticipates their personal growth and success.

On behalf of Esperanza, Shely, and the entire group we would like express our gratitude for your generosity and support!

loans.use: to purchase new clothing and shoes

loans.name: Maria Eshter

texts.es:
Maria is 40 years old and works at the Warnes monastery. Her husband is employeed by the SOBOLMA company. Maria dedicates herself to the sale of refrigerators and beer on the weekends. Also she finds work transcribing data and information, and other computation work, which she does from home. Her family is comprised of six people, her, her husband, and her four children 19, 18, 16, and 6. Maria has the experience of more than 11 years as much for being a professor as for the work she has. She encounters medium competition, but it is her experience that gives her the edge.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Maria tiene 40 años de edad y trabaja en el magisterio de Warnes, su esposo es empleado fijo de la empresa SOBOLMA. De manera particular, María, se dedica a la venta de refrigerios y cerveza los fines de semana, también realiza trabajos de transcripción de datos y otros trabajos en computación, mismo que los realiza en su domicilio. Su familia está compuesta por seis personas, ella su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 16 y 6 años respectivamente. Maria tiene una antiguedad de más de 11 años, tanto como profesora como también en las otras actividades que realiza. Su competencia en todos los rubros es media, pero su antiguedad es la que marca la diferencia. La solicitud es para la adquisición de capital de trabajo tanto para la venta de refrigerios como material para sus trabajos de computación. Los precios de estos artículos varian dependiendo del proveedor. Maria es una persona muy responsable y tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Carmen Teresa

texts.es:
Carmen is 46 years old and dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics from the Yanbal and Avon lines. Her husband has a little artisan factory of plastics connectors for glass tables. Her family is comprised of her, her husband, and their son. The family lives near the town of Urkupina which is quite far from the city. Both have worked more than 3 years in their respective areas, and there is quite a bit of competition, but there is sufficient demand for all types of products reasonably priced. Carmen and her husband are trying to keep up with there promises and obligations. The prices vary depending on the quality and type of product. This is the second loan they have take out with our institution and until now they have had a good credit and repayment history. They actually have another line of credit which they regularly pay.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Carmen es una señora de 46 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la Línea de Yanbal y Avon, su esposo tiene una pequeña fábrica artesanal de uniones de plásticos para mesas de vidrio. Su familia está compuesta por ella su esposo y un hijo, la familia vive por el barrio Urkupiña en el Plan 3000, zona que está bastante alejada de la ciudad además de ser de condiciones muy humildes. Ambos trabajan más de 3 años en sus respectivas actividades. Existe bastante competencia pero así también hay demanda para todotipo de productos de acuerdo a sus costos, Carmen y su esposo logran cumplir con estas actividades todos sus compromisos y obligaciones. Los precios varian dependiendo de la calidad y el tipo de producto, generalmente se manejan los que rige el mercado. Este es el segundo préstamo de Carmen con nuestra Institución y hasta el momento ha presentado un comportamiento aceptable en el cumplimiento de pagos. Actualmente tiene otro crédito en una entidad financiera mismo que lo paga regularmente.

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline J. is a 36 year old woman who lives with her husband, niece, and seven children (ages: 14, 12, 9, 6, 4, 2 and 4 months). Her husband is currently unemployed and has found it very difficult to secure a job. She currently has problems providing for her children – they are often sick with either a cold or asthma. Her 4 year old son, David, suffers from a chronic illness. She currently sells clothing from her home but hopes that one day she will have her own “colmado,” which is a very small grocery store. She is looking forward to this loan because it will allow her to expand her business and buy more clothing to sell.

This group lives in a small community about 40 minutes outside of Puerto Plata. Most of the people in the community are Haitian and came to the Dominican Republic in hopes of finding a better life. Jobs are extremely difficult to come by here; the unemployment rate in these smaller towns can be as high as 25%. Disease and sickness are very prevalent in this specific area due to the lack of capital available for medical care or medicine.

This is a very close and tight knit group. They rely on each other for emotional and financial support. With the loan from Kiva and business skills and supervision from Esperanza, these individuals are able to pursue their dreams and start their own small businesses.

Oh behalf of Esperanza and everyone in this group, thank you for your continued support and generosity. God Bless!

loans.use: to expand her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Vidalina's Group

texts.en:
Vidalina, Maximina, and Gladis have belonged to the community bank “Virgen D. Cocharcas” for nine, three, and six years respectively. They say they joined the community bank because they felt like the leaders had confidence in them. Since joining the community bank they have learned the importance of saving and self-esteem.

Vidalina is 53 years old. She is married and has two children. Vidalina was scared when she joined the community bank, and almost withdrew just a few months after joining. Nine years later she feels much more confident and happy that she has continued to ba a member. Vidalina is an artisan weaver who makes beautiful blankets and other products. She has been weaving for over twenty-five years.

Maximina is 48 years old. She is single and has one child. Maximina raises pigs and has recently started raising guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru. She has been raising animals for two years, before that she sold emoliente, which is a warm beverage maD. from local herbs and seeds.

Gladis is 40 years old. She is a widow and has three children aged 20, 18, and 4. Gladis sells coca leaves, which are used for medicinal purposes and to make a delicious tea. Gladis travels to the jungle region to buy the coca leaves and then sells them all around the region of Ayacucho.

Vidalina, Maximina, and Gladis need loans of 1400, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy wool, thread, guinea pig food, and to make basic home improvements.

Their dreams are to start exporting products internationally, to have security old age, and that their children will finish their education.

loans.use: To buy wool, thread, guinea pig food, and to make basic home improvements.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia is a single mother with three children ages 13, 16 and 17 who attend school. They live in a rural area called Villa Reconciliacion. The region is very poor and crime is a problem. Silvia has fought on her own to provide for her children, making sure they have an education so that they will be able to pursue professions and improve their lives. In order to meet all her obligations, she works selling clothing, perfumes and cosmetics to her friends and neighbors. The income from this has enabled her to pay her household costs.

Because of the cost of food and basic services, Silvia decided to fix up a small room in her house so that she could rent it out to a couple, increasing her income and doing her best to provide for the needs of her children. But the rains have been heavy the last few months, causing some damage to the room and the wooden walls and now the renters are asking that she fixes it. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to rebuild the walls from concrete. This will allow her to offer a nicer room to the tenants, as well as collect more rent.

La señora Silvia es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 13, 16 y 17 años, los cuales están estudiando, habitan en el asentamiento de Villa Reconciliación, zona rural, muy pobre, existe mucha delincuencia. Esta madre ha luchado sola por sacar adelante a sus hijos, le ha brindado lo necesario para vivir, como es la educación, la cual desea poderlos preparar para que sean profesionales de bien y opten a mejores condiciones de vida en donde se puedan desarrollar como individuo. Para poder cumplir con todas las obligaciones, esta madre trabaja de operaria en una zona franca, oportunidad en la que ha aprovechado para comercializar ropa, perfumes y cosméticos a las trabajadores de esa maquila así como a sus amistades y vecinas, ingresos que le han permitido pagar los gastos del hogar. Debido a lo costoso de los alimentos y servicios básicos, decide acondicionar un pequeño cuarto en su humilde vivienda con láminas de zinc y madera, el cual alquila a una pareja, es con todo esto que esta madre hace frente a satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, todo con el objetivo de brindarles un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Las abundantes lluvias de meses pasados, deterioraron el cuarto, ya que las paredes del cuarto son de madera, por lo cual están podridas y es por eso que los inquilinos le están solicitando a la señora que mejore el cuarto, ya que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, viendo esta situación la señora solicita un préstamo para construir de concreto las paredes del cuarto y brindar un mejor servicio lo que le ayudara a pedir un mejor precio por el alquiler.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CEMENT, SAND AND IRON TO REPAIR THE WALLS ON A ROOM SHE RENTS OUT IN HER HOUSE.  THE TENANTS ARE COMPLAINING BECAUSE THE RECENT HEAVY RAINS HAVE CAUSED A LOT OF DAMAGE TO THE WOODEN WALLS.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
For 7 years Blanca has been in charge of a business she inherited from her father. Although she felt very young, she took the reins of a small general store. She's had a lot of difficulty trying to diversify the products she offers. Before the father died, his illness generated a lot of costs, and so she was not able to invest sufficiently in the products and basic everyday items which are always in demand by the local people. Her husband is in charge of the household costs. He works as a driver and his salary enables him to cover basic services. Blanca runs the business, takes care of their young son and maintains the house. She is requesting a loan to stock the store with basic grains, meat, dairy products and other items. With more stock, she will be able to grow her business and improve the quality of life for her family.

Blanca hace 7 años se hizo cargo del negocio que su padre le heredó, siendo muy joven tomo las riendas de la pulpería, la cual ha tenido mucha dificultad en diversificar los productos que ofrece, antes de la muerte de su padre la enfermedad de este le generó grandes gastos, por lo cual no ha podido invertir suficiente en la compra de productos y alimentos básicos, los cuales son muy demandados por los pobladores de su zona, ya que estos compran los alimentos que consumirán día con día. Su esposo se encarga de los gastos de la casa, se desempeña como conductor y su salario le permite subsanar ciertos servicios básicos, la señora atiende el negocio, cuida de su pequeño hijo y realiza los quehaceres del hogar. En estos momentos la señora solicita un préstamo para abastecer su pulpería de granos básicos, carne, productos lácteos, y perecederos. Es así como podrá ampliar su negocio y mejorar la condición habitacional en la que se encuentra.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO STOCK HER SMALL STORE WITH RICE, SUGAR, OIL, MEAT AND DAIRY PRODUCTS, EXPANDING THE VARIETY OF ITEMS SHE OFFERS AND GROWING HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo is a baker with 30 years of experience. He inherited the business from his father, and dedicates himself to the creation of a wide range of bakery goods. His business is located in Waspan Sur, and has been growing over the years, with a team of people who help make the bread and distributors who deliver it to the markets, cafes, general stores and private homes. Through his business, Rodolfo has generated employment for others, even though he has only a small number of employees, he has supported them and helped them.

With his profits, he would like to buy some equipment which would allow him to offer his bakery goods in the various plazas and centers of Managua. Right now the costs of the business and the ingredients are high and the cost of bread is also higher. The demand has not diminished, but it's more difficult for him to buy the necessary ingredients. Rodolfo is requesting a loan to purchase necessary ingredients, enabling him to produce the same quantity needed to meet his customers requests.

Rodolfo es un panadero con muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad, inicia desde las cuatro de la mañana, el negocio fue una herencia de su padre, el cual hoy en día administra y se dedica a elaborar una gama de panes como pan dulce, simple, tostado, picos, galletas tostadas, entre otros. Tiene 30 años de tener su negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en Waspan Sur, este ha ido creciendo con el pasar de los años, cuenta con personas que le ayudan en el proceso de elaboración así como también distribuidores que se encargan de repartir en pulperías, mercados, cafetines y casas particulares las bolsas de pan. De esta forma ha contribuido a la generación de empleos, ya que a pesar que su personal es mínimo, le ha sido de mucho aporte al crecimiento del mismo. Con sus ganancias tiene el deseo de comprar un equipo rodante en el que puedan ofrecer su pan en las diferentes plazas y centros de Managua. En estos momentos los costos de los insumos de trabajo o ingredientes se encuentran a precios altos, aumentando el precio del pan pero por ser este de mucha demanda la venta no disminuye pero la capacidad de compra de ingredientes si se hace mas difícil, es por eso que el señor necesita un préstamo con el cual pueda adquirir su materia prima y así producir la misma cantidad con la que esta trabajando para satisfacer de esta manera la demanda de sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FLOUR, YEAST AND OTHER INGREDIENTS FOR HIS BAKERY.

loans.name: Nancy Socorro

texts.en:
Nancy is a 45 year old single mother of three children. Nancy has been a member of the community bank for two years. She is a member of the “Virgen de Cocharcas” Lending group within the bank. Nancy says that through the bank she has learned hardwork and the discipline to manage her money effectively. Since joining the bank she feels happier and more economically stable.

Nancy sells herbal life products, which is a line of natural dietary supplements. She travels to Lima about once per month to buy products and bring them back to Ayacucho. She has been selling these products for almost eighteen months. In the past she sold clothing, but has a higher profit with herbal life products.

Nancy dreams of owning a store, and giving her children a better life.

loans.use: To buy supplies in Lima in order to increase profits

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Don Silvio has run a grocery store in his house for five years in the Laureles Sur district. The business he started using his own savings has been very fruitful and is the source of support for his family. Over the years his business has expanded thanks to his good management and his wife's unconditional support. Together have worked hard in the business that is open from 6am until 9pm. They have been able to invest in the business and cover all of their family's expenses. They have four children, 3, 6, 7, and 9 years old who they need to support and educate. This family needs to renovate their house and also build a draining system so that they can have running water. Their immediate need is to install complete toilet facilities so that they can live cleanly and safely.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Don Silvio hace 5 años cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en el barrio Laureles Sur, con ahorros propios monta su negocio, el cual le ha sido muy fructífero, ya que de esta manera es como toda su familia se mantiene. A medida que pasan los años el negocio ha ido creciendo, esto debido a la buena dirección del señor y al apoyo incondicional de su esposa, quienes juntos se dedican de lleno al negocio, el cual se encuentra abierto desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m., estos padres han sabido invertir en el negocio y asumir todos los gastos de la familia, ya que cuenta con cuatro hijos, de 3, 6, 7 y 9 años, a quien mantener y educar. Esta familia requiere acondicionar mejor su vivienda así como también construir el sumidero donde fluya el agua a nivel interno, por lo cual la necesidad inmediata es la de construir letrina completa, que les brinde aseo y seguridad a su familia

loans.use: Purchase a toilet, cement, sand, zinc and other products

loans.name: José Justo

texts.es:
Jose is 40 years old and is a single father to his two children ages 5 and 7. He has been responsible for their care and education since his wife abandoned him and left the children in his care. He has always worked hard to improve their quality of life. They live in a very poor neighborhood called Luareles Sur, a rural area without basic services.

The living conditions of this family are very humble, with dirt floors, one main room, a roof damaged by the constant rain and sun. Jose works as a security guard and has not been able to earn enough to repair his house. With this loan, he will make the repairs on his house so that his children can develop and grow up in a dignified way. The most urgent requirement is for materials to patch the cracked walls, which have lifted up in the strong winds and rains of recent months.

José es un padre de familia soltero, de 40 años de edad, a su cargo están sus 2 hijos 5 y 7 años, a los cuales cuida, alimenta, educa en base a las posibilidades económicas con las que cuenta el señor, su esposa lo abandonó dejándoles a los niños a su cargo, siempre ha trabajado para sacar adelante a su familia, habita con sus pequeños hijos en el asentamiento Laureles Sur, un barrio muy pobre, rural, en donde no cuentan con todos los servicios básicos. La vivienda de esta familia es muy humilde, no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, el piso es de tierra, no existe división en la casa, el techo se encuentra dañado debido a las constantes lluvias del invierno y el sol, todo esto debido a la falta de mantenimiento inmediato de su vivienda, Trabaja como guarda de seguridad y no ha podido realizarle mejoras a su vivienda. El préstamo de este señor es para acondicionar su vivienda en donde sus hijos se puedan desarrollar dignamente, la necesidad mayor en estos momentos es la de cambiar el zinc de la vivienda, ya que se encuentra con sarro, rajado y ciertas partes están levantadas por los fuertes vientos y lluvias que azotaron en meses pasados.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ZINC LAMINATE, NAILS AND ANTICORROSIVE PAINT TO REPAIR HIS SMALL HOME.

loans.name: Nuevo Renecer Group

texts.en:
Rudilani is the coordinator of the Bank of Hope, Nuevo Renacer, which roughly translates to “rebirth” in English. Their Bank of Hope is the first such group to be formed in their community of La Barquita and they are proud to be part of the new relationship between their community and Esperanza International.

Rudilania is a 28 year old woman who lives with her husband. They have one daughter together but due to tough economic circumstances their daughter lives with her grandmother.

Rudilania has asked for this loan to start a new business selling clothing. She plans to make a part of her small house a sales room and will travel around her neighborhood to market her new store. Specifically, she is excited to begin selling new mens' and womens' jeans, as well as blouses and undergarments. She will purchase the clothes from a market in Santo Domingo called Villa Consuelo, an area famous for high-quality, imported clothes at discount prices. Through the training she received from Esperanza, she learned that purchasing clothes at a wholesale discount, or at a small discount, substantially increases her profit margin, and consequently enables her to generate more income.

Her biggest goal is to provide a better life for her daughter and give her what she herself never had growing up. Her personal goal is to continue studying and to graduate from the medical school she has been studying at. Rudilani is being trained in dialysis and blood work, as well as in providing vaccinations. Her biggest challenges revolve around the lack of opportunity to improve her business and to work. For the first time in a year and a half, Esperanza International is giving her the opportunity to return to work and create a stable income for her family.

In her free time, she likes to spend as much time as she can with her daughter, as well as study, read, and go to her local church. Rudilania sincerely thanks everyone who is supporting not just her loan, but also the loans of her group members. She says that without opportunities like these, they are not able to move forward with their lives and live the lives that they know they can. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza, and the entire Nuevo Renacer Bank of Hope, we thank you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase jeans, blouses and other clothing in bulk

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia is 32 years old. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and they have two children ages 6 and 8 who attend school. The family lives in an area called Laureles Sur, a very poor neighborhood with dirt streets and shortages of drinkable water. Karla decided to start a business in their small house, selling new and used clothing to help her husband with the household costs. She offers her products on credit and that is how her business has survived. Her greatest hope is to finish with the construction of their simple house, a process that has taken a lot of time because they haven't had the economic resources. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy construction materials to change the front door so they have more security in their home.

Karla Patricia tiene 32 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil, tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad, están estudiando en primaria, esta familia habita en Laureles Sur, es un asentamiento pobre, en donde las calles no son pavimentadas, existe escasez de agua potable, la señora Karla Jiron decide montar su pequeño negocio en su humilde vivienda el cual consiste en vender ropa variada nueva o usada a precios bajos, para apoyar a su esposo con todos los gastos familiares, ofrece sus productos al crédito y es así como ha sobrevivido. El mayor deseo de la señora es la de terminar de construir su vivienda, proceso que le ha llevado mucho tiempo debido a la falta de recursos económicos inmediatos, es por eso que solicita un préstamo en el que pueda comprar materiales de construcción para cambio de puerta de la entrada principal de la vivienda y tener mejor seguridad en su casa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO FIX THE FRONT DOOR OF THEIR SIMPLE HOME, MAKING IT MORE SECURE FOR THE FAMILY.

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.en:
Rosa is thirty-six years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of thirteen and eight. Rosa joined the community bank “Virgen de Cocharcas” Thirteen years ago with a savings of US $1. Over the past thirteen years Rosa has found support and learned to save and be responsible.

Rosa owns a store located in her house in a small town outside of Ayacucho where she sells food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar. She has owned this store for eight years. Five years ago she was able to buy a photocopy machine with a loan from the community bank that has made her business more profitable. On the weekends, Rosa travels to regional markets to buy grains that she then grinds in to flour and sells. Rosa is hoping to open a second store in the city of Ayacucho.

Rosa needs a loan of 1400 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use together with her savings to open the second store.

Rosa dreams that her children will be successful, and hopes to eventually be able to buy them a piece of land.

loans.use: To open a second store.

loans.name: Ebenezer, Group 1

texts.en:
Lidia is a young woman who has started a flourishing business selling sandals. Currently, she is only able to buy a few pairs of sandals at a time, which is barely enough to keep up with the requests of her customers. She is asking for a loan so that she can purchase a larger number and variety of sandals. She’d even like to try to expand her products to include socks and undergarments.

Lidia lives with her husband and two young children. Her dream is to be able to keep on improving her life, to always move forward, to keep learning, and to become a better person. Sometimes she gets discouraged when the competition gets fierce or when the economy slows down - but despite of all the hardships she always tries to maintain high product quality for her clients. She is also a good friend to them as well, which helps her ensure a loyal clientele.

On behalf of everyone at Esperanza, and on behalf of Lidia and her group members, we thank you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase sandals to expand her inventory

loans.name: Ebenezer, Group 2

texts.en:
Maria has a small cafeteria where she sells frituras, which is a variety of fried Dominican food. She is asking for a loan so that for the first time she will have extra capital to buy more merchandise to expand her business. Specifically, she wants to buy ingredients in bulk to cut down on cost, as well as occasionally buying a wider variety of meats to sell that she hasn’t been able to afford before.

She lives with her two children and husband in a small community outside of the capital, Santo Domingo. Her dream is to watch her children graduate high school, go to one of the universities in Santo Domingo and become professionals. For herself, her dream is to own a bakery and dessert shop where she can sell what she loves making most: breads and cakes. She also hopes at one point to return to school herself.

Maria's biggest challenge to overcome is not a lack of money, or poverty, but rather the insecurity and doubt she harbors in herself — it is hard for her to understand that she really is capable of improving her life and doing better for her family. Thankfully, with the help of Esperanza, and the group lending method, she is supported by her group members and learning to overcome this insecurity—she says they help her believe more strongly in herself.

On behalf of everyone at Esperanza, and on behalf of Maria and her group members, we thank you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase bread, chicken, beef, pork and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen is a 51 year old mother of three children. They live in an area called Laureles Norte, a poor, rural zone. Her husband is a bricklayer, work which helps cover the household expenses but is not sufficient. Carmen looked for an alternative to generate income to cover their costs, and so she works as a cook in a small eatery. Together, both parents fight to give their children a better quality of life, where they will have dignity, protection and security.

The economic situation of these parents has not allowed them to fix the infrastructure on their small home, as they've made the education of their children the priority. For this reason, they are requesting a loan so they may begin some basic repairs on their house, patching the walls and the living area.

Doña Carmen es una madre de 51 años de edad, habita con su familia en el humilde asentamiento Laureles Norte, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen de ella, el esposo de la señora trabaja como albañil por cuenta propia, oficio con el cual aporta en los gastos del hogar, no siendo esto suficiente, la señora buscó otra alternativa de obtener ingresos que le permita subsanar todos los gastos de la casa, es por eso que trabaja de cocinera en una comidería. Juntos estos padres luchan por brindarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida, en donde cuenten con una vivienda digna, la cual les genere protección y seguridad. La situación económica de estos padres no les ha permitido mejorar la infraestructura de su pequeña vivienda, ya que han priorizado la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Es por eso que en estos momentos solicitan un préstamo con el cual puedan iniciar algunas mejoras a su vivienda, como es cambiar el zinc de los cuartos de los hijos y embaldosar la sala.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS SUCH AS SAND AND CEMENT FOR BASIC REPAIRS ON THEIR SIMPLE HOME.

loans.name: Griska Zuleira

texts.es:
Griska is a child of 25 years who lives with her mother, who has always been the pillar of her home. With the efforts of her mother, she is now a professional as a supervisor of a quality control area of shirts and pants in a duty free zone. With her mother, they managed to do well and improve the infrastructure of the house in which they life. Her main goal is to get an air conditioner for her home, in which all of the conditions will comfort her mother when she sits down to rest and so that she can grow her family in that home in the future. The girl needs to build a wall in the front of her house so that these two women that live alone can increase their security.

This story was translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA volunteer.

Griska es una joven de 25 años de edad, la cual vive en compañía de su madre, quien desde siempre ha sido el pilar y sustento de su casa, es con el esfuerzo de su madre que logro profesionalizarse, es así que hoy en día se encuentra trabajando la joven como supervisora del área de control de calidad de camisas y pantalones de zona franca. Juntas madre e hija han logrado salir adelante y han ido mejorando la infraestructura de la casa donde habitan, el mayor deseo de Griska es la de acondicionar su vivienda, la cual preste todas las condiciones, comodidades y en donde su madre se sienta tranquila, así mismo poder llegar a formar una familia en un futuro. La joven necesita iniciar a construir el muro delantero de la vivienda, la cual le de mayor seguridad y así puedan vivir tranquilas, son dos mujeres solas y garantizarían su seguridad.

loans.use: To buy cement, bloacks and iron to raise a wall.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Mr. Dionisio is 46 years old and lives with his family in the community of San Ignacio, the capitol of Ticuantepe. He is in the business of producing and selling pitahaya, or strawberry pears. This fruit is produced in high temperatures and long periods of droughts. This is adequate in the community which Mr. Dioniso lives. He dedicates his whole day to maintaining the irrigation and cultivation of the area. Two of his four sons support him in his production of this fruit. The first crop of strawberry pears is taken in the month of April and requires greader care of the sheeths where the fruit is lodged. Everyone in his family works together like a team. His wife does the marketing of various products. This activity is done to pay the family expenses in months where there is no harvest. Thier income is bettered because she has already marketed products to stores in Ticuantepe. IN this method, the family has increased their standard of living. His main desire is to initiate the production of other crops like vegetables, since these products are consumed by many families in Nicaragua.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

El señor Dionisio tiene 46 años de edad, habita con su familia en la comunidad de San Ignacio, municipio de Ticuantepe, se dedica a la producción y comercialización del cultivo de pitahaya, el cual es una fruta que se produce en temperaturas elevadas y a largos periodos de sequías, lo cual se asienta de manera adecuada en la comunidad donde habita don Dionisio, le dedica todo el día al mantenimiento y riego del cultivo, dos de sus cuatro hijos le apoyan en el proceso productivo de dicha fruta. La primera cosecha de pitahaya esta por salir en el mes de abril, por lo cual requiere de mayor cuido en las vainas donde se aloja el fruto. Todos los integrantes de esta familia trabajan unidos como equipo, la esposa del señor se dedica a comercializar productos varios, actividad con la cual hacen frente a todos los gastos familiares en los meses que no hay cosecha y los ingresos mejoran cuando la producción esta lista para comercializarla en los mercados y plazas de Ticuantepe. De esta manera es como esta familia ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida. El mayor deseo del señor es la de iniciar a producir otros cultivos como hortalizas, ya que son productos muy consumidos por las familias nicaragüenses.

loans.use: To buy Organic Guarantees.

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es:
Bismark is 29 years old and single. He learned how to cultivate local crops from his father when he was 15 years old. At his young age, he has two plots of good quality, productive land which he works. March and April are the best months for planting, and Bismark is able to get two harvests during the year. He needs a loan to buy more organic materials needed for the cultivation and harvesting process. With the income he generates he can pay his costs, as well as help his parents financially. His most important goal is to build a better home for his parents where they can live a tranquil and safe life. The earnings from this harvest will give him the opportunity to begin making these improvements if the harvest is of the quality he expects. The money he is requesting will help guarantee a high quality harvest.

Bismarck tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, aprendió de su padre a cultivar pitahaya, actividad que adquirió hace 15 años y a la cual hoy en día se dedica, a su corta edad posee 2 manzanas de tierras en donde tiene plantadas vainas de pitahaya, cultivo que le ha permitido desarrollarse adecuadamente debido a las características ambientales que presenta la zona. En el verano (Marzo-Abril), es la época donde se asienta de mejor manera el cultivo, ya que necesitan de estar expuestas a los rayos del sol, requieren de riego constante pero teniendo en cuenta que el exceso de humedad perjudica el suelo, al año el joven saca dos producciones de pitahaya, ya sea en los meses de mayo a agosto o septiembre. El joven requiere de un préstamo para comprar insumos orgánicos que requiere en todo el proceso productivo del cultivo, ya que con los ingresos que genera la producción se paga sus gastos, con su trabajo apoya económicamente a sus padres, el mayor deseo de Bismarck, es el de construirle una mejor vivienda a sus padres en la que puedan vivir su vejez de manera tranquila y segura, por lo que con las ganancias de esta cosecha tendrá la oportunidad de iniciar las mejoras si el producto sale con la calidad esperada, para ello solicita este préstamo para garantizar una buena calidad de la cosecha.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZERS TO HELP GUARANTEE A HIGH QUALITY HARVEST

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Don Santos is 37 years old and is originally from the community of La Borgoña - Ticuantepe. He produces pineapples and has been in this industry for 15 years. This has allowed him to maintain the life of his wife and two children who are studying in primary and grade school. His wife supports the family by helping out with household tasks, takes care of the kids and vends his products in different stores with her husband. He dedicates as much time in the production of the product. The manufacturing requires much investment at high costs. These investments include organic chemicals for the soil and plantations. Sometimes he also does other activities like bricklaying in order to gain extra income so he can pay off other expenses like daily diets, educating his kids and pay for basic services. In these times, he needs to buy fertilizer to help him develop his pineapples and his crop to be successful.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Don Santos tiene 37 años, es originario de la comunidad de La Borgoña - Ticuantepe, se dedica a producir piña, posee 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual le ha permitido mantener a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, quienes se encuentran estudiando en primaria y secundaria, la esposa lo apoya realizando los quehaceres del hogar, cuidando de los niños y comercializa el producto en los diferentes mercados con su esposo. El señor le dedica el mayor tiempo posible al mantenimiento de la producción, el cual conlleva un proceso artesanal manufacturero que requiere de mucha inversión debido a los altos costos de los productos y químicos orgánicos que requiere el suelo y las plantaciones. En ocasiones el señor realiza otras actividades como albañilería, con el objetivo de percibir ingresos extras que le permitan subsanar todos los gastos como la alimentación diaria, educación de los hijos y pago de servicios básicos. En estos momentos el señor necesita comprar fertilizantes para que le ayude al desarrollo de las piñas y su cosecha sea todo un éxito.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer chemicals and herbicides.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina has been a member of the community bank “Marcela” for eight months. In her community bank she has learned to be responsible, punctual, and how to manage her business.

Dina is forty-nine years old. She is married and has six children. Dina travels to regional markets where she buys grains and chesses, which she later sells at the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho. In addition, Dina embroiders blankets.

Dina needs a loan of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wheat, barley, corn, and cheese.

Her dream is to own a home, build a larger business, and that her children will become successful business people.

loans.use: To invest in wheat, barley, corn, and cheese.

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
Lucia and Maria have been members of the community bank “Marcela” for almost two years. In their community bank they have learned to responsibly manage their money and investmets.

Lucia is a 52 year old widow and mother of seven children. Lucia sells food from a cart in the Magdalena market in Ayacucho. She also sells shish kabobs from her home in the evening. Previously, she sold soaps that she brought from Lima, she is currently thinking about restarting this business.

Maria is a 48 year old widow and mother of two children. Maria sells vegetables at the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho. She buys her products from farmers in the countrysiD.. She also uses land that she owns to grow lettuce. In addition, Maria has a small store where she sells soft drinks and fresh juice.

Lucia and Maria each need loans of 400 USD to invest in buying fish, rice, potatoes, oil, flour, squash, garlic, and carrots.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning each associate has. Lucia and Maria plan to use their savings to construct homes, buy land, and to support their children. Their dreams are to own a home in the city of Ayacucho, open a store in their home, and help a son open a mechanic shop.

loans.use: to invest in fish, rice, potatoes, oil, flour, squash, garlic, and carrots.

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.en:
Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas have been members of the community bank “Minke” for five years. In that time they have learned to be punctual and responsible and how to best invest their money.

Alberta is 41 years old. She is separated from her husband and has five children. Alberta sells shish kabobs from her home. She also runs a boarding house for travelers. In addition, Alberta has a small store where she sells food staples such as rice, sugar, and flour.

Beatriz is 38 years old. She a single mother and has two children. Beatriz sells “chicha”, which is a type of juice made from purple corn. She sells the chicha from a cart on a busy intersection in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells her juice at all of the festivals held in the city. Recently her sales have been down, and she plans to start renting a space to use as a store.

Felicitas is 48 years old. She is married and has five children. Felicitas sells candy and fruit during the day. In the evenings she sells “salchipollos” which is a popular fast food dish made from topping french fries with scrambled eggs and chicken.

Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas are asking for loans of 1600, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1). Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas plan to use their savings to buy land and build homes. Their dreams are to own homes, to develop their businesses, and to provide for their children.

loans.use: To invest in sugar, rice, milk, oil, soft drinks, beer, corn, cookies, candies, and meat.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.en:
Zenobia has been a member if the community bank “Minka” for six years. Through the community bank she has learned manage her finances responsibly.

Zenobis is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. Zenobia runs a store from her home where she sells rice, sugar, and flour, as well as fruits and vegetables. Previously, Zenobia traveled to the city of Lima where she bought groceries in bulk and then sold them to stores in Ayacuchho. In addition, Zenobia sells spices in the Covadonga market.

Zenobia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy beer, soft drinks, sugar, chicken, oil, and milk.

Zenobia plans to use her profits to buy a motorcycle taxi so that her son will be able to work as a taxi driver. Her dream is to have her three children grow up to be successful business people.

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, sugar, chicken, oil, and milk.

loans.name: Inavel's Group

texts.en:
Inavel and Nelida have been members of the community bank “Minka” in Ayacucho, Peru for close to one year. In that time they have learned to save, work hard, share, and have to have healthy family relationships.

Inavel is a 26 year old wife and mother of two children, aged five and one. Inavel bakes desserts, and cakes in her home and then sells them to a variety of different stores and cafes. With her new loan Inavel plans to begin selling spices in the market near her house. She needs a loan of 480 USD to buy herbs, vinegar, chili powder, garlic, and cumin.

Nelida is a 22 year old wife and mother of a one year old son. Together with her husband, Nelinda has a carpentry business which she runs out of her house. They do local construction projects and bring their products to the Sunday market in San Juan. They need a loan of 320 USD to buy more lumber, and expand their business.

Inavel dreams of opening a desert shop, and Nelinda dreams of opening a carpentry business in the center of Ayacucho. Both dream of a better future for their children.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa has been a member of the community bank “Compartir” for four years. Nicolasa is from the small town of Compañia, which is located one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.

Nicolasa is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and her four year old daughter. Nicolasa grows potatoes and corn, which she sells at the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho. She also resells other fruits and vegetables that she buys from farmers in the area. Since joining the community bank Nicolasa and her husband have been able to purchase the car that they use to transport their goods. In addition, Nicolasa buys tuna, a regional fruit that comes from a cactus, and takes it to Lima to sell.

Nicolasa needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she would invest in tuna and vegetables.

Nicolasa plans to use her profits to buy a bigger car and to build a home. Her dream is to grow her business, own a sturdy home, and that her daughter will become as successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To invest in tuna and vegetables.

loans.name: Amalia's Group

texts.en:
Isabel, Amalia, and Flora are all from the small town of Compañía located one hour outside of Ayacucho in Peru. They have been members of the community bank for 3, 4, and 8 years respectively. The bank has taught them to responibly invest and manage their money.

Isabel is a 39 year old wife and mother of four children. To provide for her family she sells grains in the jungle region of Peru, located an eight hour journey over poor roads from her home town of Compañía.

Amalia is 23 years old. She lives with husband and two children. Amalia grows carrots, and lettuce, which she sells in Ayacucho. She also collects cochinilla, an insect used to make red dyes, and tuna- a type of cactus fruit, from the countryside and sells them in the city.

Flora is a 43 year old widow with four children. Flora grows vegetables, which she sells in the city. In addition, she buys tara, a tree product used to make industrial products, which she sells to intermediaries in Ayacucho.

Isabel, Amalia, and Flora need a loan of 625 USD, which they will invest in buying peas, barley, wheat, seeds fertilizer, and medicine, as well as to increase and better pay their labor force.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Isabel, Amalia, and Flora plan to use their savings to build a home and to educate their children. Their dreams are to move up in the world, have bigger businesses, buy land, and ultimately create a better future for their children.

loans.use: To buy crops and supplies and to increase labor force

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en: Alejandrina has been a member of the community microfinance bank “Compartir” for one year.  She is from the small town of Compañia located one hour outside of Ayacucho, Peru. Alejandrina is 31 years old.  She lives with her partner and her two children ages two and four.  Alejandrina grows vegetables such as cilantro, celery, and lettuce, which she sells at the markets in the city of Ayacucho.  In addition, Alejandrina collects cochinilla, an insect used to make red dyes, and tuna, a regional cactus fruit, which she sells in her town. Alejandrina needs a loan of 900 soles (3 soles = $1), to invest in fertilizer, medicines, and seeds. Alejandrina plans to use her profits after repaying the loan to buy a blender and to pay for her children’s education.  She hopes that she will be able to give her children the opportunity and the education to succeed in business.

loans.use: To invest fertilizer, medicines, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Prek Tanop I Group

texts.en: This loan will be shared between 21 members of the Prek Tanop I Village Bank in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sreymarch Chheoum, age 33, is the Village Bank President and a farmer. She has two children who are students, but who are alS. looking for jobs to help support their family. Mrs. Sreymarch's husband is alS. a farmer, and between the two of them they earn around $9.00 per day. They will use their portion of this loan to buy fertilizer to help them with their crops, and will alS. buy food and pay for their children's education.

loans.use: T pay for school fees, fertilizer and food.

payments.comment: The Kiva team at AMK would like to extend its thanks to all lenders who helped fund this loan, which is helping Cambodia's rural poor climb out of poverty.
This repayment for 30 April 2007 and Mrs. Pech Ros. one of the members of this village bank, has  finished the repayment already.
This is the reayment on May 2007. Mrs. Phaly Yim has repaid $13 as an extra repayment.
This is the repayment on June.

loans.name: Prek Ta Chor I Group

texts.en: The Prek Ta Chor I Village Bank in Kandal Province consists of 21 members. Mrs. Soklin L., 28, is the Village Bank president and a farmer. Her husband works in construction and earns roughly $2.50 per day. Mrs. L. has three children, who are still too young to attend school. She plans to use the loan she receives to hire a person to plow her rice field.

loans.use: To hire labour to plow a rice field

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suwandri

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Suwadri and her husband, I Gede Suwendra, have been in the business of making brown coconut sugar for a long time. They have 3 children whom all of them have their own families now. Apart from the brown sugar making business, she is also a farmer.

Ni Ketut and her husband use 20 coconuts/ day for producing brown sugar. Her husband climbs the coconut tree twice a day to get these coconuts. In the afternoon, they slice the coconut to get the coconut juice as the main ingredients for the brown sugar. They keep the juice in bottles for a night and the next morning they put the juice in a big wok (cooking pan) and they steam the juice in the wok. This cooking process takes 3 hours. The juice becomes a bit of gel - like substance and they put these into the coconut shells that have been cut into half. Then they let these to cool down inside the coconut shells.

Everyday they can produce up to 6 kg of brown coconut sugar. The sugar is sold to regular customers who buy them once a week. The selling price is IDR 6 thousand per kg of sugar (around USD 0.65). In one month they can earn up to IDR 1,080,000 (around USD 118).

The money from Dinari will be used to buy another 3 big woks. These woks cost around IDR 2.5 million (around USD 275). The rest of the money will be used to buy slicing knifes and 20 bottles. These production utensils are required to enable them to increase the production capacity.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Suwadri dan suaminya, I Gede Suwendra, sudah lama menekuni usaha membuat gula merah. Ni Ketut Suwadri memiliki 3 orang anak dan semuanya sudah berumah tangga. Selain usaha gula merah, Ni Ketut Suwadri juga seorang petani. Ni Ketut Suwadri dan suaminya selalu bekerja sama dalam usahanya. Ni Ketut Suwadri dan suaminya memanfaatkan 20 pohon kelapa yang dipakai gula merah. Setiap hari suaminya memanjat pohon kelapa 2 kali . Sore hari, untuk mengiris bakal buah yang masih muda supaya bisa keluar air gula, dan pada pagi hari menurunkan air gula yang ada pada jrigen. Setelah itu Ni Ketut Suwadri menaruhnya kedalam wajan yang besar dan direbus. Proses pembuatan gula merah hingga siap dicetak menghabiskan waktu 3 jam. Setelah adonan mengental, lalu dicetak kedalam tempurung kelapa yang sudah disiapkan. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Suwadri mampu memproduksi 6 kg gula merah. Ni Ketut Suwadri mempunyai pelanggan tetap yang setiap 1 minggu membeli gula merahnya. Harga 1 kg gula merah sekarang ini Rp. 6.000.- Setiap satu bulan dari penghasilan gula merah Ni Ketut Suwadri mendapat uang Rp.1.080.000,-. Modal yang dipinjam dari Dinari untuk membeli 3 wajan besar yang harganya mencapai Rp. 2.500.000,- sisanya untuk membeli pisau iris dan 20 jrigen. Peralatan itu dibeli untuk menunjang proses produksi agar mendapat hasil yang lebih maksimal. Ni Ketut Suwadri bersyukur mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari.

loans.use: To buy production utensils (Membeli peralatan yang dapat menunjang produktifitas usahanya seperti wajan ukuran besar, pisau untuk mngiris dan jrigen untuk tempat air gula dari pohon kelapa)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani

texts.id:
Kadek Ayu Ardani has two children. Her first kid is 15 year old and he is in junior high school. Her 2nd kid is 9 year old and he is in Primary school.

She bought 2 female breeding pigs for IDR 2 million (around USD 220). She farms them in traditional ways. She doesn't keep her pigs in a hut as she doesn't have money to build one. She plans to build a pig hut once she succeed in selling the piglets produced by her breeding pigs.

One of her pig is now pregnant. The other one has just delivered 8 piglets recently. When these piglets are 2 month old, she will be able to sell them for IDR 200 thousand/ piglet (around USD 22), so in total she can earn a revenue of USD 175 from the selling of 8 piglets. She hopes the pregnant pig can deliver safely.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Kadek Ayu Ardani memiliki 2 orang anak. Anak yang pertama berumur 15 tahun duduk dibangku SMP. Anaknya yang kedua berumur 9 tahun duduk dibangku SD. Kadek Ayu Ardani memiliki 2 induk babi lokal yang sudah siap dikawinkan. 2 induk babi ini dibeli dengan harga Rp. 2.000.000.- Ayu Ardani memberi makan masih secara tradisional yaitu dengan memberi daun talas yang sudah direbus lalu dicampurkan dengan dedak padi. Cara pemeliharaannya juga masih secara tradisional, karena belum ada dana tambahan untuk membuat kandang. Rencananya kalau induknya berhasil, Ayu Ardani akan membuat kandang yang permanen. 2 induknya sekarang sudah hamil dan yang satu sudah melahirkan 8 ekor anak babi. Ayu Ardani sangat telaten dalam mengurus induk dan anaknya. Umur 2 bulan anaknya dijual dengan harga 1 ekor babi Rp. 200.000.- jadi total semuanya Rp.1.600.000.- Harapan Ayu Ardani, 1 induknya lagi bisa melahirkan dengan selamat.

loans.use: To buy breeding pig/ female breeder  (Membeli induk babi)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sari is a grandmother who has 4 children and 10 grandchildren. Ni Ketut Sari lives alone with her husband as all of their children has moved out.

To kill the time, she opens a small stall in front of her house. She sells daily necessities such as veggies, traditional snacks made by her neighbors and also various kinds of foods and drinks.

Every morning her husband accompanies her to go to the market to buy for ingredients and merchandise. At 5 am she finishes the morning market shopping and starts to open her stall. She can earn net profit of IDR 20 thousand per day (around USD 2.5). Her stall is doing quite good as it gets a lot of customer.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sari seorang nenek dengan 10 cucu karena 4 anaknya semuanya sudah berkeluarga dan tidak tinggal bersamanya. Ni Ketut Sari dan suaminya sudah lanjut usia. Tetapi semangat hidupnya sangat tinggi. Supaya tidak kesepian Ni Ketut Sari membuka usaha dagang dirumahnya. Ni Ketut Sari menjual kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti sayur - sayuran, kue-kue tradisional yang dititip tetangganya dan berbagai macam makanan dan minuman ringan. Setiap hari, dengan diantar suaminya, Ni Ketut Sari berbelanja di pasar pagi di kotanya. Jam 5 pagi, Ni Ketut Sari sudah sampai dirumah dan mulai membuka warungnya. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Sari mengeluarkan modal hampir Rp. 300.000.- Dan pendapatan perhari bisa mencapai Rp. 150.000.- sd Rp. 200.000.-. Dengan rata-rata keuntungan perhari yang diperolehnya Rp. 20.000,-. Karena ramainya orang yang berbelanja kewarungnya, Ni ketut Sari menjadi semangat untuk bekerja supaya pelanggannya tidak hilang.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Loan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Loan, 32 years old, lives in Trac But. She has two small school age children and the family welfare is in hardship. She tends a small vegetable garden and sells grocery for living. Her daily income is 5USD. She’s never taken out any loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chi Loan 32tuoi,hien dang o Trac But.Gia canh nha chi rat kho khan.Chi phai nuoi 2con con rat nho an hoc.lau nay chi van dang trong rau va ban hang tap hoa lat vat de kiem song,nhung thu nhap con rat thap,rat vat va de chu cap cho ca gia dinh.Thu nhap binh quan cua gia dinh chi chi 50-80nghin dong/ngay.Tu truoc den gio chi chua vay o dau ca.Chi rat thich vay Binh Minh vi co the duoc tra gop.

loans.use: Invest in vegetable garden and buy goods

loans.name: Mukim

texts.en:
M. Mukim is 37 years old. He is married with three children of school age.

Mukim is a market vendor. He sells mens clothing. His trading place is located in the local market. Mukim has been in business for ten years already. Being very friendly, Mukim has obtained a reliable base of clientele. Now he requests $1,000.00 US dollars for the term of 5 months. He is planning to purchase new mens clothing. Mukim has been a client of IMON for several years and had proved himself as a reliable client.  He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase new mens clothing to increase inventory

loans.name: Muatar

texts.en: S. Muatar is 48 years old. Muatar is a market vendor. She sells kids clothing in the local market. The elder daughter helps her in her business. After eight years of entrepreneurship, Muatar has obtained a reliable clientele. Now the business is successful and generates enough stable income improve the family's living conditions. Now Muatar woud like to purchase kids clothing for the spring season. She requests $500.00 US dollars for the term of 5 months. Muatar thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase kids clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyet, 48 years old, tends poultry and đi chợ*. She has 3 grown-up children who have moved out and a school age child. Her modest daily income is 4USD. She has taken out loan before, all paid off. She prefers the Binh Minh besause it has easier terms.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chi Nguyet hien nay 48tuoi.Hien chi dang o nha chan nuoi dan ga va di cho.Chi da co 3 con da o rieng va dang nuoi 1con con di hoc.Thu nhap binh quan cua chi la rat thap,rat vat va moi co duoc tu 50-70nghin dong mot ngay.Chi Nguyet da vay o noi khac nhung da tra het va gia dinh chi van con rat kho khan,do do chi muon tiep tuc vay de co von lam an.Chi rat thich vay cua Binh Minh voi ly do la chi co the tra gop trong mot thoi gian.

loans.use: Invest in poultry

loans.name: Salom

texts.en:
F. Salom is 46 years old. He and his wife have raised two sons. Both are already married.

Salom provides taxi services with his car. Being in this business for 5 years, Salom has become very popular in his neighborhood as a polite taxi-driver. Now Salom plans to fix his car and to sell it. The received funds shall be used for purchasing a new vehicle. However, he needs additional funding for the repairs.  Salom requests $950.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Having proved himself as an honest reliable client Salom  promises to repay the current loan in time.

loans.use: To fix his car for resale

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
G. Shavkat is 32 years old. He is married with two children. Shavkat lives with his parents and is the main bread winner for this large family. 

Shavkat runs a café where he cooks kebab and grilled chicken. Being a very good and experienced cook, Shavakat has managed to make his business successful. The income from the business is used by Shavkat to improve his family's living conditions. He also dreams to be able to educate his children in the Institutes and Universities. Now Shavkat wants to make major repairs to the café thus to attract more clients and keep the old ones. For this he requests $950.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Shavkat thanks everyone for their support and promises to be precise in loan repayment.

loans.use: Major repair of the café.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Bahrom M., 56, lives in Varzob district. He is married with 5 children and has a secondary school education. He works as a driver, but aside from that he also raises animals. He buys young, healthy calves at local markets, fattens them for 40-45 days, and then sells them back at the same markets. After selling these catlle, he then buys new ones, fattens them, and sells them again. Bahrom has been buying and selling cattle in this manner for about 30 years. This business brings additional income to his family, as well as supplying the local markets with fresh meat. He is applying for a loan to increase turnover. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Махмудов Бахром проживает в районе Варзоб. 56 лет. Женат ,имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее. Работает шофером. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Скупает на рынках молодых, здоровых бычков, откармливает около 40-45 дней, затем продает на тех же рынках. После продажи опять покупает бычков, откармливает и продает. Так по этой системе и работает клиент. опыт в данной сфере торговли бычками уже около 30 лет. Этот бизнес приносит дополнительный доход его семье, а так же помогает обеспечить рынки свежим мясом. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
K. Jamshed is 33 years old. He is married with three children.

Jamshed cooks kebab and other national meals like plov, lagman, and oriental dumplings. Jamshed is a very experienced cook. Currently he is renting a café but for 2 years he has safed money to purchase a private café. But he needs the additional funds for this. Jamshed requests $950.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Jamshed thanks everyone supporting him in his wish to run his own café and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase a private café.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.ru:
Zaynab A., 57, lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is a widow with three children. Zaynab has a secondary school education and makes her living in animal husbandry. She raises cows and sells their milk, which gives her an income to support her family. She sells the milk in Dushanbe (Tajikistan's capital) at reasonable prices, supplying the local population with fresh milk. Zaynab would like a loan to buy another cow, which will increase her income. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Азизова Зайнаб проживает в городе Турсун-заде.Возраст57 лет. Вдова, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит коров молочной породы, для того чтобы продавать получаемое молоко. Это дает возможность получать доход и обеспечивать свою семью. Молоко реализует в городе Душанбе по доступным ценам. это помогает обеспечить население свежим молоком. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одну корову, что даст возможность увеличить доход.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Hoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoan, 50 years old, lives in Cho township, a still very poor area. She has 4 grown up children, all moved out and she is by herself. She tends poultry for living. Her daily income is about 5USD. She’s never taken out loan before and now is the first time. She prefers the Binh Minh because it requires no credit and its terms are easy.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chi Hoan nam nay da 50tuoi,hien chi dang song o T. tran Cho.O T. tran do moi nguoi con rat kho khan va ngheo kho.Chi Hoan da co 4con va deu da di lam,chi phai tu nuoi song ban than.Chi hien dang lam nghe chan nuoi ga tai nha.O T. tran noi chi song,dieu kien chan nuoi con rat kho khan.Do vay nay chi muon vay tien cua cong ty de mua cam cho ga.Thu nhap cua chi rat thap,tu 80-100nghindong mot ngay.Tu truoc chi chua vay o dau.Chi rat thich vay o Binh Minh vi o day duoc tra gop va dac biet khong phai the chap.Dieu do rat thuan loi doi voi gia dinh chi.

loans.use: Invest in poultry

loans.name: Lolahon

texts.ru:
Lolahon Hamzaevna T. lives in Tursun-zade . She is 37 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a secondary education. She sells food products and has a retail stall in her village. She brings products from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan, where she buys the products wholesale. This business brings an additional income that her family needs. Lolahon wants to use proceeds from the loan to increase her turnover. She plans to repay her loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Тошматова Лолахон Хамзаевна проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 37 лет , замужем имеет 3 детей. образование среднее. Занимается розничной торговлей продуктов питания. имеет торговую точку у себя в кишлаке. Привозит товар из города Душанбе ,покупая у оптовых реализаторов. Этот бизнес помогает получить ее семье необходимый дополнительный доход , поэтому клиентка планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
I am Samina F. from the industrial city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. My husband is a farmer and I stitch clothes for my neighborhood clients. Now, I want a loan to buy a new sewing machine and invest in high quality notions. I am a mother of an only daughter and I want to give her a sound economic future. There are four other women in my loan group; all of them will invest their share of loans in their own or in their family’s businesses. I have known these women for a long time and completely trust them. They are: Uzma M., who runs a beauty salon and needs to buy cosmetics and small equipment; Razia B., who will use this loan to buy poultry feed and hens for her husband’s poultry farm; Zia I.,who requires this loan to buy a rickshaw for her husband; and Rukhsana N., who needs this loan to expand their furniture store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ansa's Group

texts.en:
I am Ansa B.. I have lived all my life in the mid-sized city of Faisalabad, Pakistan and I was married five years ago. My husband is a poultry farmer and wants to buy hens and poultry feed for his farm. He has been operating this farm for three years. My group members who in need of loans are: Bano B., whose son is a butcher and operates a meat shop; Kaloom R., who needs a loan to expand her son’s shoe manufacturing business; Nazia P., who will use this loan to buy poultry feed for her poultry farm; and Mohammad A., who will buy fertilizer for her family's field.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy hens and poultry feed

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
I am Naseem A. and I was married three years ago. I live with my husband in Faisalabad, Pakistan. My husband is a driver who transports goods on his truck. His truck is in need of repairs and therefore we need a loan. I would like to borrow in a group of several other women who are: Tasleem B., whose husband is a welder; Nighat B., who wants to start a beauty salon; Rasheeda B., who will buy goats with her share of the loan; and Tayiba Z., who needs to expand her family’s poultry farm.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Repair a delivery truck

loans.name: Almuhammad

texts.ru:
Almuhammad Ergashevich A. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 42 years old and is married with 6 children. He has a specialized secondary education. His is a driver by profession. He is also engaged in animal husbandry which allows him to provide for his family. He buys and fattens calves for 45 days and then resells them at the local market. He has been working in this field for over 20 years. He wants to purchase a calf with the proceeds of the loan. He plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Артыков Алмухаммад Эргашевич проживает в районе Рудаки . Возраст 42 года, женат имеет 6 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности водитель. Занимается животноводством, что позволяет ему обеспечивать свою семью. Покупает и откармливает бычков в течении 45 дней , продает на местном рынке . .Опыт в этой сфере имеет свыше 20 лет .Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцкв .

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Oinihol

texts.ru:
Oinihol Urakovna H. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 38 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a secondary education. She is a housewife. She has a milking cow and sells milk. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase another cow which will increase the amount of milk products she can sell and which in turn will boost her sales. She plans to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хатамова Ойнихал Ураковна жительница района Рудаки .Возраст 38 лет , замужем имеет 3 детей. Образованние среднее. Домохозяйка, занимается животноводством.Имеет дойную корову, молоко которой использует для реализации. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести еще одну корову для того чтобы увеличить объем получаемой продукции тем самым увеличивая свой доход. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing a milking cow

loans.name: Gul

texts.ru:
K. Gul lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 45 years old and is married with 2 children. He has a secondary education. He is self-employed and is engaged in animal husbandry. He buys young calves, feeds them for 40-45 days then sells them. This business is the main source of income for his family. Gul wants to expand his business, so he decided to apply for a loan. He plans to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase 2 calves. He plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кенджаев Гул проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. возраст 45 лет, женат имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Не работает. Занимается частным предпринимательством в сфере животноводства. Покупает на рынках молодых бычков , откармливает около 40-45 дней , а потом продает на тех же рынках.Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. По этой причине клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Кроме того занимаясь этим бизнесом клиент сможет обеспечить рынки здоровыми животными , использумых на мясо.На запрашиваемый кредит клиент сможет купить 2 бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing 2 calves

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safar Davlatovich N. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 57 years old, is married and has 8 children. He has a specialized secondary education. He is a professional driver and also is engaged in animal husbandry. He buys young calves, feeds them for 40-45 days and then sells them at higher price, since grown calves are cost more and are used for meat. He then buys another set of young calves, feeds them and resells them. This is his business, which helps him to provide for his family, since he is a sole breadwinner of the family. Besides that, the development of stock-raising business allows to supply nearby markets with fresh meat at affordable prices. Safar has been in this business for about 20 years. He wants to use the proceeds of his loan to purchase several calves. He plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Нуралиев Сафар Давлатович житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 57 лет, женат, имеет 8 детей.Образование средне специальное. По специальности водитель. Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает около 40-45 дней а затем продает по более высокой цене, так как откормленные и подросшие бычки стоят дороже и их используют на мясо.Затем он покупает новый молодняк , откармливает и продает. Так по этой схеме действует его бизнес.Этот бизнес помогает обеспечивать его семью так как клиент является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме того развитие животноводческого сектора позволяет обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом и по доступным ценам.Занимается животноводством клиент уже около 20 лет.Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить бычков. Погаситькредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing calves

loans.name: Khusein

texts.en:
K. Khusein is 19 years old. In spite of his youth, he supports his parents and younger brothers and sisters.

Khusein provides taxi services on his vehicle. He has been in this business for one year. Being a rather smart and diligent guy Khusein is trying to make his business stable.
