Born in 1960, Madame Kayi Adakou Dovi is married and responsible for supporting four people in her family. To make money, she sells various products ranging from soaps, plastic objects, traditional style skirts, and jewelry. With her meager finances, she was able to start this small business, but needs a loan to help augment her store and to better satisfy her customers. To do this, she would like to buy a large quantity of items in order to attract more customers. The funds from the loan will permit her to increase her revenue and finance other products on request from customers. This will also allow her to improve the standard of living of her family and above all, aid and improve the education of her children.

Translation from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1960, Madame K. Dovi Adakou Kayi est mariée et supporte quatre (4) personnes. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits divers (savons, objets plastiques, pagnes, bijoux) avec ses maigres moyens financiers. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’agrandir la taille de son commerce en achetant en grande quantité ses articles pour plus attirer la clientèle. Ce fonds lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et refinancer d’autres produits selon la demande des clients. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille surtout l’éducation de ses enfants

loans.use: To purchase and sell plastic objects and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
I am the leader of a group of 4 other women who also require loans to invest in their businesses:

Rani B. is borrowing to help with her family’s sheep trading business,

Parween A. will invest her loan in her tailoring business,

Shamim A. is borrowing to help her son, who is a welder; and

Nazia N. plans to invest her loan in her husband’s electronic store business. For myself, I am 48, married and a mother of ten: six boys and four girls. I am borrowing for my son who runs a musical band. He will use the loan to buy some new musical instruments.

loans.use: To buy musical instruments

loans.name: Mbalwa C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Getrude I.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Getrude is 33 years old and is married. Her husband is an artist. She has 2 children aged 15 and 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Getrude makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for her children's education. Getrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 800000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Getrude is joined in her small group by Grace N., Maria N., Christine N., and Justine K.. Grace N. has a business in brick laying and wants to expand the business. Maria N. is currently operating a canteen business and wants a loan to add capital stock. Christine N. operates a beauty salon business and wants to purchase more salon equipment. Justine K. is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to construct another poultry house and purchase more chicks.

loans.use: To boost tailoring business

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
I am Azra B. and I live with my family in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I am 35, married and a mother of seven: five girls and two daughters. All of my children could not attend school initially due to our family's poor economic conditions but now I have enrolled three of them in school. My husband runs a lumberyard and needs a loan to buy wood in bulk. My group members are:

Nasreen B. who needs this loan to expand her fruit-selling business,

Sharifan and Sughran B. who will buy a donkey cart each with their shares of the loan; and

Nazira B. who is borrowing money to help run her restaurant.

All these women are hardworking entrepreneurs and can be trusted to invest their loans in their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy wood for a lumberyard

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Kodjo A. was born in 1982 in Lomé, where he continues to live. A bachelor, he opened a cafeteria-cafe, financed by his meager savings. So as to improve this endeavor, he is asking for a loan which will aid him in purchasing sufficient provisions for his cafeteria-cafe so as to run smoothly, such as milk, sugar, coffee, and eggs among others. With these provisions, he hopes to expand his current cafeteria-cafe into a restaurant, because his customer demand is very high. Completing this project will make it so that he does not have to go to the market every day, which leaves him more time to run his store and will result in higher revenue which he sorely needs to improve his daily standard of living.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur A. Kodjo est né en 1982 et réside à Lomé. Célibataire, il détient une cafétéria financée par ses maigres moyens. A partir de ce projet, il sollicite un prêt afin de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante de lait, sucre, café, œufs et autres, et faire d’autres provisions pour un restaurant sur la demande de sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettre de ne plus aller tous les jours au marché et ainsi augmenter ses revenus en vue d’améliorer ses conditions de vie

loans.use: To buy provisions for his cafeteria-cafe.

loans.name: Comite Los Arrabales Group

texts.en:
This comité of women called “Barrio Los Arrabales” has arisen with the help of another committee of women entrepreneurs. Today this group has nineteen members and their businesses range from convenience stores to hair salons, clothing and food sales, and mending and making clothing.

These women do what they can to keep the money coming in. They all support each other by working in this committee and together they ask for loans and pay their loans back. This system works because they are all friends who are invested in each other’s businesses and who care about each other’s personal lives.

The women are asking for a loan today to keep their businesses running. The money will be divided amongst the women according to how much each needs and will be used to buy ingredients for preparing food, for clothing, and household goods.

loans.use: To buy flour, canned goods, milk, drinks, pieces of clothing, buttons, zippers, thread, fabric, shoes, hair products, baked goods, and baking ingredients.

loans.name: Manzar

texts.en:
G. Manzar sells fruit and vegetables in a shop that is close to her house. She lives with her son and her husband. She has been in this business for 7 years and this is the first time that she has needed a loan. Her son has an old car that they use when they go to wholesale points of the city. Her husband retired and he just joined her in trying to improve their business together.

They need funds to repair the fruit shop from the inside and outside so it looks nice. They also would like to add a couple of shelves. People that live near her buy fruits and vegetables only from her to support her business.

loans.use: To repair and improve her fruit and vegetable shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ahliba

texts.fr:
Madame Ahliba B. was born in 1966. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a saleswoman of food products, an activity that has been very profitable but still needs a larger investment. To better satisfy her customers, Madame B. is asking for a loan that will allow her to reinforce her purchasing power and to buy larger stocks of corn and rice. This will allow her to see her revenue increase and better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame B. Ahliba est née en 1966, mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse des produits alimentaires, une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite plus de fonds. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientele, Madame B. Ahliba sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de renforcer son pouvoir d’achat et constituer un stock de mais.et de riz. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et de mieux s’occuper des besoins de sa famille

loans.use: To stock corn and rice.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B. is married with her own house and two children, ages 10 and 15. They are in school while she works in a convenience store of her own. She sells various goods and has a good amount of meat that she sells as well. This makes her business competitive.

She is asking for a loan today to help her pay all the necessary bills including electricity and water, however, she wishes to invest most of the money in buying necessary goods like flour, oil, rice, and yerba mate.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, flour, rice, Yerba Mate, and pasta.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Zulma R. is a single mother of two children. She lives in the San Roque neighborhood of Encarnacion with her younger daughter. The other daughter is married and living with her husband. She only hopes that her younger daughter will continue with schooling and go on to have a profession in life.

For more than 12 years, Zulma has owned a store in a good number of clientele since she has been in business for so many years running, and she wants help now to expand her store. With the loan she will buy more remedies in bulk and therefore have the ability to charge less, making her business more competitive.

loans.use: To buy natural remedies at a good price

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on July 9, 1982, Mr. Ayaovi Z. is a young electrician for a building unit. He still lives and works in Lomé, in the district of N'Kafu. From a rather poor family, he was only recently able to finish his apprenticeship diploma. Very ambitious, he is asking for a loan which will allow him to purchase materials he needs for work and to open a workshop with the goal to exercise his trade to its full potential. This will make it possible for him to expand his business and take charge of his career and his future.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né à Lomé le 09 Juillet 1981, Monsieur Z. Ayaovi est un jeune électricien en bâtiment et réside à Lomé au quartier N’Kafu. Issu d’une famille très pauvre, il a tout récemment eu son diplôme de fin d’apprentissage. Très ambitieux, il sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acquérir les matériels et outils de travail et ouvrir un atelier afin d’exercer pleinement son métier. Ceci lui permettra de mieux s’épanouir et se prendre en charge

loans.use: To purchase materials he needs for work.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokouvi K. was born in Lomé on December 31, 1979. He is married and the father of two children, with four other children in his care. A driver by profession, he works for a third party as a taxi driver and makes daily returns. Through this project, he is asking for a loan of $1,000 with which to buy his own vehicle so that he can fully enjoy the fruits of his labor. This will enable him to better meet the needs of his family and grant him financial independence.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Kokouvi est né à Lomé le 31 décembre 1979. Marié, il est père de 2 enfants, il a en charge quatre 04) autres enfants. Chauffeur de profession, il travail pour un tiers comme conducteur de taxi et fait les recettes journalières. A travers se projet, il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour acquérir un véhicule de transport propre à lui-même afin de jouir pleinement des fruits de son travail. Cela lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Kuña Aty De Ita Group

texts.en:
The beginning of the group Kuña Aty was in November 2006. One of the members, Hermogena T., began this group of women entrepreneurs, most of whom were neighbors and all whom were friends. All of the women were interested because they all wanted to support each other in their different businesses including: grocery, crafts, drinks, fruits, and lingerie and basket sales.

Kuña Aty has a total of 16 women entrepreneurs who meet regularly to collect the loan payments and discuss their businesses. Each woman takes home the appropriate amount of money she needs for her business. Together they are aksing for a loan to help increase their businesses profits. With the money they will buy goods like food, baking goods, and clothing items.

loans.use: buy goods like food, baking goods, and clothing items.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.fr:
A paternal orphan, Mr. Alfred A. was born in Lomé on September 14, 1963, is married and has four children. After high school he trained as a farmer, specializing in the rearing of pigs and small ruminants. Gifted in pig farming, he is requesting financing to increase the size of the shelter he uses for raising pigs and also start breeding other kinds of animal that are particularly requested by his customers. Achieving this dream will allow him to better satisfy his customers and increase his income in order to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Orphelin de père, Monsieur A. Alfred est né à Lomé le 14 septembre 1963, marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il suit une formation en agriculture avec spécialisation en élevage de porcins et de petits ruminants. Doué dans l’élevage du porc, il sollicite un financement afin d’élargir sa superficie d’exploitation en loge de porcs et également procéder à l’accouplement d’autres races surtout demandées par sa clientèles. La réalisation de ce rêve lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus en vue de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: Pig Farming

loans.name: Javid

texts.en:
Javid M. has been reselling cars for 10 years. He is an expert mechanic. In his business, he purchases one car at a time, performs a tune up, and any major repairs that are necessary. Then he details and resells the car for profit.

Mr. M. is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam and his business is in Baku. He is married and has two children. The car pictured is a good vehicle that will bring him a substantial profit, but he needs this loan to buy used spare parts. Javid is a community man who provides reliable vehicles to other IDPs in his community.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Of Ita Group

texts.en:
This group of women is named Kuña Katupyry of Ita, and it was begun in October 2006 by a woman who wanted to help her neighbors and friends increase the profits from their businesses. She gathered them together and now they are working with Fundación Paraguaya to increase their business capacities. They all work independently and sell things like groceries, clothing, cosmetics, and home goods.

At the moment the group is made up of 15 women entrepreneurs and was formed in the city of Capiata. They meet regularly to discuss business methods, learn about good business practices with a representative from Fundación Paraguaya, and support each others’ business and their families. Today, they are asking for a loan to increase their merchandise.

loans.use: buying business goods like clothing, shirts, pants, perfumes, facial creams, food, meat, refreshments, and baking goods

loans.name: Neli

texts.en: Neli M. lives with her husband in the town of Smolian. She works in a garment factory that encourages its employees to do some work at home and thus generate additional payments. Neli wants to be able to work at home but she needs to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Born in 1950, Mrs. Akouvi Agathe G. is married and has three children. A seamstress by profession, she runs her business out of a straw hut as her means are too limited to have a workroom worthy of this title. She is requesting a loan to rent a workroom, buy some sewing machines and improve her set-up so that she will have a workplace that is more agreeable to her clientele, which keeps growing. Achieving this project will enable her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1967, Madame G. Akouvi Agathe est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Couturière de profession, elle exerce son activité sous une paillote car ses moyens sont très limités pour avoir un atelier digne de ce nom. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer un atelier, acheter des machines et mieux s’installer afin de rendre plus agréable son lieu de travail à sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière

loans.use: To rent a workroom and buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a craftsman, he makes hats for the Cholitas* and his wife weaves shawls for them.

Together, they also have a groceries store in the area of Villa Ingenio, city of El Alto. These 2 activities generate an income that allows them to support their 4 children (ages 12, 9, 5 and 2).

Antonio would like to use the loan to buy more supplies for his grocery store in order to increase his sales and income. He currently sells basic commodity products like bread, eggs, candies and drinks.

This is the first time he asks for a loan and the credit evaluation of Impro authorizes him to get it.

(*Note from the translator: Cholita is a Bolivian native woman that wears her waist-length hair in braids connected together at the ends with tassled tullmas, a traditional multilayered skirt (called pollera), a wide shawl (called manta) that accompanies the skirt and a small felt bowler hat balanced on top of her head. For an image you can check: http://www.lubbockonline.com/images/20070815/82730_512.jpg)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Description Antonio es artesano; él confecciona sombreros para cholitas y la esposa teje mantas de cholitas; también tienen una tienda de abarrotes. Estas dos actividades generan sus ingresos económicos para cubrir la manutención de sus cuatro hijos de 12, 9, 5 y 2 años de edad; viven en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que Antonio requiere en esta oportunidad será utilizado para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes de esa forma incrementara sus ingresos familiares. Una tienda de abarrotes es una tienda de barrio donde los vecinos encuentran pan, refrescos, huevos, jugos, dulces, y otros productos básicos de la canasta familiar.

Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le faculta para acceder al mismo. .

loans.use: To buy more supplies for his grocery store

loans.name: Réhinatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Réhinatou A. was born in 1971, is married and has seven children. Her main activity is selling bean fritters and millet porridge, commonly known as ‘coco’ and very popular here, especially for breakfast and as an afternoon snack. Lacking sufficient means, she is requesting a loan that she can use to buy cans of oil and bags of beans, millet and sugar in order to better satisfy her customers. This will enable her to increase her income for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Réhinatou est née en 1971, mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de beignets de haricot et de bouillie de mil communément appelée « coco » et très appréciés chez nous surtout pour le petit déjeuner et le goûter. N’ayant pas de moyens suffisants, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter des sacs de haricot, de mil, de sucre et de bidons d’huile pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus pour le mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use: To obtain supplies of millet and beans

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta sells food in a food stand in the area of San Pedro in the City of La Paz. Her husband is a craftsman and makes shoes. That is how together they generate the necessary income to cover their family expenses, including the school expenses of their 2 children.

Antonieta and her family live in the area of Las Nieves in the City of La Paz.

Antonieta requests the loan to buy wholesale potatoes, rice and noodles. These are the main ingredients she uses to cook and their price has increased due to the “Niña phenomenon* that has affected Bolivia.

This is the 5th loan Antonieta has requested from Impro and her credit history allows her to get it. All her prior loans have been completely paid.

(*Note from the translator: La Niña phenomenon is blamed for fueling torrential rains and massive flooding across Bolivia's Amazon region during recent months)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonieta es vivandera; tiene un puesto de venta de comida en la zona San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. El esposo es artesano y confecciona calzados y de esta manera logran sus ingresos con los que cubre los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Las Nieves de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito requerido será utilizado para capital de trabajo y comprar papa, arroz y fideo por cantidad para poder abastecerse porque estos productos son su materia prima y están subiendo de precio por el fenómeno de la niña que castigo a Bolivia.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle otro préstamo. Los cuatro créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: To buy wholesale potatoes, rice and noodles

loans.name: Muradkhan

texts.en:
Muradkhan is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam. He owns an appliance repair shop. Most of his business comes from buying used refrigerators and reselling them.

Muradkhan has been in this business for five years. During this time, he has learned that used refrigerators are cheaper in the winter time. He is asking for this loan so that he can purchase some old, cheap refrigerators now and resell them in the summer for a large profit.

His uncle, who is fixing a washing machine in the photo, is a partner in business. Muradkhan is single.

loans.use: To buy refrigerators to repair and resell.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao A. was born in Gapé (Zio prefecture) in 1975. Coming from a very poor family, he did not have the opportunity to go to school. He is married and the father of two children. In addition to agriculture, he runs a little farm of small ruminants and poultry. He thus does not have the means to build a sheep pen, obtain water troughs, mangers and the like. He is requesting financial support in the form of a loan. Achieving this project will help him and his family truly flourish.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Yao est né à Gapé (P/Zio) en 1975. Issu d’une famille très pauvre, il n’avait pas eu la chance d’étudier. Marié, il est le père de deux (2) enfants. En plus de l’agriculture, il entretien un petit élevage de petits ruminants et de volailles. Ainsi, ses moyens ne lui permettent pas de faire face aux besoins de construction de paillote de bergerie, de se doter des abreuvoirs, mangeoires et divers. Il sollicite un appui financier sous forme de crédit. La réalisation de ce projet contribuera à son plein épanouissement et à celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To  build and fit out a sheep pen

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona is a traveling saleswoman who sells spices (garlic, oregano, whole chiles, etc.) from province to province. Her husband provides DJ services at social events. These two activities make up their main sources of income with which they support their three children. Their home is located in the Villa Esperanza zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan Simona is requesting will be used to buy equipment for the DJ business, specifically a sound mixer which will help improve performance so they can offer better service to their customers.

This is her fourth loan with IMPRO; her prior record allows her to be approved for this request. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and has paid off her previous loans without any problem.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglsi, Kiva volunteer.

Simona es comerciante viajera interprovincial de condimentos (ajo, orégano, ají entero, etc.) el esposo presta servicio de amplificación y ameniza todo tipo de eventos sociales. Estas dos actividades constituyen sus principales fuentes de ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de ellos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Esperanza de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que Simona solicita será utilizado para compra de equipo para el servicio de amplificación, específicamente una mezcladora de sonido, la misma que ayudara para el mejor rendimiento de la amplificación y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por la prestataria. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005 y ha cancelados sus previos préstamos sin ninguna dificultad.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her husband's DJ business.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Born in May 1970, Mrs. Eya G. has been selling condiments and basic need goods since childhood. She is the mother of four (4) children, all of whom have been in her care after her husband abandoned the family. Disciplined in the management of her business, she was able to repay her previous loan. She is asking for a new loan in order to enlarge her store display and to stock up on food products in order to better serve her clientele. This will allow her to fulfill all her responsibilities with respect to her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en Mai 1970, Madame G. Eya est revendeuse des condiments et de produits de premières nécessités depuis son enfance. Mère de quatre (4) enfants, qui sont tous à sa charge après l’abandon du foyer conjugal par leur père. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activité, elle a su bien rembourser son crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite de nouveau un crédit en vue d’agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner en produit alimentaire afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’assurer toute sa responsabilité envers ses enfants

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.en:
This group of dedicated women entrepreneurs goes by the name of Maria Auxilidora and operates out of the town of Ita. They were started in the month of August 2006 by the president of the club, Maria Ana A.. She began by contacting her neighbors and friends with the idea of coming together and working with Fundación Paraguaya to obtain a loan.

Together these women work, meet weekly, and support each other in their businesses. There is a strong bond between the women in the group both in business and in friendship. The solidarity of their group is what makes them great candidates for a loan. The money of the loan will go towards buying more goods to be sold in their individual businesses. Each woman will receive the appropriate amount needed for her business and together they will work to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amina A. was born in January 1973 in Gapé (Prefecture Zio), and has been selling smoked fish since she abandoned her studies in 1983. The mother of four (4) children, she takes care of her children by herself, thanks to the income from her business selling smoked fish. Mrs. A. struggles to run her business and make her children happy. She is asking for a loan in order to increase her buying power and to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Amina née en Janvier 1973 à Gapé (P/Zio), est revendeuse de poissons fumés depuis qu’elle a abandonnée les classes en 1983. Mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle est seule à s’occuper des enfants grâce aux revenus de son commerce de poissons fumés. Madame A. se bat pour mettre en œuvre son activité et rendre heureux ses enfants. Elle sollicite un financement pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To sell fish

loans.name: Atilana

texts.en:
Amilana is a 71-year-old mother of four. All of her children are grown and live in Argentina. For thirty-eight years she has worked as a distributor of charcoal. She and her husband both sell it, in their convenience store which is connected to their house and using their truck.

With the price of gasoline going up, many people depend on their supply of charcoal to help them prepare meals. The loan that she is asking for today is to invest in more charcoal to sell. The demand for her product has been going up and with the coming winter season, she is expecting charcoal sales to continue to increase.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in 1968 in Gapé, where he now works as a farmer. A married father of two (2), he also has three (3) of his brother's children as apprentices. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. He owns a large field of pineapples, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou cultivateur à Gapé est né en 1968 dans la même localité. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants il a en charge trois (3) autres enfants de son frère en apprentissage. Son activité principale est l’agriculture qui lui procure le nécessaire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il dispose d’un vaste champ d’ananas mais à cause de la pauvreté du sol et des insectes il n’arrive plus à satisfaire la demande du marché. Très travailleur, il sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et des insecticides

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio and Eulalia are married with four older children. Three of them are independent and one still lives at home. Together the two have a farm which they work on, and they sell the food that they cultivate. With the money they made from selling their simple fruits and vegetables, the pair was able to invest in a truck in which to transport their goods door-to-door.

Now the couple is looking to expand their business even more and have a larger variety of fruits and vegetables than what they grow and sell. The loan they are asking for will be used for that purpose, to help them increase their sales and thus their income.

loans.use: To buy various fruits and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
At 42 years of age, Mrs. Akouvi A. is married and has five (5) children. Abandoned by her husband, she turned to agriculture to support her family. She is very happy with her work, and wants to see her children educated at any cost. To improve the yield of her farming, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the soil in order to increase production. This will allow her to raise her income and improve the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 42 ans, Madame A. Akouvi est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Abandonné par son mari, elle s’adonne à l’agriculture pour satisfaire sa famille. Elle est très contente de son activité et veut à tout prix voir ses enfants scolarisés et instruits. Pour améliorer le rendement de son activité agricole, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants pour ses terres en vue d’une bonne production. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour le mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Fanni

texts.en:
Fanni is a hairdresser and a mother of two. Her husband is in the business of repairing computers. She has been in the business of hairstyling for 15 years now and it is her passion.

Seven years ago, after a lot of hard work and savings, she was able to become independent from the business where she worked, and now has her own salon in a rented venue. She dreams of one day owning her own salon.

For now she is increasing the diversity of merchandise her salon. She has invested in clothing to be sold in her shop to bring in more income. Fanni is asking for a loan today to invest in more supplies for her salon. She will buy goods like shampoo, hair dye, and various hair creams.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, hair creams, and dyes

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a hard-working mother of four. She runs a small grocery store out of her house where she sells general necessities. Her husband is a potter who makes various decorative goods out of clay.

For seven years now she has run her grocery store and it has continued to increase in business and income. Graciela’s next goal is to save enough money from her work, along with her husband’s work, to construct a second story on their house.

She is asking for a loan today to help her flourishing business. Her plan is to buy rice, sugar, flour, general drinks and baked goods for her shop. With the increase in goods she will be better able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, baked goods and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a carpenter. He has worked 15 years in the business and has worked hard to save enough money to buy the house where he lives now. Currently, he has the necessary materials he needs to make furniture, windows, and doors.

The only thing that he lacks which would make his business prosper is a truck to transport his goods. With the investment in a truck, he will be able to expand his area for attracting customers and facilitate his business by delivering the furniture he makes.

However, he is taking small steps first and will use the money that he is asking for to buy the necessary amount of wood needed to continue making his furniture. After a little time, Juan Carlos feels sure that he will be able to obtain the truck that will help his business grow.

loans.use: to buy wood for building furniture

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a proud mother of six children all of whom live on their own, independent from their mother and father. At the moment, Marcelina is dedicated to the making and sale of cigars. She learned this skill when she was very young since her entire family is dedicated to the same business.

She sells her products throughout the country in different locations and there is a great demand for her product. With the loan that she is asking for today, Marcelina will purchase more tobacco in bulk which will allow her to sell her goods at a lower price.

loans.use: to buy tobacco to hand-make cigars

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata K. is very grateful to Kiva.  The last loan obtained from Kiva increased her stock of fish and she is happy that she no longer purchases fish on credit.  The loan helped her build her capital.  Aminata said that one of her children was sick when her husband was away.  Because of the loan, she was able to make enough profit and pay for the medical bills herself.  She is thankful to Kiva and has completed her repayments.  She is requesting another loan of Le.800, 000.

loans.use: Aminata is so proud of her accomplishments from her previous Kiva loan and would like to continue experiencing the positive change the additional capital provides.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Being a young member of the 15th branch, Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 33 years old, is very good at doing business. Realizing that TYM Fund policy was very suitable for her family conditions, from the beginning, she borrowed 60 USD to breed pigs. By using husks wasted from the husking machine as pig mash, her breeding plan became more effective and expanded. Currently, she has 18 pigs (about 1000 kg) ready to be released with an intended profit of 2000 USD. Besides, she is investing in making ice-cream machines, and general store, etc. Therefore, her family income is very stable. Her wish is to borrow more money to expand her breeding plan and other businesses, increasing family income. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy pig mash and unhusked rice. Mrs T. is living with her husband and 2 children in Yen Lac, Vinh Phuc.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là một trong những thành viên trẻ của chi nhánh 15 nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị T., 33 tuổi, là người làm kinh tế giỏi. Nhận thức được lợi ích của Quỹ Tình thương là rất phù hợp với điều kiện gia đình nên ngay từ những ngày đầu chị T. đã vay 60USD đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Tận dụng cám bã từ việc làm máy xay xát, nấu rượu làm thức ăn chăn nuôi nên dự án chăn nuôi lợn ngày càng mang lại hiệu quả và được đầu tư lớn hơn. Hiện tại chị có 18 con lợn thịt (khoảng hơn 1 tấn) sắp cho xuất chuồng dự tính thu khoảng 2000USD. Ngoài ra chị còn đầu tư vào mở cửa hàng làm máy kem, bán hàng ... nên thu nhập của gia đình rất tốt và ổn định. Mong muốn của chị T. là được vay những mức vốn lớn hơn để mở rộng dự án chăn nuôi - kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua thức ăn gia súc vào gạo về xay xát. Chị T. hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Yên Lạc, Vĩnh Phúc.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs and unhusked rice

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is the proud mother of three grown children who are living independently and are successful. She has been married to her husband Jacinto for many years and together they have made their living raising chickens.

Six years ago they increased their business and were able to give employment to two other people in the community as well. Over the years they have formed a great clientele and are known for the excellent quality of their chickens.

Now they have expanded their business and also run a general store where they sell the chickens along with other food. Their small convenience store is also successful, however, Irene is looking to expand. She wants to use the meat that they raise to make Paraguayan delicacies to sell as snacks in their shop. With the loan, Irene will buy the necessary ingredients to make the food to sell.

loans.use: buying ingredients to make empanada and milonesas, along with general refreshments

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata C. sells fish.  With her previous loan from Kiva, she increased her stock.  She is very grateful that her profit has increased.  She said that the most important difference that the loan has made on her business is her ability to purchase the stock in cash.  After the second loan, she will be able to build sufficient capital for her business.  She said, “The Kiva loan saved me from the bondage of debts to suppliers without benefit.”  Fatmata is requesting for another loan of Le.1, 000,000.

loans.use: Fatmata is enjoying the new financial freedom she has with her business and wants to further expand her stock of fish to ensure her profits continue to grow..

loans.name: Gulbeniz

texts.en: Gulbeniz S. is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Fizuli. She is married and has five children. During Soviet times, she worked in a textile workshop making sheets. She lost her job when she became an IDP. This is when she started buying wholesale fabric and selling it door to door. Now she buys both finished and unfinished fabric. She sews the unfinished fabric into bed sheets in order to make a greater profit. Gulbeniz has an IDP neighbor that she would like to hire for her business. She will use this loan to buy inventory for this new employee to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of new inventory for her fabric store

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi D., 52 years old, is an exemplary member of the branch. She was one among the first 5 members of TYM Fund in the area. She also encouraged other people to join the Fund. Her early plan was to invest in breeding pigs and work on rice field. However, since there was policy allowing people to exchange the rice field for other-purpose land, she bravely invested money and effort in transforming the land into the fish ponds and orchards. Her family income from the fish ponds in 2007 was approximately 3000 USD. Currently, her family is working on 3 rice fields, 4 fish ponds. Therefore, she is very busy at this time. However, she still manages to find some spare time to join activities of the area. She is elected to be the head of her living area. Her husband is very sympathetic with her work and is a great help to her. Her business plan is going very well; therefore, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more fishes and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đường Thị D., 52 tuổi, là một thành viên gương mẫu của cụm. Ngay từ những ngày đầu khi Quỹ về, chị là một trong 5 thành viên đầu tiên, ngoài ra chị còn tích cực vận động nhiều thành viên khác cùng tham gia. Dự án ban đầu chỉ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và làm ruộng nhưng từ khi hợp tác xã có chính sách dồn điền đổi thửa, gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư tiền của, công sức cải tạo ruộng đào ao thả cá kết hợp trồng cây ăn quả. Thu nhập từ cá năm 2007 vừa qua khoảng 3000USD. Hiện tại gia đình cấy 3 mẫu lúa, gần 4 mẫu ao thả cá, hàng ngày chị tập trung toàn bộ thời gian vào công việc nên rất tất bật. Mặc dù vậy chị vẫn dành thời gian cho việc đi sinh hoạt và các công việc chung của cụm được chị em tín nhiệm bầu làm cụm trưởng. Chồng chị rất hiểu và tạo mọi điều kiện để chị hoàn thành công việc chung. Dự án đang trên đà phát triển nên chị D. tiếp tục xin vay 950USD mua cá giống và thức ăn.

loans.use: Buy fishes and food for them

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: “God bless the initiators of this wonderful program,” exclaimed Adama.  "The loan has improved my family livelihood.”  She proudly said she was able to send one of her sons to college and has paid all the tuition fees and this is purely from the profit.  She added that she would very grateful if Kiva could grant her more loan capital to expand her business.  She sells various food items in the market, and there is a lot of demand.  She is requesting for Le.800, 000.  Adama has completed paying her previous loan.

loans.use: Adama needs an additional loan for expansion of her business so she can continue paying for her son's college tuition fees.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
When the TYM Fund came to Thanh Lâm village in May, 2000, Mrs. Hoàng Thị Tất, 49 years old, checked out the organization then decided to join. At that time, the family’s economy was in deep hardship. Her oldest son just got a construction job, and there was nothing else besides farming a little patch of rent rice paddy. For dwelling, they got a modest [i]three section[/i] hut. She took out loan to invest in her new business, trading vegetable and grain. With her income, income from her son’s construction job and together with a loan from her relatives, she is building their first house which costs 10,000USD. This time she is applying a loan of 950USD to buy more grain. The monthly family’s income is 22-USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tháng 5 năm 2000, khi Quỹ Tình thương về xã Thanh Lâm, sau khi tìm hiểu, chị Hoàng Thị Tất, 49 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên đăng ký tham gia. Điều kiện gia đình chị lúc ấy thuộc diện khó khăn, con trai lớn mới đi làm, ngoài vài sào ruộng khoán ra chị cũng không biết làm gì thêm. Ngôi nhà 3 gian tạm bợ, tuềnh toàng tránh mưa nắng rất khổ cực. Sau khi tham gia vay vốn, chị Tất luôn sử dụng đúng mục đích và có hiệu quả, con trai lớn đi xây dựng cũng có ý thức tiết kiệm cho gia đình. Ngoài ra chị cũng có thêm nghề phụ là hàng ngày thu mua rau ngô bao tử đặt hàng cho khách hàng Hà nội. Sau bảy năm tham gia Quỹ với sự tự tin, cần cù, chịu khó, chị Tất đã tích lũy được một số vốn. Cộng với vốn vay họ hàng, chị đang xây dựng căn nhà mới rất khang trang trị giá hơn 10000USD. Khi chúng tôi đến hai vợ chồng chị niềm nở tiếp chúng tôi và không giấu được niềm vui mừng khi ngôi nhà mơ ước của anh chị đang được cất lên. Tâm sự của anh chị là tiếp tục gắn bó với Quỹ để xây dựng cuộc sống gia đình ngày càng ấm no, tốt đẹp hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Tất xin vay 950USD để thu mua rau ngô bao tử. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 220USD.

loans.use: Buy grain

loans.name: Precila

texts.es:
Mrs. Precila A. R. belongs to the Communal Bank Señor de los Milagros de Chiquian. She sells candy and also makes and sells sweaters. She sells her products from her home and on the corner of the main plaza in Chiquian, in Bolognesi province, Ancash state.

With a previous loan of S/1500 nuevos soles (unit of money in Peru), she has grown her business and income. With this loan of S/1500 nuevos soles which will be repaid in 8 months, she will invest in buying candy and yarn to knit sweaters.

She is 38 years old, has 5 children, and her income allows her to educate her children and support the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Precila A. R. pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chiquian ,se dedica a la venta de golosinas y también a la confección y venta de chompas Sus productos los vende es su domicilio y las golosinas en la esquina de la plaza de armas del distrito de Chiquian, Provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su negocio y sus ingresos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, lo invertirá en comprar golosinas e hilos para tejer las chompas.

Ella tiene e 38 años de edad, conviviente tiene 5 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos y apoyar en los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Buy candy and yarn

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Giới, 38 years old, lives with her husband and two school age children in Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. When the agricultural expansion plan introduced to all provinces, Mrs. Giới has soon realized that that was a very rare opportunity. While other families might use their monies to build houses, she wisely used her money to invest in her farm. The investment brings her a handsome income. Currently she has a nice half acre farm which produces vegetable for the Hanoi’s markets. The product impresses the Office of Agricultural Encouragement of the Department of Agriculture and the office endorses it as an agricultural model for the province. Recently she invested 1,500USD to purchase 500 grapefruit trees for her current project. This time she is applying for a loan of 950USD to purchase more fruit trees and fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Giới, 38 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học tại Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. Khi việc xây khu công nghiệp phát triển tại các tỉnh, chị Giới đã sớm nắm bắt được điều kiện và cơ hội của gia đình mà không phải ai cũng có thể làm được. Trong khi nhiều gia đình đã dùng tiền đền bù xây dựng nhà cửa, mua sắm tiện nghi, thì chị Giới và chồng đã dùng đồng tiền đó vào việc cải tạo ruộng đất, dồn điền đổi thửa thành khu tập trung trồng trọt các loại rau sạch cung cấp cho thị trường. Số tiền đầu tư vào dự án cũng khá lớn và đang cho thu nhập cao. Hiện tại chị Giới có 7 sào vườn trồng các loại rau cung cấp cho thị trường Hà Nội và các vùng khác. Sản phẩm của gia đình chị được Phòng khuyến nông, sở nông nghiệp chọn làm dự án điển hình và nhân rộng ra toàn tỉnh. Mới đây chị Giới còn đầu tư 1500USD đầu tư mua 500 cây bưởi Diễn trồng quy hoạch theo mô hình trang trại, dự kiến sau vài ba năm sau sẽ cho thu nhập. Dự án lớn, dám nghĩ, dám làm và rất năng động đó là cảm nhận của người viết bài khi đến thăm mô hình của chị. Tương lai còn đang ở phía trước vẫn còn không ít những khó khăn, vất vả nhưng chị Giới luôn tin tưởng vào sự thành công của dự án. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD mua cây giống và phân bón.

loans.use: Buy fruit trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finish building two rooms to be rented.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
Roger lives with his family in the La Fuente neighborhood. Since he was very young he has worked in metal shops, where he acquired enough experience to become independent and start up his own business. He has had his business for more than 10 years and has a good number of clients he does work for. He is an expert in making iron gates and doors as well as glass windows and sliding doors among other things.

His work has allowed him to grow in his chosen field, acquiring good tools and work utensils. Together with his wife they are raising their three children, all of them minors and students in primary school. His wife helps him with household expenses; she sells food and natural soft drinks from home. In this way they have been able to improve their family´s standard of living. For the type of work which Roger does he needs an electric soldering machine, which will be of great use to give a better finish to the products he makes.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Roger habita con su familia en el barrio La Fuente, desde muy joven trabajó en talleres metalúrgicos, en donde adquirió suficiente experiencia que le sirvió para independizarse y montar su propio negocio, el cual ya tiene más de 10 años de tenerlo, posee un buen numero de clientes a quienes le trabaja, es un experto en elaborar verjas y portones de hierro, así como también ventanas de vidrio y puertas corredizas, entre otras cosas.

Su trabajo le ha permitido crecer en el ramo al cual se dedica, adquiriendo buenas herramientas y utensilios de trabajo. Junto a su esposa han sacado adelante a sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad, estudiantes de primaria. Su esposa le apoya con los gastos de la casa, la señora vende en su vivienda comida y refrescos naturales. De esta forma han logrado mejorar la condición de vida de su familia. Para el tipo de trabajo que realiza Roger necesita de una maquina soldadora eléctrica, la cual es de mucha utilidad para darle un mejor acabado al producto que realiza.

loans.use: Purchase an electric soldering machine.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Đạt, 38 years old, lives with husband and two children in Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. Same as other farmers in the area, life is harder when most of the farm land now converted to industrial plants. Seeing an opportunity in maize, she converted her little patch of rice daddy to a corn field. Besides her family’s production, she buys more maize from other family and delivers all to markets in Hanoi. In result, she has a little reputable business of trading maize. Though busy she still spends times with activities in the TYM Fund. This time she is applying a loan of 950USD to stock more maize. The average monthly income is 200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Đạt, 38 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. Cũng như nhiều gia đình khác trong cụm, khi ruộng nương ngày càng ít đi nhường chỗ cho các nhà máy, xí nghiệp thì càng khó khăn cho chị và các gia đình làm nông nghiệp khác. Thấy thị trường đang có nhu cầu rau ngô bao tử, chị Đạt đã chuyển toàn bộ số đất nông nghiệp còn lại sang trồng rau ngô bao tử. Ngoài việc sản phẩm của gia đình, chị Đạt còn thu mua thêm của các gia đình khác và tiêu thụ ở thị trường Hà nội. Giờ đây gia đình chị đã trở thành điểm thu mua, tiêu thụ khá lớn và rất có uy tín. Công việc nhiều, chạy chợ suốt ngày nhưng chị Đạt vẫn dành thời gian tham gia đầy đủ vào các buổi họp và các hoạt động chung của Quỹ Tình thương. Vòng vốn tới chị Đạt tiếp tục vay 950USD để thu mua rau ngô bao tử của các gia đình trong vùng. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị Đạt là 200USD.

loans.use: Buy small maize

loans.name: Primitiva Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. Primitiva Beatriz R. P. belons to the Communal Bank Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian. She sells alfajores, a caramel sandwich cookie, in different stores in the Chiquian area, Bolognesi province, Ancash state. She also sends orders of 500 alfajores to Lima.

With a previous loan of S/800 soles she has been able to grow her business and her income. With the current loan of S/1200 soles which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy flour, butter, sugar, and milk at wholesale prices.

She is 49 years old, a single mother of 4 children, and her income enables her to educate her children and pay her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Primitiva Beatriz R. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian”, ella se dedica a la venta D. alfajores los cuales son repartidos en las diferentes tiendas del distrito D. Chiquian, provincia D. Bolognesi, departamento D. Ancash. También envía pedidos D. 500 alfajores a la ciudad D. Lima.

Con el crédito anterior S/. 800.00 nuevos soles ha podido incrementado su negocio y sus ingresos. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 meses lo invertirá en la compra D. harina, manteca, azúcar y leche por mayor.

Ella tiene 49 años, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos y solventar los gastos del su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, sugar and milk

loans.name: Cruz Luciano

texts.es:
Cruz Luciano is 34 years old, married, and has one 4-year old child. He lives in Villa Reconciliación, a poor, semirural area with unpaved streets. 10 years ago he began a business selling car parts, and with the income he was able to expand his service. Today he sells lubricants, rims, tires, and has a tire service, where he repairs rims and tires. This business has enabled him to pay his household expenses. His wife helps by selling refreshments (beverages) from their home.

The business has a good location which enables him to get a good number of customers. The products Cruz offers are in high demand by taxis, buses, trucks, and cars, so he should have an amply supply on hand to meet the demands for his services. This loan will help him maintain his business and meet his customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Cruz Luciano tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo de 4 años, habita en el asentamiento de Villa Reconciliación, siendo esta una zona semirural, pobre, con calles sin pavimentar. Hace 10 años, inicia su negocio de venta de repuestos de vehículos, con el tiempo el mismo negocio le permitió expandirse, hoy en día cuenta con venta de lubricantes, llantas, neumáticos y tiene el servicio de vulcanización, en donde reparan llantas y neumáticos, esta actividad económica le ha permitido cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, su esposa para ayudarlo con todas las obligaciones que tienen que cumplir, vende refrescos en su vivienda.

El negocio se encuentra en una buena ubicación, lo que le permite captar un buen número de clientes. Los productos que ofrece el señor son bien demandados por taxis, buses, camiones y carros particulares, por lo tanto debe de contar con un buen numero de existencia para poder satisfacer la necesidad de dicho servicio, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener su negocio con lo que los clientes requieran.

loans.use: Buy lubricants, brake fluid, tires and rims

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca was a little girl when she began to learn about sales. In the city where she was born she used to sell chicha to help in her home. One she married, it was necessary to have income, so she opened a convenience store. She began little by little, with whatever she could buy to supply her store. So, with hard wrok, she was able to stock her store with a variety of products. She has since moved to a new locale, which was good for her, her family, and her business now is in its own locale and she doesn’t have to pay rent for a space. Now her store also has a bakery and small bazaar. She always has customers, and she has a dream with two her children of turning their great store in to a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde muy pequeña Francisca aprendió lo concerniente a las ventas. En su pueblo natal ella solía vender chicha para ayudar en su hogar. Una vez que se casó, la necesidad de contar con un ingreso fue más grande, lo cual la convenció de abrir una bodega. Fue empezando poco a poco, con lo único que podía comprar para abastecer a su tienda. Así, con su empeño, logro que su tienda este bien surtida de diversos productos. Hasta que llego el momento de mudarse a vivir en otro lado. Lo que fue bueno para ella, para su familia y para su negocio también pues ahora contaba con un local propio y no debía pagar renta por uno alquilado. Ahora su bodega se ha complementado con una panadería y un pequeño bazar. Los clientes nunca le faltan, pero el sueño de ella y de sus dos hijos es convertir su gran bodega en un minimarket.

loans.use: Convert a convenience store to a minimarket

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Janet Roxana

texts.es:
Mrs. Janet Roxana A. C. belongs to the Communal Bank Amigos Marcarinos. Her business is located in the Marcara market, in Carhuaz province, Ancash province, where she sells groceries, fruits, and vegetables.

With a previous loan of S/400 soles she bought groceries to stock her stall and thereby increase her income.

With this loan for S/800 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase: a sack of rice, bag of noodles, box of oil and vegetables to stock the business and increase sales.

Janet is 25 years old and her dream is improving her business. Her husband is a driver, offering taxi service to the Chanco Thermal Baths. Both work in order to educate their two children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Janet Roxana A. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigos Marcarinos”, su local se encuentra ubicado en el mercado del distrito de Marcara, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y también ofrece frutas y verduras.

Con el préstamo anterior S/. 400.00 compro abarrotes para surtir su puesto y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles el cual serà cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertira en la compra de : un saco de arroz, una bolsa de fideos, una caja de aceite y verduras para surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.

Ella tiene 25 años, su sueño es poder mejorar su negocio, su esposo ofrece el servicio de colectivos a los Baños Termales de Chancos, ambos trabajan para educar a sus dos hijos.

loans.use: Purchase a sack of rice, noodles and other products

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amalia A. sells hot dogs and soda pop in the Terminal market in León city. She began her business 8 years ago as a street vendor prior to establishing herself in her present locale.

She is a single mother, has one child, and is also responsible for supporting her aged mother. As her economic situation is in need, she approached Ceprodel to provide a loan that would enable her to purchase ingredients to prepare her delicious hot dogs. Today she needs to buy products such as bread, ketchup, onion, mustard, cream and sausage. So she has approached CEPRODEL again to ask for a loan and therefore improve her business and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El detalle de la actividad económica que se dedica la señora Amalia A. es a la venta de hot dogs y gaseosas en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León. Su negocio inicia desde hace 8 años ambulante en el mercado hasta establecerse en su localidad.

Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo y además con la responsabilidad de mantener a su mamá que es una humilde anciana. Debido a su situación económica que es muy baja, ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que le permiten la compra de los ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos hot dog. Hoy en día su necesidad es la compra de estos productos tales como pan, salsa de tomate, cebollas, mostaza, crema y chorizo. Para esto acude una vez mas a CEPRODEL para obtener los créditos y así mejorar la situación de su negocio y familia.

loans.use: Buy condiments for hot dog business

loans.name: Mujeres San Jardin De Jorge I Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Jardin de San Jorge arrive early for their meeting at the office of Friendship Bridge in Sololá, the region’s capital city, about a fifteen minute bus ride uphill from their town of San Jorge la Laguna. As they wait for the previous meeting to end, they greet each other with hugs and a chorus of ‘buenos dias’ and ‘como estas’, followed by excited chatter in their native language Kaqchiquel. As the other meeting lets out and the women begin to file in, the cream colored room becomes a canvas of brilliant colors, painted by the beautiful and intricate ‘huipiles’ (traditional woven blouses) that each woman wears.

These huipiles are just one of many trades that the women practice. Among the eighteen, about half of them dedicate their time to weaving and sewing skirts (like the ones in the picture), scarves, purses, belts, ribbons that get woven into long braids, as well as huipiles. Ten of the 18 women are asking for a group loan of 26,000 quetzales ($3425), ranging from $150 to $400 per person, five of whom will invest in thread for their artisan business (one of them was not able to be present for the photo). Two women have jewelry businesses, making beaded bracelets, necklaces, rings and earrings that they sell in the nearby tourism capital Panajachel. Two women have small stores, selling soft drinks, snacks, chicken and sausages. And one woman, who could not be at the meeting because she was sick, has a tortillería, and will invest in the ingredients necessary for making corn and flour tortillas.

The women of Mujeres Jardin have been with Friendship Bridge for two years, but have been together as a group much longer. They were previously with another institution, but were looking for a lower interest rate, which Friendship Bridge offers. They are more than happy with their new microfinance home, and are excited to see the long-term benefits for their business that less interest will bring. In addition to lower interest, one of their favorite things about Friendship Bridge is the education they receive—they are learning how to better run their business, care for their family, and have a real hope for the future (and they like that they get to play games while they learn, too!).

loans.use: These women would like to purchase thread for weaving, as well as beads for jewelry, supplies for a store, and ingredients for tortillas.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana P. sells personal items (hair accessories, necklaces, bracelets, wallets) in the La Terminal market in León (Nicaragua). She started her business 8 years ago with a capital of C$ 500 (five hundred córdobas net) that she had been saving since she was young.

Mrs. P. had economic difficulties obtaining the products that she sells in the market from the beginning since she had to use the little money she made to buy groceries for her family and to pay her two children's school. It's important to highlight that she is a single mother, but that has not stopped her from getting loans from Ceprodel. These loans have helped her to improve her economic situation and to keep her modest home. She has obtained 13 previous loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Ana P. es a la venta de cosméticos personales (colas, collares, pulseras, cartera) en el mercado la Terminal del departamento de León en Nicaragua. Su negocio lo inicia desde hace 8 años con un bajo capital de C$ 500 (Quinientos córdobas netos) obtenidos por sus ahorros propios desde su juventud.

Desde que inicio su negocio ha atravesado por difíciles circunstancias económicas para adquirir sus productos debido a que el poco dinero que gana lo invierte en la compra de los alimentos para su hogar y pago del colegio de sus dos hijos. Es necesario destacar que es madre soltera pero a pesar de esto, ha adquirido créditos en Ceprodel los cuales le han apoyado para mejorar su situación económica y continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar. Su record crediticio es de 13 créditos con la institución.

loans.use: Compra de los cosméticos personales

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Ndèye Fatou P. born in 1962 and married, is a member of the Khodoba Village Bank since 6 and a half years. Since joining Khodoba's microfinance program, she has never had a problem respecting her loan repayments and commitments. Madame P. wishes to expand and promote her business selling fruits and vegetables (such as cabbage, sorrel, aubergine, gombo, oranges, tangerines, mangoes, etc.). Hence, she is requesting her 8th loan for a term of 6 months with one bulk reimbursement payment at the end.

Mme Ndèye Fatou P., mariée, née le 30/07/1962 est membre du Banc villageois de Khodoba, six ans et demi. Depuis son entrée dans le Programme de Microfinance, Mme P. n'a jamaais eu de problème pour honorer ses engagements. Elle souhaite promouvoir son commerce de fruits et légumes (choux, oseille, aubergine, gombo, orange, mandarine, mangue, etc.). C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce 8ème prêt qu'elle propose de rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Franciasco Javier

texts.es:
Being a barber is very common in Nicaragua’s León city. In the Terminal market, Mrs. Francisco P. has been a barber for 15 years, taking care of men and women. He is known for being an efficient worker.

As with all jobs, this profession needs materials such as combs, gels, powders and clippers. Each one of these materials has an expense and therefore, Francisco first wisely approached Ceprodel 3 years ago and has benefited from loans that he has used to improve his business and support his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de barbería es muy común en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. En el mercado la Terminal, el señor Francisco P. se dedica a este negocio desde hace 15 años atendiendo ambos sexos y siendo muy reconocido por ser un eficiente trabajador.

Como todo trabajo, el desempeño de esta labor requiere de inversión en materiales como peines, gelatina, talco y maquina de cortar pelo. Cada uno de estos materiales tiene un costo y para esto, muy sabiamente el señor Francisco ha acudido a Ceprodel desde hace 3 años y ha sido beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su negocio y en el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: Buy barber shop supplies

loans.name: Sonia Nancy

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia Nancy H. F. is a member of the Communal Bank Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Feria. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Yungay market in Ancash state.

With a prior loan of S/800 soles, she increased her merchandise and income.

With this loan of S/500 soles which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy apples, bananas, pineapples, mandarin oranges, oranges, and grapes.

She is 34 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is a driver. Both work to support their home and educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia Nancy H. F. , es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial” ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras ,su local esta ubicado en el mercado de Yungay del departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su mercadería y sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra de : manzana, plátano, piña, mandarina, naranja, uva

Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente con 5 hijos su esposo es chofer, ambos se apoyan para sacar adelante su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Jerónima De Los Ánge

texts.es:
Mrs. Jeronima has been selling vegetables for 10 years. She began with her own savings, selling the Terminal market of León.

Her business selling vegetables began as a street vendor with a small cart selling throughout the market, and then she found her own locale but it was in poor condition. Jeronima is a married woman with 5 children to support, and they are the source of her strength to build a successful business.

She has benefited from working with Ceprodel for 2 years, assisting her with 13 loans that have greatly impacted her vegetable business’s growth and has raised her standard of living and that of her children. She needs a loan from Ceprodel to acquire a large amount of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica de la señora Jeronima es la venta de verduras variadas teniendo su negocio desde hace 10 años que dio inicio con sus propios ahorros en el mercado la Terminal de León.

Su negocio de venta de verduras lo inicia vendiendo ambulante con una pana pequeña por todo el mercado y posteriormente se ubica en un local propio pero en malas condiciones. Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella es una dama casada y con 5 hijos a su cargo por lo que ellos son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos en el negocio.

Ha sido beneficiada desde hace dos años por Ceprodel quien le asistió con financiamiento habiéndoles otorgado 13 créditos de los que le han impactado en un mayor crecimiento de su negocio de verduras y además ha mejorado su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos. Su necesidad por la que solicita el crédito a Ceprodel es por la adquisición de mayores volúmenes de verduras.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Josefa De La Concepc

texts.es:
The sale of fruits and vegetables is a very popular business in the market of La Terminal in Leon since there are many retailers that sell them in this town. One of them is Mrs. Josefa U., also known as Chepita, who has been working very hard in this business for the last 22 years.

Mrs. Chepita needs to buy the produce (fruits and vegetables) from the whole sale retail sellers but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason she's approaching Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan to purchase produce from the whole sale retail sellers. It's important to highlight that as of right now she has duly paid the five loans that she has requested in time and according to the conditions established.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Un negocio muy populas en el mercado de la Terminal en Leon es la venta de frutas y verduras debido a que existen muchas comerciantes que se dedican a este negocio en esta localidad. Una de ellas es la señora Josefa U. conocida comúnmente como chepita que desde hace 22 largos años se ha dedicado a este negocio muy esforzadamente

Una necesidad atravesada actualmente por chepita es la adquisición de sus productos (frutas y verduras) ya que los debe comprar a sus proveedores y al no contar con el dinero suficiente acude a Ceprodel para que le otorgue créditos para la compra de sus productos a sus proveedores. Es necesario destacar que actualmente tiene un record de 5 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma según lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchasing produce

loans.name: Karla Nadia

texts.es:
Mrs. Karla R. has been selling clothes of all sizes and for all ages for the last 15 years in the La Terminal market of León. She has worked very hard and has invested much money to obtain and keep her own slot in the market . She has three children who have been able to go on with their schooling thanks to their mom's little business.

She started her business by selling in the traveling market, out in the sun and getting physically worn out after walking for long periods of time. Little by little, she started saving in order to invest in a slot inside the market, and, after obtaining it, she kept on selling clothes, but in smaller quantities.

Mrs. Karla is facing the need of investment of clothes to sell in her slot in the market, and that's why she's approaching Ceprodel: to benefit from a loan and buy the clothes she needs to sell. This will help to keep her family together.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 15 años en la ciudad de León en el mercado la Terminal, la señora Karla R. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaños y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversión y esfuerzos por mantener este negocio. Es madre de tres hijos que gracias a su apoyo han logrado salir adelante en sus estudios.

El negocio lo comienza vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponiéndose al sol y al desgaste físico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenzó a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo y de aquí en adelante comenzó vendiendo la ropa pero en menores cantidades.

La necesidad que atraviesa la señora Karla es la inversión en compra de la mercadería es por eso que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos y de esta manera adquirir la ropa para comercializarla y así seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Clothing purchase

loans.name: Mujeres San Jardin De Jorge Ii Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Jardin de San Jorge have been with Friendship Bridge for two years now, but were previously with another finance institution. They weren’t happy there and set out to find lower interest rates, which they found with Friendship Bridge.

They are excited to see the long-term benefits these savings will bring to their business and are planning accordingly.

Of the eighteen women, half of them are artisans, weaving beautiful ‘huipiles’, traditional Mayan blouses as well as skirts, purses, and scarves.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 16,500 quetzales ($2175) ranging from $150 to $400 per person. Four of these women will invest in colorful threads to weave and sew.

One woman has a jewelry business, selling beaded bracelets, necklaces and earrings in the nearby tourist capital, Panajachel. In addition to purchasing materials, she plans to hire an employee to increase her production.

The other three women (one who could not be in the picture) have small ‘tiendas’, stores, where they sell soft drinks, snacks, chicken and sausages. These women have a goal of opening additional stores, where they will offer an expanded variety of products, ranging from food to basic commodity products.

All these women have children, sometimes as many as eight each and they dream of being able to better provide for their families.

With a lower interest rate, they are able to invest in more materials, therefore producing more and earning a higher income. With this added income, the women are able to provide better education for their children as they can purchase the books, clothing and supplies they need.

All of them whish that their children will finish school and become professionals so that they don’t have to struggle in the same ways they have had to.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving, beads for jewelry, and supplies for small stores.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Elena P.'s primary job has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past 23 years, in the market La Terminal in Leon. She began her business with an investment of $500 (500 cordobas), the result of her efforts to save enough money.

Her business began with her acting as a sort of traveling saleswoman, selling her wares on the streets of Leon, with a basket where she placed her fruits and vegetables. However, she noticed that her business was not able to support her family and her four small children. And so, with the hope of progressing little by little, she asked for a loan from Ceprodel, who offered her a friendly hand and helped her to push forward the success of her small business. Today, she has been able to develop her business, making a little bit more money, which is used to buy more products. But, she finds herself in a difficult position where she needs to ask for another loan in order to stock her fruits and vegetables, the larger quantity of products will mean more revenue and better support for her family.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Señora Maria Elena P. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 23 años ubicada en el mercado La Terminal en León. Inicia con un capital inicial de C$ 500 ( Quinientos córdobas), producto de sus esfuerzos en ahorros.

Su negocio lo inicia vendiendo ambulante en las calles de León con una pana donde colocaba sus verduras y frutas, sin embargo al darse cuenta que este negocio no le cubría para mantener a sus cuatro pequeños hijos, decide con la esperanza de ir progresando poco a poco solicitar préstamos a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le ayuda para salir adelante en su negocio. Hoy en día ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio obteniendo un poco mas de ingresos para la compra de las verduras y frutas. Pero aun atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir los productos para comercializarlos y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegatables

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix's call shop recently marked its one year anniversary. However, this isn't the only business that he runs. He also has a restaurant that is progressing with the help of his wife and children.

With the idea of making the most of the success that call shops were having a year ago, and with the goal of giving his children more work, he decided to open this business. Nevertheless, the competition is a factor that he has to fight every day because currently there are two call shops on every corner of the district where Felix lives. This is why he would like to implement more modern equipment in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El locutorio de Félix tiene recién un año en funcionamiento. Sin embargo, este no el único negocio que él maneja. A la par, tiene también un restaurante que con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos lo saca adelante.

Con la idea de aprovechar el éxito que tenían los locutorios hace un año y con el propósito de darles más trabajo a sus hijos, decidió abrir este negocio. No obstante, la competencia es un factor con el que debe lidiar diariamente ya que en la actualidad hay dos locutorios en cada esquina en el distrito donde Félix vive. Por esto, le gustaría implementar con equipos más modernos su local.

loans.use: To implement more modern equipment in his call shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria José

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Jose Rios is a native to the city of Leon. She runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables in the market La Terminal, in the beautiful city of Leon. Her business stands out because it is very popular and is visited by customers who sympathize with Maria because of her humble nature and attentiveness to her customers.

Mrs. Rios needs to purchase more fruits and vegetables from her wholesalers and this is why she is asking Ceprodel for a loan that would be used wholly for this purpose. It is important to point out that ever since she became involved in the loan process with Ceprodel she has been very punctual with her payments and consistent with agreed upon requirements and rules.
