Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Maria José R. originaria de la ciudad de León, se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado la Terminal de esta bella ciudad. Su negocio se caracteriza por ser muy popular debido a que es muy visitada por clientes quienes se sienten muy identificada con ella por ser una muy humilde persona que atiende muy bien a sus clientes.

La necesidad de la señora R. es la compra de las frutas y verduras a sus proveedores y es por tal motivo que acude a CEPRODEL para que se le otorgue crédito y usarlo directamente en la compra de sus productos. Es de importancia destacar que desde que ha adquirido créditos con esta institución ha sido fiel con sus pagos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo Lopez is a gentleman, originally from the city of Leon and he has run a barbershop in the market La Terminal for 14 years now. He is married and has two small children who are school aged now. Alongside his wife, he fights for a better financial situation to give to his small nuclear family.

Currently, Mr. Pablo Lopez finds himself in a precarious position, because he needs to buy more tools for his barbershop like scissors, talcum powder, gels and combs, yet lacks sufficient funds. This is why he has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan that would allow him to improve his small business which would directly help him to continue to support his family.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Pablo L. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de León y que tiene su negocio de barbería en el mercado la Terminal desde hace 14 años. Es casado y con dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar y junto con su esposa lucha para mejorar la situación financiera de su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente la situación que atraviesa el señor Pablo L. es la necesidad de adquirir sus enseres de barbería como lo son tijeras, talco, gelatina, cepillo. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan mejorar la situación de su negocio y a la vez continuar manteniendo a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for his babershop

loans.name: Mujeres Chuisequec I Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Chuisequéc have traveled about an hour from their farming community of Concepción to the region’s capital city, Sololá, for their meeting at the Friendship Bridge office.

They gather quickly and expectantly, dressed in their traditional Mayan clothing, they calm their babies and whisper to each other in their native language, Kaqchiquel, as they wait. The loan officer begins, and all eyes are on her.

Mujeres Chuisequéc have been together for two years now. They began with three women and are now up to eighteen. The word spread quickly about the loans from Friendship Bridge and how they helped business, and the eighteen women in the room are eager and hopeful, ready to put their loans to good use.

All but two of them have small farms in which they grow potatoes, carrots, onions, radishes, beans, broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes, lemongrass, and chamomile. The farms are located in Concepción, an area with a temperate climate and a rich soil that allows for year-round farming. Ten of the women are asking for a group loan of 21,500 quetzales ($2825), ranging from $150 to $400, all which will be invested in farming. They will use the money to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

The women of Mujeres Chuisequéc have large families- up to ten kids each. As they go to sign their names, all but two of them sign with a thumbprint, indicating they cannot write. The women express that everything they do is for their children. They work hard every day and do everything possible to provide for their families so that their children can receive an education and have lives with more opportunities and far less suffering than what they have had to endure.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Petrona Marcelina

texts.es:
Ms. Petrona L. began her small business 20 years ago, selling fruits and vegetables in Leon, in the market La Terminal. Because she has a small site established and installations constructed in the market, one of the goals of Petrona is to now improve the infrastructure of her business.

She has asked Ceprodel for a loan that would allow her to purchase more fruits and vegetables. With the financial support from Ceprodel, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her two children and herself. Furthermore, she has begun to save money so that she can invest in reconstruction of her current site in the market where she works.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La dama Petrona L. inicia su pequeño negocio hace 20 años vendiendo frutas y verduras en León en el mercado la Terminal. Debido a que tiene un pequeño local establecido en las instalaciones del mercado una de las metas de la señora Petrona es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan la adquisición de las frutas y verduras. Con el aporte económico obtenido por los prestamos de CEPRODEL ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y sus dos hijos y además ha iniciado a ahorrar para la reconstrucción de su negocio en el mercado donde ella labora.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Saida De La Concepci

texts.es:
Since 28 years, Mrs Saida sells vegetables at the “La Terminal” market in the city of Leon. She decided to ask for a loan in order to have her own market stand and buy more products.

Her dream is to improve the standard of living of her family (including her 4 children).

Saida believes that the financial support she has received from CEPRODEL has been a key factor for the development of her business. Nowadays, she has improved her sales and would like to receive another loan to buy even more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Saida se dedica a esta actividad de venta de verduras desde hace 28 años ubicándose en el mercado la Terminal en la ciudad de León.

Con la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos decide solicitar prestamos para tener un local propio, incrementar su inventario en fin el de realizar sus sueños mejorar en todos los aspectos de su vida.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente ha mejorado sus ventas y hoy en día una vez mas acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que son invertidos directamente en la compra de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and get her own market-stand

loans.name: Timotea Sinforosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Timotea is a widow with two children to take care of. She currently finds herself in a difficult position because she has to be both father and mother to her children and also dedicate herself to her job selling clothing in the market La Terminal in the district of Leon. Before beginning this business, Mrs. Timotea sold clothes as a sort of traveling saleswoman, on the streets. However, the revenue from this system of selling was insufficient to support her family. Confronting this problem, she decided to collect more quantities of clothing to resell in the market. She seeks out the cheapest or most affordable venders of clothing in various places in her district so as to make a better profit when reselling them. To date, she has finished 14 loans with CEPRODEL which has helped her to collect enough money to purchase clothing from her venders and furthermore, in ways, has improved the quality of life in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Timotea es una madre viuda y con dos hijos que mantener. Actualmente atraviesa una difícil situación por el hecho de que hace el papel de padre y madre y además se dedica a la venta de ropa en lo interno del mercado la Terminal en el Departamento de León.

Antes de iniciar este negocio en su local la señora Timotea se dedicaba a realizar las ventas en la calle al aire libre pero sus bajos ingresos eran insuficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Partiendo de este problema, decide muy firmemente comenzar a adquirir mas cantidades de ropa para comercializarla por lo que realiza cotizaciones en varios lugares para seleccionar al proveedor que mas barato le venda la ropa.

Hoy en dia ha realizado un total de 14 créditos en CEPRODEL que le han sido de sumo apoyo ya que ha adquirido la ropa de sus proveedores y además ha mejorado en parte las condiciones de su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Seynabou A.

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou A. F., 44 and married, is a member of the Khodoba Village Bank since 6 and half years. Madame F. is asking for a loan to grow her business selling fruit (Organges, watermelon, tangerines, etc.). She is hoping that the money she earns from growing her business will help her manage maintenance costs and improve her boutique's infra-structure.

Seynabou is one of the best clients within Caurie's Khodoba Village Bank, maintaining a solid reimbursement history. This will be her 8th loan with a term of 6 months and 1 payment at the end of the loan term.

Mme Seynabou A. F. est âgée de 44 ans, mariée. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de Khodoba depuis six ans et demis. Afin d'aider à l’entretien de son foyer, elle souhaite renforcer son commerce de fruits (Orange, pastèque, mandarine, clémentine, etc.). Elle fait partie des meilleurs clientes de son groupe. Elle sollicite un 8ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor´s current work was an initiative of her sister who, because of a trip, left the business to her. Prior to this Flor worked with her husband as a fare collector in a public transport line. This work, although it generated income, left her very tired at the end of the day. As the years went by she began to look for another job and her sister´s trip was a coincidence. She gladly accepted the fruit stand her sister left her. She has been selling fruit and orange juice now for two years. Thanks to this work she is helping to build and maintain her house. What she would like most of all is to fix up the stand that she has, as it has deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El actual trabajo de Flora en un inicio era de su hermana, quien por motivos de viaje, se lo dejo a ella. Anteriormente, Flor trabajaba junto a su esposo como cobradora de una línea de transporte público. Este trabajo, si bien le generaba ingresos, al final del día ella terminaba muy cansada. Con el paso de los años ella empezó a buscar otro trabajo y el viaje de su hermana fue una coincidencia. Así que acepto con mucho gusto manejar el puesto de frutas que se le concedió. Ya lleva dos años vendiendo frutas y jugo de naranja. Gracias a este trabajo está ayudando en la construcción de su casa y al mantenimiento de esta. Lo que ella más quisiera es poder arreglar el puesto que tiene, ya que esta degradado por el tiempo.

loans.use: Remodel her stand.

loans.name: Ta Thi Phuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tạ Thị Phương A., 30 years old, is A. active womA.. Her vision of the city expansion has encouraged her to open a gas station. Due to her lack of experience the start up failed. She and her husband tried again with a different project, a plastic recycle plant. She has a better luck this time. The operation is steady together with good income. Currently her plant has around 10 employees. The production is sold to bigger plants in Hanoi, Hưng Yên and some other provinces. The business keeps expanding and gains good reputation. This time she is applying for a loA. of 1,200USD to stock more scrap plastic. The plant needs more capital that is why she hopes she cA. be approved for bigger loans, 5,000-6,000USD. The monthly income is 500-550USD. She has 3 school age children.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Là một trong rất ít thành viên trẻ nhưng năng động và mạnh dạn đầu tư dự án lớn, tận dụng lợi thế và điều kiện thuận lợi như đất đai rộng, gần đường giao thông, bA. đầu chị Tạ Thị Phương A., 30 tuổi, đầu tư mở cửa hàng Gas nhưng do thiếu kinh nghiệm, đồng vốn nhỏ hẹp nên việc kinh doanh bị thua lỗ phải bỏ dở. Vốn là người dám nghĩ dám làm, không chịu chấp nhận thất bại, chị A. cùng chồng lại tìm kiếm và học hỏi nhiều kinh nghiệm ở nhiều nơi với nhiều nghề khác nhau. Được một người bạn mách nước, chị Thanh và chồng cùng góp vốn với anh trai mở xưởng sản xuất nhựa nguyên liệu. Sau một thời giA., công việc đi vào ổn định và cho thu nhập tốt. Hiện tại xưởng của gia đình chị đang có gần chục công nhân đang trực tiếp sản xuất. Sản phẩm nhựa nguyên liệu của gia đình làm ra được cung cấp cho các nhà máy sản xuất nhựa ở Hà Nội, Hưng Yên và một số tỉnh khác được khách hàng rất tin cậy nên công việc ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn này chị A. xin vay 1200USD để thu mua nhựa về tái chế. Nhu cầu sử dụng vốn của chị A. rất lớn nên nguyện vọng của chị cùng gia đình là Quỹ cho vay mức vốn lớn hơn (khoảng 5000-6000USD) để tiếp tục đầu tư mở rộng dự án. Thu nhập của chị A. là 500-550USD/tháng. Chị có 3 con còn nhỏ đang trong độ tuổi đi học.

loans.use: Buy wasted plastic

loans.name: Mujeres Chuisequec Ii Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Chuisequéc enter their meeting at the Friendship Bridge office, their strong faces colored by the wind and the sun they daily endure as they take care of their farms.

They have traveled an hour from their community of Concepción, where the soil is rich and the climate good, allowing for year-round farming. All but two of the eighteen women have small farms, where they grow potatoes, carrots, onions, radishes, beans, broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes, lemongrass, and chamomile (quite a variety!).

They whisper to each other in their native language Kaqchiquel, eagerly awaiting approval of the loans they have requested.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 18,500 quetzales ($2425), ranging from $150 to $400 each. Of the eight, six will invest in seeds and fertilizer for their farms.

One woman is an artisan, weaving beautiful ‘huipiles’, traditional Mayan blouses known for their intricate and colorful designs. She will invest in thread for her weavings.

Another woman is a ‘comerciante’ (commerce women), buying a variety of goods in bulk and selling them at local markets. With her loan, she will buy a greater quantity of each item, lowering the price per item and increasing her profits.

Each woman of Mujeres Chuisequéc has a family to take care of; some even have up to ten children.

They express that everything they do is to improve the lives of their children so they can receive an education and learn to read and write. This will open them new opportunities and avoid them the suffering their mothers have had to endure.

As they go to sign their names, all but two sign with a thumbprint, indicating they cannot write. But they sign with pride, knowing that with this loan they are doing everything in their power to give their children the right tools to learn and later on sign their names with a pen.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer, as well as thread for weaving and goods in bulk

loans.name: Kieu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Kiều Thị Sơn, 27 years old, lives with her husband and a 6 years old S. in Sóc Sơn. She joins the TYM Fund in 2001 when her S. was 8 months old. The funds of her first loan was invested in wedding parties such as china, utensils and decorative items for her rental business. Though the income was hefty in wedding seaS., off seaS. had different story. In 2006, she converts her rental business to a refreshment distributor which serves fruits and refreshment to general population and also other businesses as well. This business gives a more stable monthly income of 300USD. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to stock more goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Kiều Thị Sơn, 27 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 6 tuổi tại Sóc Sơn. Chị Sơn bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2001, sau khi sinh con được 8 tháng. Số vốn vay lần đầu được chị Sơn đầu tư mua phông bạt, bát đĩa cho thuê đám cưới. Mỗi lần cho thuê mang lại cho chị lợi nhuận vài chục USD. Thu nhập bình quân cũng khá nhưng vào những tháng không phải trong mùa cưới thường không có việc. Năm 2006 chị Sơn chuyển sang buôn bán bánh kẹo, hoa quả, nước giải khát phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người dân trong địa phương và bán buôn cho các cửa hàng trong huyện. Do đã hoạt động kinh doanh phục vụ đám cưới từ thời gian trước nên cửa hàng của chị được rất nhiều người biết đến. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng đạt 300USD/tháng. Với khả năng phát triển của cửa hàng nên vòng vốn này chị Sơn tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD mua bánh kẹo, rượu bia.

loans.use: Buy confectionary, wine, beer

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara has been selling chickens in a market near her house for ten years. She started with the idea of helping her husband maintain their home, since the income he earned as a carpenter wasn't enough.

Upon finding out about the inauguration of the market, she didn't hesitate to leave the stand that she had and to start working in the market. She invested what she earned, so little by little, she could afford to buy the stand in the market.

Clara is a young, hard-working woman. She is only 34-years-old, and she plans to build another stand. She has a husband and two children, who are 14 and 3-years-old. Her children are her strength. Because of them, she feels capable of doing anything and strives to progress more and more.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace diez años que Clara vende pollos en un mercado cercano a su casa. Ella empezó con la idea de ayudar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar, ya que sus ingresos como carpintero no eran suficientes. Al enterarse de la inauguración de un mercado no dudo en separar su puesto y ponerse a trabajar en él. Lo que ganaba lo volvía a invertir, y así poco a poco pudo comprar el puesto.

Clara es una mujer joven y muy trabajadora. Cuenta con solo 34 años y ya planea construir otro puesto. Tiene un esposo y dos hijos de catorce y tres años, quienes son su fortaleza. Por ellos, se siente capaz de todo y tiene las ganas de progresar cada vez más.

loans.use: To construct another stand

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kaksija I Group

texts.en:
Seated on plastic chairs, wooden boards, or the ground, the women of the community bank Kaksija gather in the home of one of the members, talking in their native language K´iche´, treating each other like family after almost eight years of being together as a group.

Waiting for the meeting to begin, some women nurse their babies, others work on craft projects, and others catch up on the weekly news. The fourteen women of the group dedicate themselves to artisan crafts, primarily to ‘huipiles’, a traditional Mayan blouse woven with intricate patterns. They also specialize in other typical clothing, such as the skirts you see in the photo.

The women of Kaksija are strong and wise. Most have been practicing their trade since their childhood, and have perfected the art. They sell their clothing in nearby markets, but are now looking for ways to expand their business. They would like to break into the tourist market surrounding Lake Atitlan, about an hour and a half away.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 17,500 quetzales ($2300), ranging from $150 to $400 per person, with which they will purchase thread for weaving, and two of these women are hoping to also invest in a sewing machine, in hopes to increase production as well as quality of their sewing.

All eight of the women have children, with some of the older women having as many as ten. They dream of expanding their business in order to better provide for their kids, so that they can receive an education and have more opportunity in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and a sewing machine

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Giá, 39 years old, lives in Sóc Sơn. She joins the TYM Fund in 1994. The funds of her first loan was invested in a food stand which serves inexpensive breakfast items. She was young and energetic. Her house situates right at Rout 133, near by the headquarter of the Air Force division and other government offices. From a small breakfast stand, she expands it to a full-fledged restaurant, Phúc-Giá. The restaurant has three employees with monthly salary of 50USD each. Her monthly income is 350USD. She is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to stock more goods. She hope she can be approved with her next loan of 3,000USD,

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Giá, 39 tuổi, sống tại Sóc Sơn là thành viên tham G. Quỹ năm 1994. Vốn vay vòng 1 được chị đầu tư bán hàng ăn sáng với những món ăn ngon miệng, rẻ tiền, đặc trưng của vùng nông thôn Việt Nam như xôi đỗ, cháo gà, bánh nếp, bánh rán ... Mặc dù còn trẻ nhưng chị Giá là một phụ nữ năng động tháo vát, nhà lại ngay mặt đường 131, cạnh sư đoàn không quân và các cơ quan, thuận tiện giao thông, nên chị bàn với anh sửa chữa nâng cấp nhà mở rộng kinh doanh hàng ăn. Với cái rét thấu người duới 10 độ, nếu bạn có thời gian và muốn làm ấm lòng mình để bù đắp năng lượng tiêu hao xin mời đến với nhà hàng Phúc-Giá với món khoái khẩu lẩu lòng bò-gà. Hiện tại chị Giá thuê 3 người giúp việc với mức lương tháng 50USD. Với thu nhập 350USD/tháng của cửa hàng, vòng vốn này chị Giá xin vay 1200USD để mua thực phẩm, đồ uống thu hút thêm ngày càng đông khách. Trong tương lai, dự định của chị là muốn vay thêm 3000USD đầu tư nhà hàng tại một địa điểm khác.

loans.use: Buy food, drink

loans.name: Yanira Irma

texts.es:
Yanina Irma B. O. belongs to the "Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa" community bank and she has a stationery supply store, in a rented space located near the Instituto Pedagógico school in Huaraz, in the Ancash region.

With a prior loan she has been able to increase her supply of merchandise and her income.

With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of supplies such as pencils, paints, erasers, notebooks, rulers, construction paper, etc. for the school year.

She is 31 years old, a single mother, has a daughter and lives with her 65-year-old mother. With her income she supports her daughter and mother.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yanina Irma B. O. pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa”, tiene una librería –bazar, en un local alquilado, ubicado cerca al Instituto Pedagógico de Huaraz, Región Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior, ha podido incrementado su mercadería y sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como: lapiceros, temperas, correctores, cuadernos, reglas, cartulinas, etc. para la campaña escolar.

Ella tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, vive con su Mamá de 65 años de edad, con los ingresos que tiene apoya a su hija y madre.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for the school year to stock her stationery store.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Phương, 32 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund since 2002. She took out her first loan of 125USD to open a hair salon. Her energetic and skillful nature made her shop a crowded place. In 2006, she acquired bridal make-up, dressing and photographing skills and expanded her shop to a bridal do-all shop. The monthly income is 450USD. Though busy, she always whole heartedly participates in the Fund’s activities and helps other members. She lives with her husband and two children in Quang Tiến, Sóc Sơn. This time, she is applying a loan of $1200 to buy bridal gowns and cosmetics for her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương, 32 tuổi, là thành viên Quỹ Tình thương năm 2002. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay của Quỹ 125USD đầu tư vào cửa hàng cắt tóc gội đầu. Bản thân là một người có tay nghề và nhiệt tình với công việc nên khách đến cửa hàng ngày một đông. Kinh tế phát triển, năm 2006 chị Phương học thêm nghề trang điểm cô dâu và cho thuê áo cưới, chụp ảnh. Khách hàng của chị là những đôi lứa yêu nhau và những cặp chuẩn bị cưới. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng của cửa hàng đạt 450USD. Mặc dù rất bận rộn với công việc nhưng trong thời gian tham gia Quỹ chị Phương luôn hoàn thành tốt trách nhiệm của mình, và sẵn sàng giúp đỡ chị em trong cụm khi gặp khó khăn. Hiện tại chị Phương đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Quang Tiến, Sóc Sơn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD mua áo cưới và mỹ phẩm.

loans.use: Buy bridal gowns and cosmetics

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
When her husband was left without a job because of an illness, Aida searched desperately for a way to pay the bills of her home and the medical bills of her husband, who suffered from diabetes.

At first, because of a lack of resources, she bought her merchandise at retail prices, by the kilo. Little by little, with the help of one of her daughters, she increased her sales and started to buy larger quantities of her products. She says that this business isn't going badly for her, but she does earn very little compared to the work and effort she puts into her business every day. Upon having the opportunity of receiving financial support, she would like to open a bazaar and sell clothing in the same market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo a causa de una enfermedad, Aida buscó desesperadamente la forma de mantener los gastos de su vivienda y la salud de su esposo, quien padecía de diabetes.

En un inicio, Aida por falta de recursos, compraba su mercadería al por menor, por kilos. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de una de sus hijas pudo aumentar sus ventas y comprar por mayores cantidades sus productos. Ella afirma que no le va mal en este negocio; sin embargo, asegura ganar muy poco comparado al trabajo y esfuerzo que pone a diario en él. De tener la oportunidad de recibir un apoyo financiero le gustaría abrir un bazar y vender ropa en el mismo mercado.

loans.use: To begin constructing a clothing bazaar.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Virginia Mercedes

texts.es:
Señora Virginia Mercedes M. J. belongs to the communal bank "Niño Manuelito". She is a member of an association of vendors of construction material (concrete mix and gravel). She takes these materials to the quarry to sell them, which is in the city of Huaraz in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 1,000 nuevos soles, she invested in the purchase of tools for her business.

With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will invest in her business to increase her income.

She is 39-years-old, and she works together with her husband to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Virginia Mercedes M. J., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito” ella es socia en la asociación de vendedores de materiales de construcción ( arena hormigón, ripio) extrae estos materiales para venderlos en la cantera, esto en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra para comprar de herramientas para su negocio.

Con este préstamo S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 8 meses lo invertirá en su negocio para poder mejorar sus ingresos .

Ella tiene 39m años, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: She will invest the loan in her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Señora Vilma V. G. belongs to the communal bank, "Niño Manuelito". She has a grocery store and also sells food that she prepares. Her business is located in Huaraz in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 1,000 nuevos soles, she invested in her business to increase her sales and her income.

With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy soft drinks, beer, and rice. She will also buy sugar and oil to prepare food.

She is 41-years-old, her husband is a driver, and both work to take good care of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora VilmaV. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito”, ella tiene su bodega y también se dedica a la venta de alimentos, su negocio esta ubicado en Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses , comprara gaseosas, cerveza y arroz, azúcar, aceite para la elaboración de alimentos.

Ella tiene 41 años de edad, su esposo es chofer y ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: With this loan, she will buy products to increase the amount of her merchandise

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
For the past 5 years Ramón has worked as a security guard at the Treasury and Public Finance Ministry, where he works 12-hour shifts daily. The income he receives allows him to maintain his family decently. His wife takes care of household chores and raising their son.

This family lives in a housing project, their home is small and shows signs of deterioration because they have not been able to make any improvements due to lack of resources. It is urgent for this family to build a wall on the left side of their house, which currently is in poor condition. Because this part of their house is open, with no security or protection, Ramón fears that delinquents will break in and take all of their possesions which he has worked so hard to obtain.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Don Ramón tiene 5 años de desempeñarse como guarda de seguridad en el Ministerio de Hacienda y Crédito Público, trabaja por turno de 12 horas diarias, los ingresos que percibe este señor le ha permitido mantener a la familia con decoro, su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar y la manutención de su hijo.

Esta familia habita en un asentamiento, su vivienda es pequeña, presenta malas condiciones debido a que no han podido mejorar por completo la vivienda por la falta de recursos, la urgencia de esta familia es de construir el muro lateral del costado izquierdo de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones. Al tener esa parte de la casa abierta, sin seguridad ni protección, el señor teme que los delincuentes se le metan a despojarlos de sus pertenencias que tanto trabajo le ha costado obtener.

loans.use: Buy cinder blocks, sand, rocks and metal to build a wall.

loans.name: Kaksija Ii Group

texts.en:
Dressed in traditional Mayan clothing with babies wrapped in blankets on their back, the women of the community bank Kaksija enter one by one into the home of one of the members, where they gather for their monthly meeting.

They speak rapidly in their native language of K´iche´, and when necessary, the younger members translate from Spanish for the older members of the group. These fourteen women know each other well, having been together for almost eight years.

They dedicate themselves to traditional artisan crafts, primarily to the intricate art of weaving ‘huipiles’, beautiful hand-woven blouses than can take up to a month to produce. They also sew skirts and scarves, such as the ones in the picture.

As members of their community bank, these women have not only become friends and confidants, but they also support each other in business and give advice on loans. If a new member enters the group, the other women make sure that she understands what it means to receive a loan, and the importance of paying back on time. They help each other, sharing business tips and loan advice, ensuring that each member is successful.

Six women of the community bank are asking for a group loan of 16,000 quetzales ($2100), ranging from $150 to $400 per person. They will invest this money in colorful thread for their weaving and one woman is hoping to purchase a sewing machine that will enable her to rapidly increase her productivity, as well as the quality of her product.

All the women have children and they dream of being able to provide them an education so they can have better lives with more opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and a sewing machine

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Mrs Norma León Bedón belongs to the Community Bank “Kid Manuelito”. She sells food at the riverside of the Santa River, where people work extracting sand, gravel and cement, amongst others. Her business is located in the city of Huaraz, in the Ancash district.

With a prior loan, Norma had bought main ingredients for her food like rice, oil and sugar. With this new loan of 175 USD, which she will pay in 4 months, Norma will continue to invest in ingredients for her business as noodles and rice.

She is 38 years old, has 4 little children and her husband is a driver. The main objective of their work is to be able to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma León Bedón, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito”, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos, en las canteras del Río Santa donde las personas trabajan sacando hormigón, arena fina, ripio y otros. Este negocio se ubica en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior ella compro artículos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite para la preparación de alimentos. Con este préstamo de S/. 500 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses lo invertirá en la comprara de productos para su negocio como: arroz, fideos, etc

Ella tiene 38 años de edad, 4 hijos pequeños, es casada su esposo es chofer eventual ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like rice and noodles

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is 23 years of age, married and has a young child. She works as a hostess in Rostipollos (a restaurant) helping to organize fun games for kids around the piñatas. Her husband works as a cable TV installer and both their incomes help them to maintain their small home. Times are tough even with two incomes because the Nicaraguan economy is currently going through a difficult cycle.

Ana Maria and her husband are not able to afford taking their child to Rostipollos to celebrate his birthday, but they wish to make their home as comfortable as possible for him. Ana would like to repaint the interior with colors that would match her boys´ eyes and to repair the leaking roof with new zinc plates.

With the microloan they are requesting they hope to be able to improve the living conditions in their humble home

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 35 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Soc Son. She joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before, her family earned their stable income by the motorcycle-repairing workshop. After join the Fund, she combined the borrowed money with her savings to open a motorcycle store. Besides, she also provided warranty. Therefore, she always had a lot of customers. Currently, Mrs.T. is owning a motorcycle store right in the center of the town. Her average income is 700-800 USD/ month. Because the business is going very well, her 2 children are sent to school. They are now attending their last years of school. This time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more motorcycles, increasing store’s sale.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tình, 35 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Sóc Sơn. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Trước kia gia đình chị chuyên sửa chữa xe máy, thu nhập cũng ổn định. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ có điều kiện được vay vốn, cộng với số tiền tích lũy của gia đình chị Tình cùng chồng đầu tư buôn bán xe máy. Ngoài buôn bán, chị cũng bảo hành sửa chữa xe nên cửa hàng luôn đông khách. Hiện nay, chị có một cửa hàng buôn bán xe mới, cũ rất khang trang rộng rãi ngay trung tâm xã. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng của cửa hàng từ 700-800USD. Việc kinh doanh thuận lợi nên hai con của chị tình được bố mẹ tạo điều kiện cho học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Hiện nay hai cháu đang học những năm cuối cấp. Vòng vốn chị xin vay 1200USD để mua bán xe máy, tăng doanh thu cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy motorbike

loans.name: Elena Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Elena Isabel A. M. belongs to the communal bank of "Amigos Marcarinos". She grows and sells guinea pigs in her home which is located in the district of Marcara, province of Carhuaz, department of Ancash. She sells the guinea pigs in the city of Huaraz which is 30 minutes away from Marcara. She also sells them directly to the tourist resorts in the city.

With her previous credit of S/. 200.00 she invested in her business to improve her sales and income. With this new loan of S./ 200.00 which will be paid back in 4 months, she'll buy food for her animals so that she can sell them in good health.

She is 39 years old and has two children. Her husband does many jobs such as gas fitter and electrician. They both work to get their family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Señora Elena Isabel A. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigos Marcarinos”, ella se dedica a la crianza y vende de cuyes, su local se encuentra en su domicilio en el Distrito de Marcara, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash, ella vede los cuyes en la ciudad de Huaraz que esta 30 minutos de Marcara, también los vende directo a los Recreos turísticos de su Localidad. Con el crédito anterior de S/. 200.00 invirtió en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos Con este préstamo de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprara alimentos para su animales para poder venderlos semanalmente. Ella tiene 39 años, dos hijos, su esposo que desempeña varios oficios como gasfitero, electricista, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan, she'll purchase food for her animals / Con el prestamo comprara alimento para sus animales

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started selling chicken by chance. 28 years ago, together with her husband, she would breed chicken and hens. Nevertheless, at some point she sold the eggs that she had in excess and later on she also started selling chicken.

Nowadays, she only breeds chicken on special occasions, like Christmas, when she receives special orders from her clients. Thanks to her business, to the help of her husband and to her inner-strength, she has been able to support her children and provide them with an education.

Isabel just turned 60 and she would like to open a store at her home to sell the chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Vender pollos solo fue una casualidad para Isabel. Hace 28 años ella, junto a su esposo, se dedicaba a criar pollos y gallinas ponedoras de huevo. No obstante, en un tiempo tuvo la oportunidad de vender ella misma huevos, ya que los tenía en grandes cantidades.

Poco a poco fue incluyendo a sus ventas los pollos que ella criaba. Hasta que se dedico por completo a la venta de pollos y dejo de lado la crianza de ellos. Solo por temporadas vuelve a la crianza, como en Navidad que lo hace porque recibe pedidos de algunos clientes. Gracias a su negocio, a la ayuda de su esposo y a la fuerza que nunca la abandona, ella ha podido mantener a sus hijos y darles educación.

Isabel acaba de cumplir setenta años y está pensando abrir una bodega en su casa.

loans.use: To open a  butcher shop at her home (to sell chicken)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nueva Santa Catarina Group

texts.en:
In a modest room lit only by the sun, a woman sweeps the dirt floor and sets out multi-colored plastic chairs in preparation for the ‘desembolsa’, the meeting for the community bank Nueva Santa Catarina where its 11 members will have their requested loans approved. The women gather excitedly, talking rapidly in their native language K´iche´, while their children play in the folds of their dresses, giggling timidly. These women are strong and have endured much, yet more than exhaustion they emit hope and joy. As a community bank, they are proud to have been together eight years, their bank was the first of the now four banks in their small community.

Located about an hour and a half from the region’s capital, Sololá, the 11 women dedicate themselves to the beautiful and intricate art of weaving huipiles, native Mayan blouses. A single huipil can take up to one month to make, and after an investment of about 200 Quetzales (about $25), they can sell it for about 500 Quetzales (about $60). Currently, the women sell their huipiles in the nearby town of Nahuala, and they are well known in their community so customers also come directly to their home to make purchases.

Of the 11 women, almost half can read and write, which is a very large percentage for the area. They are smart in business, and are looking for new ways to expand. They’ve recognized the large number of sales that tourism brings in, and are hoping to implement an export business or connect with a nearby community where tourism is more prevalent than in their town and open a market there. As a group they are asking for a loan of 33,500 Quetzales, about $4400, $400 per person, which they will invest in various colored threads to weave their huipiles. A few of the women are also planning on using part of their loan to hire extra help so they can increase the rate of production and make more sales.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and hire extra help

loans.name: Clara Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Clara Francisca E. V. belongs to the Group "The Roses of Yungay". Her business is the sale of clothing for ladies and gentlemen. Two years ago she offered her products in a tricycle, and now has a small store located in the market of the district and province of Yungay.

With her previous loan for S/. 300, she purchased more merchandise with which she increased her sales. With this loan for S/. 500 which she will pay back in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of clothing for boys and girls.

She is 57 years old and married. Her 6 children already moved out so she works to help support her grandchildren and pay for the house expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Clara Francisca E. V. , ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Rosas de Yungay”, su negocio es la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, hace dos años ofrecía sus productos en un triciclo, actualmente cuenta con un local que esta ubicado en el Campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay. Con el préstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro mercaderías con las cuales pudo incrementa ventas Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses lo invertirá en la comprara de ropa para niños y niñas. Ella tiene 57 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos que están fuera de familia, trabaja para apoyar a sus nietos y sostener los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan, she'll purchase clothing for boys and girls / Con el prestamo comprara ropa de niño y niñas

loans.name: Camilo Ernesto

texts.es:
Camilo is a young jeweller that creates and sells gold and silver jewellery. He learned his trade 13 years ago from his uncle and now he owns and operates his own jewellery shop. He meets with his clients and personally transforms their requests into beautiful hand made gold and silver jewellery.

Business is going well, thanks to a large client base and client references for future business. He has gained a reputation as a fine jeweller creating a beautiful high quality product. Sales are up and his wife is helping out so he can concentrate on dealing with the backlog of orders. Camilo wants to buy a new sales stand which his wife would manage to increase their business opportunities.

Thanks to their business venture, Camilo and his wife have achieved economic stability. Their current dream is to become parents as up until now they have dedicated all their energies to raising the business. Now they want to become a family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase 18kt gold to make jewellery

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es:
Mr. Walter is a free-lance photographer with a 12-year experience. His profession has allowed him to make a living for his family. He covers weddings, birthdays, baptisms and graduations, among other events. He has a good number of clients that hire him on a temporary basis, but he is always on the outlook to make new clients and to cover important business events. Because of their tough financial situation and the high living costs, his wife sells cosmetics by catalog in workplaces and to family and friends. In this way, they support their two children. Having prioritized other expenses, they haven’t been able to repair the roof of their house living room, which is cracked and has holes, after many years of use. Moreover, some of the zinc sheets are loose due to the strong winds and Mr. Walter is afraid that might facilitate thieves breaking into his house. He is requesting a loan to tend to this urgent need of changing the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Walter es fotógrafo de profesión, con 12 años en esta actividad,que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. El señor cubre bodas, cumpleaños, bautizos y graduaciones, entre otros eventos. Cuenta con un buen número de clientes que lo contratan temporalmente, pero siempre está en busca de capturar nuevos clientes y cubrir eventos importantes en empresas. Viendo que la situación económica se encuentra difícil y lo cara que está la vida, la esposa se dedica a ofrecer cosméticos en centros de trabajo, a familiares y amistades. De este modo mantienen a sus dos hijos. Por priorizar otros gastos, no han podido cambiar el techo de la sala de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra rajado y con orificios debido a los años de uso, y hay ciertas láminas de zinc que están flojas debido a los fuertes vientos, por lo cual teme que se le metan a despojarlo de sus pertenecias. Siendo esta una necesidad urgente, el señor solicita un préstamo para cambiar el techo.

loans.use: Purchase of zinc sheets and anti-corrosive paint.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga D. L. C. H. belongs to the "Warac" community bank. She provides tourist services for different hiking routes in the region. Her business is located in the city of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With a loan which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy trekking equipment: such as tents, sleeping bags, sleeping pads and backpacks, so she can proviD. better service to her clients.

She is 39 years old, married and the mother of a 14-year-old girl. Her husband is in the same business and both of them work to educate their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

L. señora Olga D. L. C. H. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Warac”, elL. se dedica a prestar servicios turístico en los diferentes circuito D. L. región. Su local esta ubicado en L. ciudad D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo el cual será cancelada en 6 meses elL. comprara equipos D. montaña: como carpas, bolsas D. dormir, colchonetas y mochilas, para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

ElL. tiene 39 años, es casada y madre D. una hija D. 14 años D. edad, su esposo también se dedica a este negocio, ambos trabajan para educar su hija.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
When she divorced her husband 34 years ago, all of a sudden Genara faced the responsibility of caring for her five children by herself. As time went on, the sale of clothing she herself made was no longer enough to support her family. For that reason, in 1983, she decided to open a general store. Things were going well, but lack of time forced her to close the business since she needed to take care of her younger children. Because of this she continued making clothing and worked in whatever other business appeared at the time, such as the sale of fish, sale of food, etc.

Three years ago, one of her daughters suggested that she reopen the store. Since she had continued to pay the yearly business license fee to her city, it was no problem to reopen. Because of this, thanks to her daughter´s support and a loan from EDAPROSPRO, she able to open the store again.

With a lot of effort, Genera gets ahead in her business. Fortunately her children are grown now and help her once in a while. However, she thinks about growing the business even more because now she needs to take care of two illnesses which she suffers from, diabetes and osteoporosis.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Con el divorcio de su esposo, hace treinta y cuatro años, Genara, de pronto, se vio con la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus cinco hijos ella sola. Conforme pasaba el tiempo, la venta de ropa que ella misma confeccionaba no era suficiente para mantener a su hogar. Por ello, en el año 1983 decidió abrir una bodega. Todo iba yendo bien, pero la falta de tiempo la obligo a cerrar el negocio, pues debía ocuparse de atender a sus hijos menores aún. Así que continúo con la confección de ropas y alguno que otro negocio que se le presentaba en el momento, como la venta de pescados, venta de comidas, etc.

Hace tres años, una de sus hijas le propuso volver a abrir la tienda. Ya que ella continuaba pagando año tras año el permiso que la municipalidad le había otorgado de tener un negocio en su casa, no fue un problema reinaugurarla. Fue así que, gracias al apoyo de su hija y al préstamo que le brindo EDAPROSPO pudo volver a abrir su bodega.

Actualmente, Genara lleva con mucho esfuerzo su negocio adelante, felizmente sus hijos ya están grandes y la ayudan de vez en cuando. Sin embargo, ella piensa en hacer crecer su negocio aun más porque ahora debe encargarse de las dos enfermedades que la molestan, diabetes y osteoporosis.

loans.use: Supply her store with more products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina H. D. C. belongs to the "Mujeres del Futuro" community bank. She sells vegetables and prepared flour (flour from broad beans, dried peas and wheat). Her stand is located in the market in the city of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With a loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 3 boxes of tomatoes, 3 sacks of onions, 3 pumpkins, a sack of potatoes, 12 kilos of broad bean flour, and 12 kilos of dried pea flour.

She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 4 children; the oldest is 40 and the youngest 25. All of her children live independently. Her husband works in agriculture and both raised their children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandrina H. D. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, ella se dedica ala venta D. verduras y harina preparada (harina D. haba, arvejas, trigo), su local esta ubicado en el mercado, D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo el cual será cancelado en 4 meses , comprará, 3 cajas D. tomates, 3 sacos D. cebolla, 3 zapallos , un saco D. papas, 12 kilos D. harina D. haba, 12 kilos D. harina D. arvejas.

Ella tienen 57 años D. edad es casada y madre D. 4 hijos, el mayor D. 40 años y la ùltima D. 25 años, todos sus hijos son independientes, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ambos educaron a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen Comenzó en el mes de Febrero de 1993 a vender joyería , zapatos y otros artículos por catálogo, a raíz de que un agente de ventas la visitó su casa y al cual le platicó su inquietud de poner un pequeño negocio y gracias a la asesoría que le brindó pudo iniciar un pequeño negocio de compra-venta de joyería. Posteriormente cambió de giro al vender ropa nueva con la cual le fue muy bien y hace 2 años comenzó a vender además de la ropa nueva zapatos por catalogo y lencería. Carmen trabaja para poder sacar dinero para ayudarle a su esposo a pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijas, las cuales una de ellas ya terminó, pero las dos más pequeñas se encuentran estudiando la preparatoria.

Sin embargo Actualmente, Carmen está solicitando un crédito de US $825 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Carmen podrá comprar un lote de zapatos de temporada y lencería que le permita tener un mayor surtido para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Carmen podrá salir adelante y ofrecerles una carrera universitaria a sus dos hijas.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen began selling jewelry, shoes and other merchandise purchased from catalogs in February 1993 after a sales agent called on her at home and calmed her fears about starting a small business. Thanks to the agent's advice, she was able to start her business buying and selling jewelry. Subsequently, she turned to selling new clothing, which went well, and two years ago she added new shoes and lingerie, all purchased from catalogs for resale. Carmen works to earn money to help her husband pay expenses for their 3 daughters, two of whom are still at school.

Carmen is now asking for a US$850 loan, to be repaid in 5 months, that she can use to buy an order of seasonal shoes and lingerie so that she can offer a wider selection of them to her customers. With your help, Carmen will be able to get ahead and give her two daughters a chance at university educations.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen comenzó en el mes de Febrero de 1993 a vender joyería , zapatos y otros artículos por catálogo, a raíz de que un agente de ventas la visitó su casa y al cual le platicó su inquietud de poner un pequeño negocio y gracias a la asesoría que le brindó pudo iniciar un pequeño negocio de compra-venta de joyería. Posteriormente cambió de giro al vender ropa nueva con la cual le fue muy bien y hace 2 años comenzó a vender además de la ropa nueva zapatos por catalogo y lencería. Carmen trabaja para poder sacar dinero para ayudarle a su esposo a pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijas, las cuales una de ellas ya terminó, pero las dos más pequeñas se encuentran estudiando la preparatoria.

Sin embargo Actualmente, Carmen está solicitando un crédito de US $850 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Carmen podrá comprar un lote de zapatos de temporada y lencería que le permita tener un mayor surtido para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Carmen podrá salir adelante y ofrecerles una carrera universitaria a sus dos hijas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Adrian De Jesús

texts.es:
In the El Sauce municipality in the Valle San Antonio region, Adrian de Jesús Mejia is in the agriculture and livestock business with the goal of maintaining his household, which consists of his wife and his two small children who, despite their age, are a great support in the labor involved in agriculture and livestock breeding.

The Valle San Antonio region has always faced the problem of not having electric power. They have no electricity because they are situated in a rural zone. For this reason, Adrian has acquired a solar panel to have access to two lamps and a small television. When he acquired this solar panel, he was left with the obligation of paying this debt. This is why he turned to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow him to pay this debt, and in that way have access to electric power in his humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce en la comarca Valle San Antonio, el señor Adrian de Jesús Mejia es dedica a al negocio de la agricultura y ganadería con el fin de mantener su hogar que consta de ella y sus dos pequeños hijos que a pesar de su edad son un gran apoyo en el trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería.

La comarca Valle San Antonio siempre ha atravesado un problema como lo es la ausencia de energía eléctrica, no poseen luminarias por estar ubicados en una zona rural. Es por este motivo que el señor Adrian ha adquirido un panel solar para tener acceso a dos lámparas y un pequeño televisor. Al adquirir el panel solar queda en la obligación de pagar esta deuda y es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan salir de esta deuda y de esta manera tener acceso a la energía eléctrica en su humilde casa de habitación.

loans.use: Acquire a solar panel to have electric power in his home.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
In the El Sauce municipality in the city of León, Augusto B. has been in the business of livestock and agriculture for over 40 years in his town situated in a region called Valle San Antonio.

Augusto is married and is the father of 5 children who depend on him and are his reason for being. Because there is no electric power in his town being that it is far from an urban zone, he requested that he have a solar panel installed so that he may have power in his home to do household chores and so his children can study. When he obtained this panel, he now needed to obtain a means for payment of this debt. For this reason, he turned to Ceprodel to benefit from loans that will allow him to pay this debt and have power in his home, which he will benefit greatly from mostly because his children will be able to study in the afternoons and evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de el Sauce en el departamento de León, el señor A gusto B. desde mas de 40 años se dedica al negocio agropecuario en su localidad en una comarca llamada Valle San Antonio.

Es padre casado y con 5 hijos a su cargo que son el motivo de su existencia. Debido a que en su localidad no existe energía eléctrica por encontrarse alejado de la zona urbana, solicitó que le implantaran un panel solar para aprovechar la luz eléctrica y realizar los quehaceres de su hogar y además que sus hijos estudien. Una vez obtenido el panel, su necesidad es la obtención de recursos para pagar esta deuda. Es por tal motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan cancelar esta deuda y así poder aprovechar la luz eléctrica que le servirá de mucho beneficio principalmente para que sus hijos estudien por las tardes y noche.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel so that he may have electricity in his home.

loans.name: Bertalina

texts.es:
Bertalina Mejia is in the livestock and agriculture business in a region called Valle San Antonio in the El Sauce municipality in the city of León. The dilemma this region faces is that because it is isolated, it does not have access to electric power. For this reason, Bertalina acquired a solar panel so that her children may study with proper lighting and so that they can do household chores that require electricity.

The problem Bertalina is facing is that when she acquired the panel, she also acquired a debt which she must now repay. Her livestock and agriculture business does not cover this expense, which is why she is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she may pay this debt with no problems so that her children may study and so that her family can do household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertalina Mejia se dedica al negocio de ganadería y agricultura en una comarca llamada Valle San Antonio en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. La problemática que presenta esta comarca es que por encontrarse alejada, no posee energía eléctrica y es por tal motivo que la señora Bertalina adquirió un panel solar para aprovechar que sus hijos estudien con iluminación y además para realizar los quehaceres del hogar que adquieran de energía.

La problemática que atraviesa la señora Bertalina es que al haber adquirido el panel, debe cancelar esta deuda y su negocio de ganadería y agricultura no cubre este gasto y es por esta razón que solicita crédito en CEPRODEL y de esta manera lograr salir de la deuda sin ningún problema y así lograr que sus hijos puedan estudiar con luz eléctrica y también realizar los quehaceres del hogar.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel so that her family may have electric power.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia Rodríguez is a single woman with the responsibility of maintaining her four small children who are of school age. She has been in the agriculture business since she was very young in the Achuapa municipality in the city of León.

The Achuapa municipality where Claudia lives has been facing the problem of having no electric power for a very long time and thus, they have no lighting. For this reason, she has acquired a solar panel for her home. After she acquired the panel, she now had a debt to repay, and she turned to Ceprodel to receive loans that will allow her to pay for it so she may do all of her household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia Rodríguez es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus cuatro pequeños hijos en edad escolar. Se dedica desde muy jovencita a la agricultura en el municipio Achuapa en la ciudad de León.

El municipio de Achuapa donde la señora habita, por mucho tiempo ha tenido una problemática como lo es la ausencia de energía eléctrica por lo que no cuentan con alumbrado y es por este motivo que la señora Claudia ha adquirido un panel solar en su hogar. Al haber adquirido este bien tiene la obligación de cancelar esta deuda y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan realizar el pago del panel y así lograr adquirir la luz eléctrica para realizar los quehaceres del hogar en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel so she may have electricity in her home.

loans.name: Elvin Francisco

texts.es:
Vicente López has been in the agriculture business all his life being that he lives in a rural zone such as is the Achuapa municipality in León. He is the father of two small children who along with his wife, a homemaker, make every effort to bring them forth successfully and educate them.

Currently, Vicente’s necessity lies in that there is no electric power in his town, for which reason he acquired a solar panel and must now repay this loan. Because of this circumstance, he turns to Ceprodel to request a loan with the objective of paying this debt, which will allow him to have electricity in his home so that his children can study in the afternoons and in the evening and so they have access to a small television. In this way, it will be possible that he and his family can improve their quality of living.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Vicente López durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura por vivir en una zona rural como lo es el municipio de Achuapa en León. Es padre de familia de dos pequeños hijos que junto con su esposa que es ama de casa se esfuerzan para sacarlos adelante y puedan estudiar.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa Vicente es que en su localidad no existe luz eléctrica por lo que adquirió un panel solar y le urge cancelar esta deuda. Por esta circunstancia acude a Ceprodel para solicitar crédito con el propósito de cancelar la deuda y así aprovechar de la energía eléctrica principalmente para que sus niños estudian por la tarde y en la noche y además para tener acceso a un pequeño televisor. De esta manera se hace posible que el y su familia mejoren su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel that will allow him to have electricity in his home.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina S. is originally from Achuapa near the city of León. Throughout her life, she worked in agriculture and cattle raising. Being a woman of amazing strength, she has worked hard to support her household and cover all of her needs.

Achuapa is located is very far from the city, and is a rural town without electricity. Facing this problem, Georgina uses candles at night, but she has been working towards installing solar panels to power her house. However, each installation requires a deposit beforehand, and for this reason she is turning to Ceprodel for a loan to cover this deposit and better her living conditions. Half a solar panel can power two 50-Watt lamps and a small television. Please help with her investment in house repair so she may provide better living conditions for her children.

Translated by Lily Fu, Princeton University Language Project.

Georgina S. es una dama originaria del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería siendo una dama muy esforzada que a diario lucha por mantener su hogar y suplir todas las necesidades.

El municipio de Achuapa es una localidad muy alejada de la ciudad y se caracteriza por ser una zona rural que no posee energía eléctrica. Ante este problema, la señora Georgina hace uso de candiles por la noche pero al ver que esta problemática puede erradicarse, solicita un panel solar para su hogar. Una vez instalado el panel su obligación como persona responsable es pagar esta deuda y es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel solicitando préstamo para cubrir la deuda y mejorar la condición de su hogar de habitación. Por medio del panel solar tiene derecho a dos lámparas de 50 Watts y un pequeño televisor. Su anhelo es ir invirtiendo en las necesidades de su hogar para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: purchase of solar panel

loans.name: Mileidy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Farming is exhausting work, exposed to the sun and worn out from the effort it requires. Aware of this, Mileidy has earned a living farming for more than 10 years in the "municipio" of Achuapa near the Nicaraguan city of Leon.

Mileidy is a very hard-working person who thanks to the great sacrifices she's made has managed to improve her house, lacking only an investment in electric lighting, having only had lanterns for night lighting up to now. To meet this need, she's asking that a solar panel be installed at her house. She's looking for a loan from Ceprodel to get the money she needs to cover the debt and gain the benefits of being able to light her house at night.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El trabajo de agricultura requiere de mucho esfuerzo por la exposición al sol y el desgaste físico que este trabajo provoca. Consiente de esto la señora Mileidy C. se dedica a este negocio desde hace mas de 10 años en el municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

Mileidy se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a los grandes sacrificios que ha realizado ha logrado mejorar su casa de habitación faltándole solamente invertir en la iluminación ya que lo hace con candiles por la noche. Para suplir esta necesidad, solicita que le implementen un panel solar en su hogar y al obtenerlo se ve en la obligación de pagar este panel. Es por tal razón que busca créditos en Ceprodel para obtener el dinero necesario para cubrir esta deuda y de esta manera continuar esforzándose grandemente y sacarle mas provecho a los días por medios de las actividades que le permite realizar la energía eléctrica por medio del panel solar.

loans.use: Pay for solar panel.

loans.name: Pablo Ramon

texts.es:
Pablo is the father of six children, some of whom are very young, but all of whom depend on him. He makes a living farming and raising livestock. He's originally from the "municipio" of Achuapa near the city of Leon in the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

Pablo does the hard work that he has to do everyday to provide his children with the most that he can and one of his greatest hopes is that they end up with professional careers. With that goal in mind, he has invested his few resources in the basic needs of his children and he now wants to address their lack of electric power, a problem for those who live in this rural area. He's bought a solar panel that he wants to pay off as quickly as possible. Very wisely, he's approached Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him to repay the [original?] debt and be certain of not owing it so that he can begin to use the panel for his own benefit and that of his children and beloved wife.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

Pablo Calderón es un padre de seis hijos unos menores de edad y otros en la edad de la adolescencia pero todos dependientes de él. Su negocio desde pequeño ha sido en el campo con la agricultura y ganadería. Es originario del municipio Achuapa ubicado en la ciudad de León de la bella nación de Nicaragua.

El arduo trabajo que a diario lleva a cabo lo realiza con el propósito de brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos y uno de sus mejores anhelos es que ellos lleguen a ser profesionales de éxito. Para lograr esta meta ha invertido sus pocos recursos en las necesidades de sus hijos pero hoy en día debe suplir la necesidad de ausencia de energía eléctrica ya que habitan en una zona rural. Para esto ha adquirido un panel solar que debe de pagar lo mas pronto posible. Muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita salir de esta deuda y tener la certeza de que no debe este bien y así comenzar a usarlo sin ningun problema para beneficio directo de él , sus hijos y su querida esposa.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
For more than 10 years, Vicente has earned a living from farming in the "comunidad" of Achuapa, the place where he was raised near the Nicaraguan city of Leon. He's a married men with four children who study at a small school that they have to walk very far to reach.

The problem that Vicente faces is that there's no electricity in his neighborhood because it's a rural area with few basic services. He's looking for a way to solve the problem and he's applying to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him [to withdraw from this debt for a solar panel?] so that he can use the power from it for household chores and provide light for his children to study.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Vicente López por mas de 10 años se ha dedicado al negocio de agropecuario en la ciudad de León específicamente en la comunidad de Achuapa que es el lugar donde se ha criado desde pequeño. Es un caballero casado y con cuatro hijos estudiando en una pequilla escuela que a diario tienen que caminar una larga distancia para llegar a ella.

Una problemática atravesada por el señor Vicente es la ausencia de energía eléctrica en su localidad por ser una zona rural que no cuenta con estos servicios básicos. Por este motivo, el señor Vicente busca la manera de solucionar este problema y para ello acude a Ceprodel para que le brinde crédito que le permita salir de esta deuda y así aprovechar la energía tanto para los quehaceres del hogar como para que sus hijos estudien sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Pay for solar panel.

loans.name: Faviana

texts.es:
Señora Faviana H. T. Huerta belongs to the interim group "Las Rosas de Yungay" (The Roses of Yungay). Her business is located in the city of Yungay in the province of Yungay in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 300 nuevos soles, she has increased her merchandise and her income.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more fruits like oranges, apples, and bananas.

She is 31-years-old and lives with her two children. With the income that she has, she supports her children. She is very enthusiastic about belonging to an interim group of Manuela Ramos, and she will continue working to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Faviana H. T. Huerta pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, su negocio esta ubicado en la localidad de Yungay, provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su mercadería y sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas como: naranjas, manzanas, plátanos

Ella tiene 31 años, es conviviente con 2 hijos, con los ingresos que tiene apoya a sus hijos, ella esta muy entusiasmada de pertenecer a un grupo mientras tanto de Manuela Ramos y continuara trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio. .

loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruits so she can sell them

loans.name: Virginia Oralia

texts.es:
Mrs Virginia G. is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. She sells clothes at a stand in the City’s main market. She has been selling clothes for 13 years and now owns two market stands.

She is 41 years old; she is married and has 5 children that also help her with the business. Her husband has a car and helps her to transport the clothes from her home to the market.

She sells a great variety of clothes for children, men and women. Now she wants to use the loan to buy summer clothes.

Her objective is to keep on growing as a business woman and to create new sources of employment.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Virginia G., es una señora muy emprendedora y trabajadora, sobresaliendo con su familia en una venta de ropa, ubicado en un mercado de la ciudad capital; tiene 13 años de vender en su puesto, actualmente cuenta con 2 puestos iguales, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales le ayudan en los puestos que ella tiene.

Es de edad de 41 años, es casada, igual su esposo, le ayuda con un carro donde transporta la mercaderia, del mercado a su casa. Cuenta con ropa para vender, de niño, niña, mujer y hombre, en gran variedad, pero ella quiere aprovechar la época del verano para adquirir ropa.

Tiene su visión puesta en seguir creciendo como empresaria, y crear nuevas fuentes de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy summer-clothes for children, women and men

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia J. C. belongs to the communal bank Working Women of Campo Ferial. She sells breakfasts in the market of Yungay province (in Ancash department).

The previous loan she received was used as an investment in her business to improve her earnings.

Mrs.J. wants to purchase the food necessary to prepare enough breakfasts to make her business profitable. She is planning on returning the loan in four months.

Virginia is 36 years old, married with children and she works hard to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase food to prepare and sell

loans.name: Norma Elida's Group

texts.en:
Norma, Esther, and Teofila have been members of the community bank “Marcela” for about two years. In that time they have learned be responsible, punctual, and to save.

Norma is 41 years old. She is a single mom raising her three children. Norma runs a hostel. She has been running her business for fifteen years. Holy Week is next month and it is the biggest tourism event in the area. Norma plans to use her loan to make some repairs to her hostel in order to accommodate the tourists.

Esther is 28 years old. She lives with her partner and two young children. Teofila travels eight hours on poor roads twice per week to sell food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar in the jungle region. With loans from the community bank she has also been able to buy two motorcycle taxis, which she leases to people who drive them.

Teofila is 50 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of thirty and eight. Teofila is an artisan weaver who concentrates on blankets. She has been weaving for eight years and sells her products from her home.

Norma, Esther, and Teofila need loans of 200, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy decorations, new sheets, food staples, thread, yarn, and fabrics.

One of the most important aspects of the community banks is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Norma, Esther, and Teofila plan to use their savings to buy a home, a van, and a sewing machine for a daughter who is studying to be a tailor.

loans.use: Norma, Esther, and Teofila need loans of 200, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy decorations, new sheets, food staples, thread, yarn, and fabrics.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
In January 1996 Angelina started selling cosmetics, perfumes and household products. A friend invited her to a perfume testing at her home, and that’s what she started selling first. As the business prospered, in 2000 she incorporated cosmetics of renowned brands, as well as naturistic products. To date, she has been able to maintain the business, with lows and highs. The income has allowed her to pay for the education of her three children, who she wishes to eventually send to college.

Angelina wishes to buy more merchandise in order to offer new products to her clients. For this reason she is requesting a $850 loan, that she is willing to repay in five months. With your help Angelina and her family will make it.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

En enero de 1996, Angelina comenzó a vender cosméticos, perfumes y artículos para el hogar, gracias a una amiga que la invitó a su casa a una demostración de perfumes, y esto fue lo primero que empezó a vender. Como le empezó a ir bien, en el año 2000 incorporó también cosméticos de reconocidas marcas, además de productos naturistas. Hasta la fecha ha mantenido este negocio con altas y bajas. Sin embargo el dinero que gana le sirve para poder pagar los estudios de sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Angelina desea comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US$ 850 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. Con tu ayuda Angelina y su familia podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Cruzkaya's Group

texts.en:
Cruzkaya, Francisca, and Tarcila have been members of the community bank “Minka” for between two and four years. In that time they have learned to share, to work in solidarity with others, and to smile.

Cruzkaya is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children. One of her children is four and the other is four months. She sells products such as candy and maps from a hotel in Ayacucho.

Francisca is 64 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of 39 and 27. Francisca has a tailor shop that she has owned for 36 years. Francisca also has a store where she sells a little bit of everything from food to small toys and games. She opened her store four years ago when she joined the community bank.

Tarcila is 27 years old. She is single and raising her two children. Tarcila sells jewelry. She travels to Lima twice per month to buy products that she then sells in Ayacucho.
